review_text: Its a lovely park but in the other hands pas datang gak banyk yang bisa dilihat mungkin belum pada bloom bunga2nya , bersih banget si tapi. Pas piknik buat keluarga. Bagusnya harga terjangkau parkiran luas dan emang gwedee banget garden ini harus sewa golf cart atau shuttle kayaknya kalau mau explore mungkin akan sapat ecperience yang maksimal

Calm, cool and nice place to click photos. Dont miss the deer there !

A pretty, quiet, up in the mountain botanical garden. Many visit the place with friends and families, taking a walk or having a picnic on the grass. The entire area is very vast with several gardens dispered across the park.

Entry ticket is cheap with almost no queue. Big parking space. Inside there are rental bikes that you can rent per hour. The park is clean and no trash in sight.

가족 연인이 휴식을 즐기기에 좋은곳입니다.
근처 숙소라 들렀는데 부두굴 근처 여러 관광지를 같이 보거나 지나가는 경로에 있다면 방문하는것이 괜찮을 수 있지만 짧은 여행 일정에 이곳만 보려고 멀리서 방문하는것은 추천하지 않습니다.

Bali Botanical Garden is a breathtaking escape into nature. The lush greenery, fresh mountain air, and diverse plant collections make it a peaceful and refreshing experience. It’s perfect for a quiet walk, a picnic, or just soaking in the natural beauty. The views are stunning, and there’s something calming about being surrounded by such vibrant flora. A must-visit for nature lovers and anyone looking to unwind in Bali’s cooler highlands!

Изумительное место, огромная и ухоженная территория, из-за особенности расположения тут не жарко.
Сколько бы не было людей все как то разбредаются по территории и очень спокойно и тихо.
Вход на двоих нам обошёлся в 40 000 + парковка.
Peaceful and oxygen-rich - but I prefer the real jungly forests all around Bali

This park is wonderful, truly large and spacious, full of interesting species of plants, trees and animals, quiet, and tremendously beautiful. We've been here a couple of times as we live far south of Bali. Our 1.5-year-old puppy loves the park over the moon! It isn't a must-visit for everyone, as many tourists want to see this full-throttle essence of Bali, which this park is not. It is more about nature, peace, calmness, and sweet moments, such as sitting on the grass surrounded by gigantic trees and seeing mountains and a volcanic lake. But if you love parks, forests, views, picturesque spaces, cooler temperatures, fresh air, and long walks, this place is perfect for 2 hours or half a day. Amazing!
Absolutely gorgeous and worth the drive to visit this tropical garden

Sangat luas dan banyak spot foto dan bersantai. Udara sejuk. Namun pengelola buruk. Toilet sangat kurang terawat. Pelayan kurang ramah terutama di tempat penyewaan scooter/sepeda. Kalau lebih dikelola dengan baik dan fasilitas diperhatikan bakal jadi tempat wisata paling recomended di bali

Оценка 3 звезды включает в себя крайнее неудовлетворение качеством велосипедов - это тихий ужас. Стоимость 35к в час, при этом на велосипеде просто нереально подняться в гору, не работают переключатели скоростей, пришлось около часа таскать велосипед с собой. По-хорошему стоимость этой услуги (-35), то есть вам должны заплатить за то, что вы тащите за собой ржавый и древний байк, которому лет столько же, сколько этому парку. Пожалуйста, не позорьтесь и замените велопарк, текущие варианты нужно выкинуть или сдать в металлолом.

Сам по себе парк отличный и виды шикарные, особенно вид на озеро.

Самое красивое место что я видел на Бали советую приезжать в 8:00 пораньше и взять электрический байк в аренду внутри на час проехать весь парк на нем и потом ещё пройтись пешком часок байки стоят на 25 мая 2025 года 75к за час :)

Kebun raya sekarang ini merupakan trap bagi warga lokal yang mau sekedar berlibur dan piknik di sana. Segala barang bawaan anda akan di charge. Saat weekdays mobil tidak boleh masuk dan anda harus naik shuttle seharga 30 ribu per orang yang hanya mengantarkan anda ke satu destinasi dan menjemput anda kembali. Aturan yang paling lucu, jika anda membawa nasi bungkus/nasi kotak anda akan dikenakan charge 10 ribu per bungkus/kotak. Staff manager di sana bilang, kebun raya mencharge barang barang/fasilitas jasa yang mereka jual. Membawa Sepeda dan sepeda listrik pun sekarang di charge. Semua perusahaan memang berhak memiliki aturan masing masing. Tapi aturannya yg diterapkan kebun raya saat ini seperti memeras pengunjung dan hanya ingin keuntungan cepat. Destinasi wisata yang sudah lama sudah bukan untuk masyarakat Bali lagi sekarang.
Lebih baik hindari tempat ini. Aturannya memberatkan dan sungguh di luar nalar

Saran penting, mending sewa kendaraan deh, entah itu sepeda listrik, sepeda biasa, atau mobil kayak odong-odong yang bisa dipakek bareng-bareng itu. Kalo maksa jalan kaki, siap-siap capek maksimal dan cuma bisa njangkau beberapa spot doang. Karena kebun raya ini lokasinya luaaaaasss banget, ya.

Tiket masuk 51 rb buat 2 orang dewasa dan 1 anak-anak usia 3 tahun. Spot ada buanyak, mulai patung keren-keren tuh, trus ada rumah kaca botani, danau, dsb. Atau kalo males keliling, bisa rebahan di rerumputan hijau di bawah pohon-pohon. Luas banget, seluas lapangan golf deh kayaknya. Kalo mau jajan, ada warung-warung pedagang di area parkir.

Didn’t expect the garden to be this big! In the entrance, you can rent bicycles, motors & even a golf cart. The bicycles were rusty and not usable so we opted for the golf cart which made the experience fun (250k/h). I strongly advise you to rent some form of transportation if you don’t want to walk for 3h doing the whole tour.

When we went most of the flowers were not blooming so that was slightly disappointing. The big Ficus tree is impressive.

I was surprised that Bali Botanical Garden isn’t crowded at all. This place is magical, with hills overlooking Beratan Lake and mountains across. If I were you, I would pack my picnic baskets, grab my family, head to Bali Botanical Garden’s fields and create memories that will last. Plus, entry fee is cheap

Spent 1.5hrs here and rented an electric scooter for 75,000idr per hour.

Highly recommend renting a bike or scooter as the botanical garden is quite large and I would estimate at least 6 hours walking to cover it all, if not more.

The highlight of these gardens was riding from point to point. The trees and greenery were so vast and gorgeous. However that's really about it. I didn't find much in the way of flowers and any real variety aside from the amazing trees alongside the road.

There were more than a couple dilapidated buildings that collapsed due to lack of maintenance in what looked like promosing little museums.

After seeing the botanical gardens in a few countries around the world, this one in Bali is very underwhelming in comparison. Set your expectations for a 3rd-world equivalent experience and you'll be fine.

Cruising through on an E-scooter is my  recommendation. It was still enjoyable and worthy of a visit.
Incredible! And very secluded on a Tuesday.
A must in Bedugul. Wonderfull place. Can go walking maybe 5 to 7km, bicycle or in their transport.

Area is huge with some nice view spots but aside from a whole lot of open fields and grass, it's really not well maintained.

One of the bikes we rented had faulty brakes, which we only found out later on going down a slope and could have been seriously injured.

Saran saya untuk soundsystem mohon untuk dilarang atau diatur regulasinya. Contohnya boleh untuk menghantarkan acara saja/MC, jangan menghidupkan lagu kencang2 apalagi karaoke. Kita ke kebun raya untuk healing malah dikasi polusi suara.
Untuk event mungkin bisa ditempatkan khusus, apalagi orang2 yg tidak izin buat event tapi datengnya sampai 100 orang rombongan. Saya dan beberapa keluarga lain di usir saat mau piknik. Padahal haknya sama bayarnya sama, malah kami yg duluan sampai. Rombonganya belum datang tapi sudah ada satu dua orangnya yg tag tempat.
Dateng mau healing malah stress ini.
Atau boleh tiketnya di mahalin lagi, biar pengunjung yg dateng terfilter, ga banyak yg kampungan gini. Ga punya sopan santun dan empati. Kayak di rumah sendiri aja bukan di tempat wisata.
Udaranya sejuk banget, cocok buat yang butuh ketenangan. Bisa di antar jemput juga sampai ke atas pake shuttle bus.

I had visited many Botanical Gardens all over. This is absolutely not properly maintained. Be mindful this place is huge and considering there are not many toilets around, making it worst some are "closed". Plan your toilet-break properly.
Rose and Orchid gardens were really pathetic, no effort put in at all to sure plants are healthy and blooming with flowers. Catus garden features a varieties of spices, not too bad.
It was a disappointment and let down for me.
Seriously not worth visiting unless you have extra time to kill

Bali Botanical Garden, also known as Kebun Raya Bali, is the largest botanical garden in Indonesia and a popular natural attraction in Bali. It is located in Bedugul, Tabanan Regency, at an altitude of about 1,250–1,450 meters above sea level, making it cooler than the coastal areas of Bali.

Kebun Raya Bali adalah kebun botani terbesar di Indonesia yang terletak di Bedugul, Bali. Kebun raya ini juga dikenal dengan nama Kebun Raya Eka Karya Bali atau Kebun Raya Bedugul.

Sejarah

Kebun Raya Bali didirikan pada 15 Juli 1959

Kebun raya ini merupakan kebun raya pertama yang didirikan oleh putra bangsa Indonesia

Kebun raya ini dikelola oleh Lembaga Ilmu Pengetahuan Indonesia (LIPI)

Lokasi

Kebun Raya Bali berada di Desa Candikuning, Kecamatan Baturiti, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali

Kebun raya ini berjarak sekitar 60 km dari Denpasar

Kebun raya ini berada di ketinggian 1.250–1.450 m dpl

Fungsi

Kebun raya ini berfungsi sebagai paru-paru udara

Kebun raya ini menjadi tempat penelitian botani, pelestarian tumbuhan, konservasi, pendidikan, dan rekreasi

Kebun raya ini menjadi salah satu destinasi wisata favorit di Bali

I recently visited the Bali Botanical Garden and was truly amazed by its natural beauty. It's a perfect escape for nature lovers and those seeking tranquility.

Here are a few tips to enhance your visit:

Early Bird Gets the Worm: Arrive early to avoid crowds and experience the serene morning atmosphere. The garden typically opens around 8 AM and closes at 5 PM.
Comfortable Footwear: Wear comfortable walking shoes as the garden is quite expansive.
Hydrate and Protect: Bring plenty of water and wear sunscreen to stay comfortable.
Capture the Beauty: Don't forget your camera to capture the stunning flora and fauna.
Respect the Environment: Admire the beauty without disturbing the ecosystem.
By following these tips, you can make the most of your visit to the Bali Botanical Garden.

Saat berkunjung jelang akhir tahun tgl 30 disampaikan oleh petugas tiket ada bazar di tengah sehingga tidak bisa bawa mobil masuk. Dianjurkan parkir di sana atau diparkiran depan. Karena saya sering berkunjung ke sini, saya lihat jalur kiri dan kanan tidak ditutup. Artinya bisa masuk, asal tidak lewat tengah. Namun saat kami sudah di atas, di bagian yang menghadap view danau beratan, seorang satpam berpakaian putih dan hitam, menghampiri. Yang berpakaian putih keras dan kasar memarahi. Katanya kami masuk tanpa ijin dan informasi bawa mobil. Loh? Saat beli tiket jelas jelas bawa mobil. Lalu, disampaikan bazar ditengah kebun raya, bukan di sisi kiri atau kanan. Ketika saya tanya aturan mana yang saya langgar? Petugas tersebut tidak bisa menjawab. Saya merasa kecewa dengan cara para petugas yang tidak profesional. Terlebih ketika dipaksa keluar, kami melihat, ada buggy dan mobil terbuka plat B keliling dan wajjb bayar sewa..artinya, ini memang dikomersiilkan. Sekali lagi, kalau buat aturan, pasang besar2 di depan: :dilarang bawa mobil berkeliling". Tanda tangan petugas penanggung jawab. Dan setiap jalur pasang plank sekalian, "mobil pribadi" tidak boleh lewat. Satu lagi, petugas jangan kasar, apalagi sok melotot segala.  Bicaralah yang baik dan beri petunjuk yang dibutuhkan.

we came on a rainy season and the rain start just 5 mins after we arrive. entrance ticket IDR 25.5K (local) and bike parking is IDR 10K (which is surprising). inside you can barely explore without renting any vehicle. (on weekend you can take your car inside but no bike) they rent elecrtic bike which is 75K per 30 mins WOW and even so they told us it cannot be used for 2 people WOW. so we ended up bought 2 way shuttle bus ticket for 20K per person. they take you to one spot and you can call them to pick you to another spot so 20K was just for 2 ride. we decided to just go to lake view point.
However, as I said it was raining so we were just waiting for the rain to stop for 2 hours. after that we wore raincoat and tried to explore a bit. the place was huge with a lot of fresh air and greenery however the flowers and other plants seems to be not well maintained as you can see from the picture attached. so would I recommend this place? not really

Der botanische Garten ist vielmehr ein Park,  für den man Eintritt zahlen muss. Er machte auf uns einen vernachlässigten Eindruck. Die Beete sind nicht gepflegt und Müll liegt herum. Es blüht nur wenig, sodass man nicht in den Genuss kommt die verschiedenen Pflanzen zu vergleichen.

This was a truly great experience! Very easy to get in and only 15k IDR per person which is ~$1 USD. You can walk around the whole place and see a lake view, orchid garden, cactus glass house, big tree, and rose garden. There are so many trees and plants to look at and take pictures of. Would recommend to go when things are bloomed, but a good experience no matter what. It’s a big walk so would also recommend bike if you do not want to trek. Overall, a beautiful place and the grounds are well looked after. Not crowded at all and easy to see everything without a million people there. Definitely a hidden gem in Bali and the cheapest experience we had. Also skip the famous gate and go to this one. Looks the same and no wait
Good vibes, want to spend all day here with my husband(if not raining)

Datang weekend kalau mau bawa roda 4 masuk, jeleknya kalau weekend banyak perkumpulan yg datang bawa sound besar2 jd hilang suasana hening dan nyamannya, working day harus naik shutle, kalau bawa sepeda sendiri bayar seperti sewa sepeda di dalam bahkan sepeda anak2 kecuali R3, anak usia diatas 4th bayar, harga makan dan minum di dalam mahal, jadi klo bawa kendaraan sendiri, sekalian bawa tenda, alat masak sekaligus bahan makanan yg cukup buat seharian bisa mampir dulu indomart di patung jagung atau kalau mau bantu UKM bisa belanja di minimart setelah patung jagung kiri jalan, atau beli makanan jadi di arah ke kiri jalan setelah patung jagung sebelum masuk kawasan taman, tidak ada wahana permainan, toilet gratis.

Tempat edukasi dan rekreasi yang sangat menyenangkan dan terawat. Luas sekali dengan banyak koleksi tanaman. Suasana di setiap bagian bisa beda-beda gitu; di area giant tree berasa chill dan magical, di taman bambu lebih terbuka , rumah kaktus dan taman begonia rapi tertata. Total keliling 3 jam jalan kaki santai. Puas banget.

Kurangnya: petugas kurang proaktif, tidak nawarin peta jadi harus inisiatif minta. Penunjuk arah kurang banyak.

Actually this is second time i come there, and yesterday I tried to explore by walking around 10,000 steps, wowwww really tiring but fun, some facilities are still under repair, my suggestion for the staff is to go around often just to check on visitors and offer to take a shuttle (with the note to pay after arriving at the destination)

Bedugul is a spectacular scenic area with mountains and lakes, with the Bali Botanical Gardens located adjacent to the huge Bedugul Lake.
Being a solo traveller with my own driver, I had the opportunity to spend unlimited time at this magnificent tourist attraction.
This pleased me as I absolutely love gardens and was able to wander around at leisure admiring and photographing the repetitive plantings of perrenials and annuals enhanced by mature trees and meticulously maintained lawns. I couldn't help feeling relieved that I wasn't one of the hundreds of tourists pouring off buses adhering to a structured itinerary.
The Bali Botanical Gardens at Bedugal is not only a 'must visit' for garden and plant lovers but also for those who wish to experience a more authentic Bali in Bedugal and its villages.
Pelayanan Ramah

Parc abandonné, la seule choses entretenue est le gazon, pour les 32 autre choses à « voir », elles sont complètement laissé à l’abandon, ne vaut pas le détour.
Le parc est immense mais toutes les structures sont abandonnées (32 au total), rien n’est entretenu. Passez votre chemin !!!

Bali Botanical Garden is fantastic! It's cool, clean, and has fresh air. The place is huge with beautiful views of Beratan Lake. You can rent scooters, bicycles, or buggy cars to explore. Great spot for pre-wedding photoshoots (IDR 500,000) and drone flying (extra IDR 200,000). Highly recommend!

I really enjoyed this park! It’s huge and you can feel the high altitude energy  it’s definitely colder so grab a jacket! You can just chill in the amazing vast meadows, go for a walk in the forest or sit at the lake view. Parking 10k, entry 25k weekends and 15k weekdays. I definitely recommend this place  you can easily spend 3 hours here

Agree with a review that said this is not a botanical garden but rather a very large park. Well, there are some botanical garden components, but most of them are not well-maintained except for the cactus house.

If you need a place to chill with family and friends, there are large open areas. People usually “camp”, having some bbqs, or have a picnic there.

You can rent a bike or an e-bike to get around the areas but prepare to get some exercise cause it’s hilly.

Entrance fee is different during weekdays and the holidays.

Do yourself a favour. On the way to Lovina or on the way to Denpasar through the centre of Bali stay over night in Pancasari or Candikuning (We recommend Stawberry Hill Hotel) & spend a few hours here at Kebun Raya . An oasis in the middle of Bali. Grassed lawns, amazing plants & trees & views with some pretty amazing statues. Even see a wedding or 2 or dancing groups. Its about 6000 steps to traverse this Botanical garden wonder up hill & down dale but absolutely worth it. Good for the soul & the body. If disabled there are electric bikes & electric carts available. Inc parking 2 people only 51,000 idr great value. What was amazing was RUBBISH FREE. Well nearly. We picked up some discarded plastic items dropped by uncaring types on dear Mother Earth. I ask myself why spoil this wonder & our beautiful stunning Bali of course?
fun place to playing with friends, cool vibes.

Don’t understand why this place has such a good rating. The park is very poorly maintained, outdated and absolutely doesn’t feel like a botanical garden. It looks more like a random park with not much stuff to do. If you are expecting a cool botanical garden; trust me, you’re gonna feel depressed leaving the park. Especially after paying a visit to one of the dirtiest toilets at the entrance/exit of the park, infested with cockroaches. Do yourself a favor and don’t go here.

Overall the gardens are quite beautiful, but a couple of things detracted from the experience…

Firstly, some of the paths are very poorly maintained (almost to the point of being unusable).

Secondly, there were large groups of people with loudspeakers blaring music/karaoke/speeches. It was impossible to escape this noise - even in the upper reaches of the park it could still be heard in the distance. I have no idea why this is allowed in what’s otherwise a very peaceful environment. I’d recommend not going on the weekend because of this.

Kebun Raya Bali memukau dengan keindahan alamnya yang asri dan luas, menawarkan beragam spesies tumbuhan yang memikat. Tempat ini merupakan surga bagi pecinta alam dan pengunjung yang ingin mengeksplorasi keanekaragaman flora Bali. Area parkir yang luas memudahkan akses, menjadikan kunjungan lebih nyaman. Selain itu, kebun ini juga menawarkan fasilitas yang baik bagi pengunjung, seperti jalur berjalan yang tertata rapi dan tempat istirahat yang nyaman. Secara keseluruhan, Kebun Raya Bali adalah destinasi yang sempurna untuk bersantai sambil menikmati keindahan alam dan belajar tentang keanekaragaman hayati pulau Bali.

Bali Botanic Garden is Indonesia's largest Botanic Garden (157 hectares). Nestled in the cool mountainous region of Bedugul in central Bali (1300 metres above sea level), the Garden is an easy day trip, around 90 minutes' drive from Denpasar The sprawling garden is a mix of green open space, unique plant collections and tropical mountain forest set against the misty, green slopes of Tapak Hill. Discover Bali's biggest display of wild orchids, the largest begonia collection in the world, a magical rainforest trail, enchanting fern garden and dinosaur shadehouse, carnivorous plants, bamboo collection and much more. Bali Botanical Garden was first established on 15 July 1959 by Sukarno, the first President of Indonesia. The garden was previously known as Eka Karya Botanical Garden, where "Eka" means first while "Karya" means creation in the Balinese language, as the first Indonesian botanical garden established after independence. Refers to the condition of the garden. Three Hindu temples are also accessed from within the Garden.
The botanical garden or botanic garden is a garden dedicated to the collection, cultivation, preservation and display of an especially wide range of plants, which are typically labelled with their botanical names.

Ботанический сад Бали (Bali botanic garden)

На южном берегу озера Братан расположился ботанический парк острова. История сада началась в 1958 году. Сегодня это филиал Национального Ботанического Сада, основанного Индонезийским научным институтом и расположенного на острове Ява.
Кроме деревьев и растений в парке сотрудниками поддерживается естественная экосистема. На территории сада проживает множество птиц и животных, с которыми любопытные посетители также могут встретиться. Но не волнуйтесь, все звери и птицы вполне безобидны, а некоторые очень даже общительны.
Приезжать в ботанический сад лучше на весь день. Даже в самый жаркий полдень здесь можно укрыться в тени деревьев и есть чем заняться не только взрослым, но и детям. Местные жители очень любят приходить сюда по выходным и праздникам.
В парке есть гостиница. Если вам захотелось задержаться здесь подольше, можно переночевать. Также на территории сада работает кафе. Любители острых ощущений могут полетать над кронами деревьев на специально натянутых канатах.
Добраться до ботанического сада Бали можно на туристическом автобусе в составе экскурсии

A wonderful, big park – like nothing we've seen in Bali before. Entrance and parking is cheap and you can easily spend a whole afternoon in the park. Lots of locals seem to come here to hang out with their families and enjoy picnics across the entire park. There is a restaurant, a cactus garden, and a massive old tree that's worth visiting. They rent push bikes and small electric scooters to whiz around the park and look at the different attractions. Worth a visit.

Terakhir ke kebun raya Bedugul kls 4 SD dan sekarang sudah tamat kuliah iseng Jelan jalan kesana ternyata tempatnya masih sama. Sama sama nyaman dan tentram banyak fasilitas baru juga jadi lebih baik dari dulu. Minusnya makanan yang lumayan mahal seperti popmie yang harganya 20k.

Yesterday, me and my buddies decided to check out a spot that was recommended by my friend in our WhatsApp group chat. And let me tell you, when we got there, we were amazed! The place was absolutely stunning, and it was enormous! People were driving with their cars and rental scooters, exploring every corner.

Speaking of explore, Of course, we wanted to explore too, but there was one problem. we were exhausted! We had to WALK everywhere, and my feet were killing me, especially since I forgot to wear socks. Note to self: always wear socks if you come here with shoes.
Even though we got a little lost, we finally reached the exit gate.

Actually I took lots of photos. But, I decided to just attach the good ones

dulu waktu jaman sd sering kesini karena agenda tamasya sekolah, lalu kemarin saya mampir kesini lagi. untuk dulu saya kurang tau harga tiketnya berapa karena rombongan sekolah, kalo kemarin itu harga tiketnya untuk 2 orang 51 ribu (hari libur nasional/weekend) dan bayar parkirnya itu 10 ribu/motor, jujur menurut saya untuk biaya parkir motor tergolong mahal, dan untuk biaya tiket masuk masih bisa diterima karena jarang kesini juga. lalu setelah saya masuk suasananya tidak berubah dari dulu tetap sejuk dan nyaman mungkin sekarang sangat ramai dibandingkan jaman sd dulu. kemarin saya jalan jalan di sekitar lapangan bola dan duduk di sekitar lapangan bola. next time saya mau coba keliling keliling lebih jauh lagi, untuk kebersihan perlu dijaga oleh pengunjung karena kemarin saya lihat sampah berserakan bekas dari pengunjung. dan saran saya untuk toilet jumlahnya perlu ditambah karena saya pengunjung ramai bisa antre lama hanya untuk ke toilet. sekian terima kasih

Saya orang asli Bali, hari ini iseng main kesini bersama 3 orang teman saya sekalian sewa skuter listrik. Tiket masuk mobil 20K , tiket per orang 15.500 rupiah ( hari kerja ) , sewa sekuter listrik 50K per 30 menit ( kondisi menurut saya jelek ). Saat dilokasi kami menikmati udara dan waktu yang hanya 30 menit saya dan teman saya mengabadikan moment. Saya juga dari awal tempat reception sewa skuter sudah memperlihatkan drone saya, dan saya menerbangkan drone untuk dokumentasi kami bersama. Selang usai menerbangkan drone tiba2 2 petugas wanita datang menghampiri dan berkata jika menerbangkan drone disini bayar 500K jika tidak harus hapus seluruh data fto dan video. Tentu saja ini sangat tidak fair, dari awal kami datang tidak ada himbau jika menerbangkan drone bayar 500K, sedangkan sedari awal saya sudah memperlihatkan drone saya sblum ambil skuter itu saya udah set up drone saya. Saya tanya 2 orang petugas wanita tersebut berkata kalau keterangan menerbangkan drone bayar 500K ada di depan saat beli tiket, pas saya ke depan tempat loket saya berbicara dengan petugas bilang untuk preweeding bayar dan photoshoot. Tapi saya kan sedang bukan preweding atau photoshoot, kami sedang mendokumentasikan fto dan video dokumentasi kami bersama. Dan kami bilang kok tidak di himbau kepada kami terkait peraturan ini ? Lalu mereka mengarahkan kami untuk balik bertanya ke petugas dalam. Sungguh sangat mengecewakan hal seperti ini.

Kalau sedari awal saya tahu, saya TIDAK AKAN BERKUNJUNG KE TEMPAT SPERTI INI. Tempat yang menurut saya gak cuma ada di bali. Masih banyak tempat bagus lainnya dibali dan jelas himbauannya.

Sudah bayar, tiket parkir , masuk, sewa skuter pengalaman yang didapat tidak sepadan dengan biaya yang dikeluarkan. Kami rugi waktu dan materi untuk sebuag tempat wisata yang berkesan SUPER TRAP !!!

Buat para pengunjung yang senang atau hobi pakai drone, mending gak usah kesini. !!!!

Jeg do mai semeton , tongos bebangkaan nee !!!

Sangat mengecewakan ,
Sewa scooter listrik 50rb / jam pelayanan kurang ramah ,ditengah saat buat vidio dan fto fto ada oknum yg nyamperin dibilang tidak boleh bawa drone ,tapi diawal baru masuk di tiket masuk tidak ada penjelasan,dan saat sewa scooter juga tidak ada himbauan ,sedangkan oknum datang langsung setlah lebih dari 20menit diinfo tidak diperbolehkan,boleh disimpan hasilnya tapi dimintai bayar 500rb ,trus ta tanya itu katanya sudah ada peraturan yg tertera di tiket masuk,padahal sma sekali tidak ada himbauan klau tidak boleh pakai drone,ya namanya aja liburan pasti kita sudah terplaning untuk menikmati suasana biarpun ada pertauran ya setidaknya diinfo dari awal apa yg tidak boleh,anehnya disini sy kembali melihat yg katanya peraturan tidak boleh pakai drone dan boleh di simpan vidionya tapi bayar 500rb,setelah ta cek peraturan yg tertera itu untuk penggunaan drone jika ptoshot atau take vidio weeding,tidak ada tertera jelas boleh disimpan vidionya biarpun itu cuma vidio biasa tapi bayar 500rb.,tolong ya dibenahi sy yg merasa ingin liburan seketika menjadi badmood dan sudah sangat emosi campur kecewa sama orang lokl saja begini.,initinya disini yg saya kecewakan tidak ada himbauan langsung untuk peraturan yg mana mestinya untuk dipahami dlu sebelum masuk,dan tidak ada peraturan tertulis perihal penagihan uang 500rb untuk hanya sekedar membuat vidio dokumentasi ,bukan untuk proshot ataupun frewed…

The tranquility and serenity of this place is palpable.
A massive park, it would be better named “Bali Botanical Forest”!
There are many different areas.
I walked through the park with my wife, we did not manage to see everything and it still took around 3 hours.
It is possible to explore the park by walking, riding bicycle, e-scooter or by car. In my opinion walking is the best for a full immersion.
If you wish, i think it is possible to camp for a fee of 100k IDR. I do not know if this is a group or per person price.
The park has an entry fee, we paid 75k IDR which is actually about $3.50 each AUD.
In my opinion, this Botanical Garden is a “must see” when staying in Munduk. My wife was astounded and enthralled.

Beworben als der größte und eindrucksvollste botanische Garten Indonesiens erwartet man erstmal viel. Die Lage ist jedenfalls super: am Fuße des Gunung Batukaru, zwischen See und Berge auf ca. 1300 m Höhe in Bali. Die Luft ist kühl und das Wetter wechselhaft, was es angenehm macht im Vergleich zur Hitze an der Küste.

Zum botanischen Garten: Große Teile sind einfach nur ein Parkwald mit Rasen. Das ist erst mal relativ uninteressant, viele Menschen schätzen das aber zum Picknicken und entspannen in kühler, schattiger Atmosphäre. Auffällig sind breite Straßen. Eine der Straßen durchzieht den ganzen Park in seinen verschiedenen Bereichen, wodurch er für Roller oder Autos bzw. Busse auch für mobilitätseingeschränkte oder faule Menschen gut erschlossen werden kann. Die Straße wirkt aber auch befremdlich und der begleitende Fußweg existiert nicht überall, was unfreundlich für Wanderer wirkt.

Der Garten hat verschiedene Bereiche. Gepflegt wird kaum, nur auf Rasenmähern wird der Rasen gekürzt. Es scheint kein Pflegekonzept zu geben. Die verschiedenen Bereiche wie Orchideengarten, Farngarten oder Kaktusgarten sind ebenfalls nur schlecht in Schuss und stark in die Jahre gekommen.
Grade das ist aber in manchen Bereichen das, was den Garten ausmacht. Beispielsätze der Farngarten (Lykophytengarten) ist einer der schönsten, die ich je sah. Offensichtlich seit Jahrzehnten sich selbst überlassen hat sich dort ein wunderschöner Wald aus Baumfarnen, alten auf Bali heimischen Bäumen und epiphytisch wachsenden Farnen sowie Orchideen und weiteren Sporophyten gebildet. Den geschwungenen Pfad zu durchgehen ist wie in eine längst vergangene Welt einzutauchen. Man hört nur die Vögel und den Wind, es ist kühl und schattig und feucht. Wunderschöne Farne Säumen den Weg.
Weiter oben im Wald findet man das wahrscheinlich schönste Exemplar von Ficus heteropleura das es gibt. Ich wusste nicht, dass Bäume derart eigenartig wachsen können, und dabei so riesig und groß werden! Auch der Orchideengarten hat einige Spezies (über 280) zu bieten.
Auch der Bambusgarten, solch riesige Baumbus Exemplare hab ich noch nirgends gesehen. Man fühlt sich wie eine Ameise.

Der Garten lässt sich auch per Scooter oder Bus erkunden, dabei auf jeden Fall längere Stops an den Hauptattraktionen machen. Ich sah mehrere Busse einfach vorbeifahren, man muss sich schon etwas Zeit lassen und in die Landschaft eintauchen.

Ich würde sagen große Teile des Gartens sind leider unattraktiv und es fehlt an jeglicher Kreativität (meist einfach Rasen+Gehölze).

Zusammenfassend lohnen sich aber die toll gealterten Bereiche.

Für die Zukunft sollte der Garten unbedingt weiterentwickelt werden. Wie es funktioniert kann an den Bereichen abgeschaut werden, die noch gut funktionieren. Dann wird der Garten auch mehr Besuchende anlocken.

Kebun Raya Bali di Bedugul, salah satu tempat wisata alam yang banyak pemandangan indah dan spot2 foto yang bagus, salah satunya taman dengan latar belakang pemandangan danau.  Tiiket masuk sangat terjangkau dengan harga sekitar Rp. 15.000,- per orang. Kalau ingin memakai jasa antar jemput via shuttle kendaraan. Harganya Rp. 30.000,-. Sangat disayangkan shuttle kendaraan hanya mengantarkan ke 1 titik antar jemput. Jadi tidak mungkin kita bisa menjelajahi semua lokasi dengan berjalan kaki dikarenakan tempatnya sangat luas. Seandainya kendaraan pribadi boleh masuk, kita bisa menjelajahi semua tempat dengan mudah. Sayangnya mbl hanya boleh masuk sampai lapangan parkir.

Sangat nyaman

Sorry if there is any reason for the system at the moment....but I want to say this because I have so much love for this place. The visitors cannot enter all areas with their vehicles except bicycles. You need to pay parking & entrance fee separately, plus pay another extra fee for various vehicles to go around, which is expensive. The system of pay-for-each is good, so that people who just sit and picnik can pay only a little.

However, please make shuttle bus reachable for anyone inside the garden and tour each spots so that we can enjoy & appreciate the beautiful garden more. if you're worried about staff costs or thefts, you can set a vending machine that sells ticket to ride the bus. This way only the driver is needed, and the guest who wants to learn more about tropical plants do not have to go back to the entrance to rent smaller vehicles (which actually cannot go around all spots). And the price to ride shuttle one time can be much cheaper, repetitive, and effective.
You can also set CCTV cameras to watch people who scatter rubbish anywhere, then ask for fine when they leave.

Please please consider because I hope to visit the garden again and teach my kid how beautiful tropical nature in Bali is. The place has so much worth.

Beautiful botanical garden in Bali. Very recommended!

Lovely huge garden, the total area 150 hectar. The place it's a refreshing atmosphere with fresh air everywhere.
My favorite part it's the cactus Glass house and the Giant Ficus Tree.
My suggestion if you came here for the first time and have limited time, you need to go to the 5 most favorites area by renting small car, it's only IDR 50.000 per person and if you have plenty of time, rent a bike or motorcycle with battery.
Don't even try to walk unless you are like to do  running for sport.
If you like photos ,  there's a lot of spots to take photos.  The place also good to hang around /picnic with family and friends.

If you come on weekdays :

1. Your vehicle cannot enter the botanical garden area,
2. They provide a shuttle bus, at a cost of IDR 30 K / pax, and your shuttle bus is only valid for 1 destination,
3. There is an additional parking fee of IDR 15 K for your car,

The above costs do not include your entrance fee.

Het is een mooi wijdt park en biedt leuke exhibitions. Alleen toen wij er waren was het begonia huis dicht. Dat was erg jammer. Naast een cactus kas, orchideëen exhibition en de grote 200jaar oude boom is het park snel te bezoeken binnen 2 uur tijd. In het weekend mogen er auto's doorheen rijden, alleen geen scooters.
Om jezelf te verplaatsen binnen het park kan je vervoer regelen. Scooter 30min, shuttlebus, golfkar 60min. De tijden die vastgesteld zijn vonden wij te krap. De plattegrond is niet gedetaileerd genoeg. En de shuttlebus is raar geregeld i.p.v. hop on hop off plaatsen, is het nu alleen droppen. Dan zou je moeten whatsappen om voor 2x binnen 30min tijd weer je op te komen halen en weer te droppen. Lopend kan prima naar de cactus kas, orchidee(ligt er naast), rhododendron tuin en varen tuin. De grote boom zou je toch echt shuttlebus voor moeten gebruiken. Wij deden drop off bij de boom, lieten de chauffeur ff 5 min wachten en vervolgens bij de cactus ons verder af te zetten, de rest was beloopbaar.
Het restaurant was goed en betaalbaar.

Это место определенно входит в топ моих самых любимых мест на Бали!
Территория парка достаточно большая, здесь спокойно можно гулять весь день, особенно если вы любите лес и природу. Много красивых и интересных локаций, местами вообще сложно было поверить глазам - словно картинка из пинтереста. Вы встретите красивые дорожки, идеальные зеленые лужайки, "дикий" лес, теплицу с кактусами и местечко, где растения только начинают свою жизнь в виде множества росточков, развешенных на досточках в теплицах. Там же есть небольшая аллея с фонтаном, находясь там, я ощущала себя в теплицах Хогвартса, где-то около башни Слизерина.
Мы гуляли там часа 4 и этого оказалось жутко мало. Особая прелесть этого места, что людей не так много и если отойти чуть в глубь, то можно насладиться тишиной и прохладой леса.
Cocok buat kumpul bersama keluarga.

Красивый и ухоженный ботанический сад с огромной территорией, по которой можно гулять хоть целый день или взять в аренду любой транспорт на свой вкус и объехать по быстрому. Тут есть и цветочные сады и бамбуковый лес и вид на озеро и кактусовый сад и настоящие джунгли и густой лес. Вход стоит всего 20к в будни, в парке прохладно, очень мало людей, прекрасно оборудованы пешие тропинки, и по всему этому я сильно соскучилась за месяц на Бали. Я получила истинное удовольствие от этого сада, насладилась природой и тишиной и всем его советую

Люблю этот парк. Он сочетает в себе разные ландшафты: лес, бамбуковые рощи, парк с высаженными цветами, широкие и холмистые газоны, вид на озеро. Территория большая - можно прямо вдоволь нагуляться и провести много времени здесь.

Я люблю взять с собой еду (можно купить в блидайшем indomaret - там большой выбор, есть кофейня, нсрезанные фрукты и кулирария) и устроить пикник в этом парке. Большинство посетителей парка имеют такой же план. В самом парке есть популярная зона для пикников, там тоже продается еда.

Здечь можно сделать красивые фотографи, местрые отмечают здесь праздники

В парк разрешен вьезд только на машинах, можно арендовать велрсипед
Great

It's an amazing place to be. Especially if you get lucky and go there on a cloudy day, you will love it. Its a big area to discover so it may take a while to view everything there. I went on weekend and wasn't crowded at all.

I didn't expect to find such a big and beautiful botanic garden in Bali. If you're visiting, make sure you've got a few hours to fully explore. There are options to rent bikes, golf carts, or e-scooters which is convenient. Plus, you can swap your entrance ticket for a bottle of water.

It would be great if there was a shuttle bus, might be more efficient than renting vehicles. Taking off stars because the toilet needs attention. It smells so bad. Otherwise, it is a wonderful experience.

Suasana yang sangat sejuk, sangat cocok untuk keluarga rekreasi, piknik dan kegiatan outdoor lainnya. Rumput hijau yang menyejukan mata, pohon rindang dan tempatnya yang sangat alami dan bersih. Dengan harga tiket yang sangat ramah dikantong,kebun raya ini cocok untuk yang mencari daerah pegunungan.

The garden is nice and very big which makes it a bit difficult to do everything by foot. We finally rented a golf car which I found was too expensive (200‘000 IDR for 1 hour). Unfortunately, some houses were under construction and renovation so the park is currently not in a perfect condition. The giant ficus tree was our highlight but to get there, you better rent a vehicle. As soon as the houses are fixed and the plants nice again, I would be willing to give more points. The trees were truly amazing.
Kebun raya terluas di bali, sejuk, sangat cocok untuk berkumpul bersama keluarga, teman, maupun big group. Silahkan berkunjung dan Terimakasih
Antrian nya sangat lama , khusu Untuk Mobil

Udah beda skrang ke tempat ini.. harusnya jika memang tidak ada pakai kendaraan pribadi ke areaa sana harusnya untuk sewa sepeda listriknya juga harus ngotak agar para pengunjung merasa puas menikmati suana yg adem aalami... menurut saya terlalu mahal sewanya apalagi dengan medan datar seperti itu harusnya speda listrik juga gx terlalu banyak perawatan sangat di sayangkan sebagai sorang wisatan lokal juga gx otak sih harga sewa sgtu kecuali untuk tamu ok lah.. miris sih liatnya.. jadi gx puas ke sana mesti jalan kaki jauh kali buat cari titik suport yg bagus

Tiket masuk dihitung per mobil plus per orang dalam mobil, tidak terlalu mahal.
Kebun Raya luas dengan beberapa objek yg menarik seperti Taman Kaktus. Nyaman berkeliling karena semua bisa dijangkau berkendara mobil. Beberapa patung menghiasi  Kebun Raya, beberapa pohon berderet teratur merupakan hutan. Banyak lapangan rumput terbuka luas untuk santai, makan bersama bekal yg dibawa, dan ada tempat yg bisa memandang ke Danau Beratan.
Namun banyak juga suara dari sound system yg dibawa pengunjung, sehingga mengurangi rasa Hening.
Kesadaran pengunjung untuk tidak buang sampah
perlu ditingkatkan, misalnya di gerbang masuk dihimbau atau ditulis tanda peringatan untuk Tidak Buang Sampah di sembarang tempat.
Secara umum Kebun Raya yg berlogo "BRIN" ini cukup menarik untuk dikunjungi.

Een mega groot park. Het is zeker aan te raden om een elektrisch vervoermiddel te huren. Wij hadden een elektrische fiets, maar op sommige plekken kwamen we zelfs daarmee de heuvels niet op.

Mooi bos met indrukwekkende bomen en bamboe. De orchideeën tuin viel tegen en was een beetje vergane glorie.

Schöner großer Park, mit verschiedenen Bäumen und Pflanzen, sehr weitläufig, wir sind bis zum großen Fikus hoch gelaufen, man kann sich Ber auch gegen Bezahlung mit einem Fahrzeug fahren lassen. Es waren viele Veranstaltungen von Einheimischen und viele Familien haben Picknick gemacht. Es gibt auch kleine Stände mit Getränken.
If you wonder why is the flower in the orchid garden is not blooming, you can ask the staff there, they would be very pleasant to give the explanation and show you some rare plant !!

Сам сад очень классный! Много мест для прогулок, много где можно посидеть отдохнуть. Но выглядит немного заброшенным, оранжерея с орхидеями была закрыта, немного зеленый фонтан) велосипеды конечно правда кошмарные))) тормоза очень плохие, шла много в итоге пешком, потому что в горку не заедешь на них (голубые с корзинами) а вниз тоже страшно, спуски крутые а например тормоз только 1 работал

The staff should update the ticket officer to provide the information to visitor about facilities that are running for the day.

Atleast, the visitor can plan the trip to the garden well. Instead, they offer expensive package to fill their pockets. Not worth it.

Untuk menuju Kebun Raya Bali dapat ditempuh melalui perjalanan darat selama satu setengah jam dari Denpasar, atau sekitar 55 km ke arah utara Denpasar menuju Singaraja. Jika dari Singaraja maka jarak yang ditempuh sekitar 30 km ke arah selatan menuju Denpasar atau menempuh waktu kira-kira 45 menit perjalanan darat.

Luas kawasan Kebun Raya semula hanya 50 ha, tetapi saat ini luas kebun raya menjadi 157,5 ha.

Pengelolaannya dilakukan oleh Lembaga Ilmu Pengetahuan Indonesia (LIPI) dan secara struktur organisasi berada di bawah pembinaan Pusat Konservasi Tumbuhan Kebun Raya Bogor.
Un sitio precioso, ofrecen diferentes tipos de transportes para pasear por el parque. Recomendado si se va a visitar el parque es hacer un picnic, se está de maravilla!

open park. small fee to enter. can walk around the entire complex. cool and calm, there are gardens, exhibitions, piconic areas, water gardens and plenty of other natural attractions. excellent for small or large groups. hikes just the right distance and difficulty for kids. clean and safe. highly recommended. worth a bit of a drive as well.

Kawasan ramah anak-anak, bisa sebagai wisata edukasi. Ada taman anggrek, taman kaktus, begonia, mawar, dll. Beautiful botanical garden, amazing scenery and lots of amazing specimens. Would not recommend the mountain bike as it keeps on breaking, would be better to just walk or as a family rent a cart. There are some parts of the garden that seem to be run down and closed, possibly because of the pandemic and lack of visitors to those areas based on other peoples previous experiences. Would want more signs with explanations and facts so people could learn more of the collections, instead of just hanging tags. Seems to be dog-friendly as well.

Wir hatten nicht viel Zeit und wollten unbedingt noch vorbei schauen. Haben uns dann einen Shuttle zum Orchideen & Kaktus Haus gegönnt. Dort angekommen waren wir wirklich enttäuscht. Lieblos, ungepflegt, keine einzige Blüte und kranke Pflanzen. Es war einfach alles heruntergekommen. Zurück sind wir dann zu Fuß gegangen und der Park ist nett und gepflegt, viele Familien pickniken dort oder spielen Ball. Dennoch befremdlich für einen Park Eintritt zu verlangen. Spart euch das Geld für einen kurzen Abstecher. Wer den ganzen Tag darin spazieren möchte wird sicher ein paar schöne Plätzchen finden.

Beautiful park with lots of trees among them a massive banyan. When we were there today the orchid garden and cactus garden (main reasons why we came here) were closed. We saw a guided group going in but when we tried to follow, we were stopped by the guide who said it was closed for maintenance. Bit weird with a group of 15 just having entered... All in all this seems more like a place for locals to relax and have picnics.

Worst botanical garden I've been to.

The place is really a park and it is being used as such mostly.

Difficult to walk around as it's hilly and poorly signposted. Cactus garden was shut.

No map or pamphlet issued for your entrance fee so it's difficult navigating.

You need to really scoot around or drive around to the various parts to get anywhere out of the experience.

However it was nice to enjoy the fresh air for a little while on our tour and the big tree is pretty spectacular.

Cara kelola nya sudah tidak sebagus 3-4 tahun lalu :
1. Terlalu banyak mobil masuk ke area kebun, jadi kesan naturalnya berkurang. ( dulu hanya boleh di area parkiran)
2. Jangan harap sewa scooter  bisa sebebas dulu atau yg kalian lihat di reels2 selebgram... Hanya berlaku 30 menit dan di pandu harganya 40k dan ANTRI waiting list.
3. Yang parah, ada sepeda elektronik mau sewa di bilang baterainya habis, tapi selang berapa lama ada beberapa pengunjung ada yg pakai.
4. Sewa sepeda semi electric, cukup perlu tenaga dan berat.

Gehen Sie lieber in den Wald und bleiben Sie fern von diesem Garten! Dieser „botanische Garten“ weckt nur Enttäuschung. Nachdem man den langen Weg auf den Hügel auf sich genommen hat, findet man anstatt vielen schönen Pflanzen nur dreck, ungepflegte und abgestorbene Blumen. Das einzige was es hier zu sehen gibt sind Bäume, doch dafür können sie auch in einen Wald gehen ohne etwas dafür zu zahlen.

Nice place to see if you like plants and trees.

Kebun Raya Bali Bedugul, Berhawa Dingin, Pohon pohon besar, Bukit dengan latar belakang Danau Bedugul juga ada monyet. Tersedia Shuttle Bus.

Kebun Raya yang sangat indah, bersih, dan sangat menyenangkan untuk dikunjungi.
Pemandangan disini sungguh spektakuler, udara segar bebas polusi, dan hamparan rumput hijau yang bersih bak permadani.
Setiap kali ke Bali saya selalu berkunjung ke kebun raya apabila sempat.
Sayangnya terakhir saya kesana mobil DILARANG berkeliling kebun raya di hari kerja yang sangat sangat merepotkan terutama karena jumlah golf car yang terbatas dan harga sewa yg lumayan MAHAL. Sedangkan sepeda listrik sering tidak kuat nanjak (belum lagi kalau gerimis).

An Average Experience with Room for Improvement

During my visit to the Bali Botanical Park, I had an average experience that left me with mixed feelings. While there were some aspects that stood out, there were also areas where improvements could be made.

One of the main issues I encountered was the lack of efficient exploration options within the park. Walking through the vast grounds proved to be quite challenging and time-consuming, especially if you have limited time or are not in the best physical shape. I would strongly recommend renting a bicycle or an electric scooter to cover more ground and make the most of your visit.

Navigating the park also proved to be a bit confusing, and I wasted a significant amount of time trying to find my way around. Although I obtained a map from the information center, it didn't provide clear directions, leading to unnecessary detours and frustration.

Despite these setbacks, I found the statues along the middle road extending from the main gate to be the most captivating aspect of the park. They added a touch of intrigue and cultural significance to the surroundings, making it a worthwhile experience. Additionally, the highlight of the park was undoubtedly the breathtaking Lakeview. I highly recommend making the effort to reach it, as the tranquil beauty of the lake is truly worth the journey.

Unfortunately, for enthusiasts of plants like myself, the park didn't offer much in terms of botanical wonders. The focus seemed to be more on the statues and the scenic views, rather than a diverse range of plant species. However, I do regret not spending more time exploring the nurseries located just before the park entrance, as I've heard they boast a stunning variety of plants.

Overall, my visit to the Bali Botanical Park left me with mixed feelings. While there were elements that stood out, such as the statues and the captivating Lakeview, improvements in terms of navigation and plant diversity could greatly enhance the overall experience. I would recommend this park to those seeking cultural experience, but for true plant enthusiasts, there might be better options available.

But they would keep cutting out and also would not take me uphill. Which is why I rented it. So very frustrating.

Bedugul, located in Bali, Indonesia, is a picturesque destination known for its natural beauty. With Lake Bratan and the iconic Ulun Danu Beratan Temple, the scenery is captivating. Indulge in delightful dining experiences at Lakeview Restaurant, offering stunning lake views, or try the fresh strawberry treats at Strawberry Stop. For authentic Balinese cuisine, visit Warung Dedari, or explore the lively Bedugul Market for local flavors and culinary treasures. Bedugul is a tranquil retreat that combines breathtaking landscapes with memorable dining experiences.

The garden is filled with a variety of colorful flowers and plants, and the paths are well-maintained and easy to navigate.  I really enjoy the Pine tree plant.  There are also several water features and fountains throughout the garden, which add to the serene and peaceful ambiance.  I highly recommend visiting the Botanical Gardens, especially if you are a nature lover or just looking for a relaxing outdoor activity.  There you can also rent scooters or bicycles.  for the price of a scooter, which is 40 thousand on weekends and 30 thousand on weekdays.  Besides that, you can also have a picnic with your family or loved ones.  for those who want to shop there are also various food stalls available such as strawberries, cassava chips, grilled sausages, etc.  for entrance tickets, namely 30 thousand on weekends and 20 thousand on weekdays.  The facilities provided are also complete, such as toilets and parking areas.  for parking tickets, namely 5 thousand for motorbikes
Best for family activities like picnic and bonding, weather ☁️ is tricky, rain often,
Siip

I had an amazing time at Bedugul Botanical Garden! The gardens are absolutely beautiful and the variety of plants and flowers on display is truly impressive. The pathways are well-maintained and easy to navigate, and the staff is friendly and helpful. but the gardens were quite crowded with tourists, which made it difficult to fully enjoy the beauty and serenity of the surroundings. Some areas of the garden were also not as well-maintained as they could be, with weeds and litter in some areas. I particularly enjoyed the orchid collection and the greenhouse, which was home to some rare and exotic plants. The views of the surrounding mountains and Lake Bratan are also stunning. Overall, I highly recommend visiting this botanical garden if you're in Bali.

The spacious garden is suitable for recreation with family and friends. Upon entering the garden, I was blown away by the cool, refreshing air. The place is clean, comfortable, green, and there are shady trees and various plants. In this garden there are also flowers and views of green hills. For those of you who like strawberries there are also strawberry traders. There are also toilets and trash cans here. We can take pictures and explore the vast botanical garden with various rare plant species. Don't forget to bring appropriate clothing because the temperature is quite cold.

Bedugul Botanical Garden is an amazing place to visit if you're interested in learning about botany in Bali. The garden is wide, lush, and cozy, making it one of the best places in Bali for a picnic. The air here is very fresh and filled with the scent of plants and trees, making it a perfect spot for a peaceful and relaxing day out. The garden is divided into various sections according to the types of plants grown here, making it a great place to explore and learn about the different varieties of plants.

Apart from exploring the garden, there are many other activities you can enjoy here. The botanical garden has complete facilities like toilets, food vendors, and souvenir shops near the parking lot. You can even rent bicycles if you want to explore the garden while getting some exercise. You can have a picnic with your loved ones, gather with a large group of people, or even organize a mini BBQ if you bring a portable stove. The garden is also ideal for outdoor sports like football or badminton.

Bedugul Botanical Garden is easily accessible, located in Tabanan district and takes around 3 hours from Ngurah Rai Airport. The garden is open every day, from 8 am to 4 pm on weekdays and until 5 pm on weekends. The entrance fee is quite affordable, ranging from 11000 to 20000 rupiahs.

Bedugul Botanical Garden or Kebun Raya Eka Karya, is a recomment destination for nature lovers and botany enthusiasts in Bali or for the people who want to healing and relaxing holiday. This place is home to thousands of species of plants, trees, and flowers, providing a stunning display of nature's beauty. The visitors can take a photo, doing picnic with family, walking around in the garden with nature scenery and while enjoying the fresh air there and you can be relax with the nature view. Visitors can buy souvenirs, locals snacks, and even plants and seeds to take home from the plants store there. This place is easy to access by car or motorbike from other parts of Bali, and there is ample parking available. The facilities that provided to visitors, including restrooms, picnic areas, and a cafe serving snacks and refreshments.

i visited this botanical garden last year 2021. it was very cool and very suitable for people who like shade and coolness. when I went there it was raining so the weather was quite cold, and still during the pandemic I paid an entrance ticket of IDR 20,000/person and got a free hand sanitizer. there it is very beautiful and clean from plastic the manager of the botanical garden arranges the garden as beautiful and clean as possible. but I was a bit annoyed because to rent a toilet per person was charged IDR 10,000 even though it was only to change clothes haha ​​but that was fine. suitable for picnics and family time or other outbound events. there is also a place to take pictures, you can walk around until you get tired because the garden is very wide and large. there is also a very big statue, you can take pictures there but i didn't have time to take pictures there because of the rain. You can also buy souvenirs such as chips, strawberries and souvenirs at the Bedugul parking lot, but you have to be smart in bidding on prices hahah because they will offer you the highest price because you are visitor. the parking fee is only IDR 2000 for motorbikes and IDR 5000 for cars. better to bring a raincoat and wear a jacket if you can't stand the cold. and recently I heard that there is an electric scooter rental there, you have to visit and try electric scooters in this place with your love one, thank you <3

The atmosphere in Kebun Raya is cool because it is surrounded by lots of trees, with a large area which is very suitable as a tourist spot to relax with family. There we can bring a portable stove and food ingredients to cook there while gathering with family or the loved ones. In terms of facilities, the toilets are clean and available at every point. There are  gazebos and benches at several points, but some of the benches are already broken and cannot be sat on.
Now scooter and bicycle rentals are also provided for those who want to explore the botanical garden area, but we can't take them too far.
In my opinion, the entry ticket is relatively expensive compared to the previous one, but it depends on each person's point of view.
Overall the place is okay for traveling with family or for an organization gathering

Here's my review for the Bedugul Botanical Garden. I last visited the Bedugul Botanical Garden in 2021. In Bedugul you can buy souvenirs at the gift shop and can buy locally made crafts and plants. The price is a bit expensive, but the quality is good. There are many activities that can be do in Bedugul, such as hiking, bird watching, and exploring various types of plants. Bedugul also has a playground for children which is suitable for families and there are several food stalls within the park serving local food. The prices are reasonable, and the food is delicious. Bedugul is located on a hill, so there are some steep climbs and stairs to traverse. Bedugul is open from 8am to 6pm daily, you can see beautiful views of Bedugul and an impressive collection of plants and trees from all over Indonesia and the world and there are also several ponds, fountains and statues throughout the park which add to its beauty. The entrance fee for domestic tourists is IDR 9,000 per person and the vehicle parking fee for cars is IDR 6,000. However. Overall, I would recommend Bedugul Botanical Gardens to anyone looking for a peaceful and educational day trip.

Non l'ho trovato molto interessante, in quanto in molte zone è lasciato un po' andare e poco curato.

Bedugul Botanical Garden, a favorite place to refresh energy 
 A very cool place, surrounded by very beautiful trees, perfect for a picnic.

The Gardens cover approx. 157ha and are established on a series of undulating sections of Tapak Hill as we discovered on entering. Too far to walk if suffering from a physical impairment but there are buggies, scooters and cycles for hire or, like ourselves, paid the fee to be taken around and shown the main features in a larger buggy. Thankfully, having arrived early, we were the only couple on board and it became very much a private tour with our well versed and skilled driver/guide. The entire area was light on for flora in bloom, only one orchid in bloom in the Orchid House. We enjoyed the Cactus House, Lake View, Bamboo Grove, Fern Garden, Dinosaur area, Giant banyan tree and the cool temperature as we meandered through the trees. Many lovely walking trails and the Statue of Kumbakarna Laga and the many other statues and flora features. There was a festive atmosphere with many locals enjoying picnics throughout the gardens. Disappointing the shop at the entrance is vacant, no literature or souvenirs of the gardens for sale.

Extremely disorganized and intended for the locals and not foreigners. Shuttle bus is available but only allowed to buy a single stop even though the shuttle buses are empty. It’s a large park and the shuttle should loop the park but it doesn’t. Tried to rent a scooter but most of them were discharged and the available ones were rented to locals over foreigners. Obviously they are not interested in renting the golf carts or scooters because the discharged machines are not connected to power to be charged.  Since we couldn’t rent a scooter we walked to the orchid garden and along the way there was a second rental kiosk but they were “closed” which means they could be bothered with renting. The orchid garden had 3,155 orchids but only one was blooming. After a terrible experience we decided to cut our losses and leave. Which means we had to walk because there is no shuttle to pick us up.
Tgl 11 kami berkunjung ke tempat ini, kenapa dibiarkan sampai sangat macet menuju pintu keluar! Mau keluar saja bisa memakan waktu 2 jam apa yg dikerjakan pengelola dan security!!! Damn!

Немного туристов сюда заезжают, а зря! Наверное думают, что здесь всё о ботанике. И зря! Здесь все об отдыхе и красоте! За небольшую входную плату сюда приезжают местные жители на целый день отдохнуть в прохладе ( сад располагается на высоте почти километр над уровнем моря), порезвиться, насладится прекрасными видами и заняться спортом. Территория большая и прекрасно обустроена. Местами экваториальный лес, местами красивые ухоженные аллеи. Нас за сущие копейки провезли на общественном электрокаре индивидуально по всему саду. Все показали, расставили правильные акценты. Отсюда и озеро, с самой верхушки парка, видно. Рекомендую посетить.

In comparison to botanical gardens I saw during other travels, this one was different. I would assume that garden lovers get a bit disappointed, because there are not a lot of flowers. However, there is a huge number of trees, some of them (see pic) being enormous in size.
What I found interesting, too, is that the garden (or park) has become a meeting point for locals to celebrate family gatherings and team-building events.
We went there on the way from Ubud to Munduk - and that is what I would recommend instead of a trip on its own.

I visited this place back in 2010, fast forward to 2022 with Covid 19 Pandemic in consideration, this place definitely is negatively impacted.

Revisit this place as a couple in May 2022, we try to enter 2 of their facilities, however both are closed and not maintained. We can only assume Covid 19 impact was too much like how it take down most of the world business for the past 2 years.

We also noticed 2 foreign national tourists trying to communicate to garden security about maintenance required, unfortunately the response was flat with phrases like “We will convey your comment to our manager”

Open space is still great, with fresh air, green and beautiful scenery for us to walk by. We hope that Bali Botanical Garden that was magnificent in the past can soon see a better recovery.

See a quite beautiful spot with a sitting hut and you'll find coffee cups, food wrappers and cigarette boxes all over the ground. Its not just here but all over Bali. Its such a cool place and such a great idea to have botanical park full of amazing plants and trees, but some visitors are just so ignorant of the value and beauty of nature they just throw their rubbish on the ground. Very disgusting!! Sorry I didn't get a photo but I'm staying close by and will take a few shots if I have time. Worth a visit, yes, but some very disappointing garbage areas to spoil the view!!!

Après une nuit à Candidasa, nous nous sommes rendus dans ce petit village typique et historique dont l'une des activités principales est l'élevage de coqs de combats (très colorés). Une sorte de ruelle pour monter et une pour descendre, avec tout du long, les maisons des villageois dont certaines servent de lieux d'exposition pour l'artisanat local (tissus, batiks, sarongs, œufs peints, écritures sur bambous...). L'habitat est simple mais rien ne laisse transparaître la précarité des gens du village. Le bonheur tient à peu de choses. Le village est agréable à parcourir. Un bon moment.

We left Tenganan Pegringsingan Village with a heart full of peace and admiration. This ancient Balinese village offers not only a glimpse into the island’s rich traditions and unique culture, but also a sense of serenity and authenticity that’s hard to find elsewhere.

The people are incredibly warm and welcoming, and their pride in preserving centuries-old customs is truly inspiring. Walking through the narrow paths lined with traditional homes, watching the artisans weave double ikat textiles, and hearing the stories behind every ritual made the visit unforgettable.

Highly recommended for anyone seeking a deeper, more meaningful connection with the real Bali.
tempat yg indah,sakral,bagus utk wisatawan,biar mengenal tradisi Bali dan harus dijaga kelestarian adat istiadat di tenganan
You should come for their event truna..

Kesan pertama saya berkunjung ke Desa Tenganan Pegringsingan adalah saya merasa seperti memasuki pekarangan rumah yang didalamnya terdapat beberapa kepala keluarga, mungkin karena saya melihat semua warga di sini begitu akrab satu sama lain seperti keluarga besar. Saya kagum dengan adat istiadat yang masih tetap dijaga sampai saat ini. Suasananya yang damai dan tenang menjadikan Desa Tenganan salah satu tempat yang cocok untuk relaksasi sambil mengenal tradisi dan budaya Bali Aga. Selain itu ada banyak kerajinan khas Desa Tenganan salah satunya Kain Tenun Pengringsingan, anyaman bambu, ukiran, dan lukisan diatas daun lontar. Saya juga berkesempatan melihat salah satu proses pemintalaan benang, dan juga proses membuat lukisan diatas daun lontar,

Semoga di lain kesempatan bisa berkunjung kembali .

Schönes Dorf… traditionell, vielleicht. Gute Handwerkliche Kunst und tolle Stoffe.
Nette Menschen, aber wo auf Bali sind die Menschen nicht nett
Kann man sich ansehen, wir haben mehr erwartet. Man wird nicht bedrängt etwas zu kaufen. Es ist eine ruhige Atmosphäre und es ist eine schöne Abwechslung zum Touri Trubel.

Lovely cultural experience.
When you arrive they ask you for a donation, this money goes towards the children's education and construction of the new temple. From what we saw, people donated roughly $50-100k, but it's up to you
Once you donated, a guide (ours spoke excellent English) will take you through the village and explain their local customs, religion, and the significance of their culture to you. He'll take you to his house and offer you the chance to purchase their wares (our guide had a wife that weaves, so they offered us a chance to buy their heritage listed fabrics). You're not pressured to buy, though it's nice if you do.
Overall the tour was very informative, the people were very friendly, and we ended up visiting the local honey farm too and buying some local honey while learning more about the black bees narrative to this region. Great way to learn more about the original inhabitants of this island and their culture.
tenganan pegringsingan adalah desa yang sangat indah dengan perpaduan tradisi dan kesenian khas Bali... saya merasa damai setelah berkunjung ke sana.

Jika memiliki wisata minat khusus untuk mengenal Desa Wisata yang memiliki tradisi perang pandan (mekare-kare) dan mengenal Bali Aga. Desa Tenganan sangat direkomendasikan karena di Desa ini memiliki ciri khas produk yang dihasilkan seperti kain grising, madu asam, dan karya-karya luar biasa tangan masyarakat lokal yang patut di apresiasi. Selain itu dari desa ini juga kita akan melihat bagaimana pandangan masyarakat terkait lingkungan, dimana masyarakat sangattt menghargai dan menjaga kelestarian alam. Contohnya seperti tidak menggunakan pestisida untuk pertanian dan tidak sembarang menebang pohon untuk dijadikan kayu bakar (harus kayu yang benar-benar sudah mati). Sangat salutt bagaimana masyarakat desa ini menjunjung tinggi kelestarian alam yang patut dicontoh oleh seluruh masyarakat Indonesia.

Small Balinese village, great for walks around, and the start point for a few trekking trails. Nice place to go when visiting Candidasa.

Le village et son histoire sont très interessants et c’est sympas de s y balader. Par contre attention à l’arnaque après. Notre guide un monsieur d’un certain âge nous a emmené dans sa maison pour nous montrer le tissage artisanal. La machine était posée mais personne ne tissait et dans sa maison il a un shop qui vend des sarongs soit disant tissés par sa femme et j’ai payé 800 000 roupies pour un sarong soit disant artisanal alors que j’ai retrouvé le même à kuta pour 60000.
Cette personne est donc malhonnête. Visitez le village mais n’achetez rien.

Kalau kamu pikir sudah mengenal Bali, coba kunjungi Desa Tenganan Pegringsingan di Karangasem.
Di sinilah Bali Aga, Bali kuno, masih hidup dan bernafas.

Apa yang bikin desa ini istimewa?
– Hanya penduduk asli yang boleh menikah di dalam desa
– Upacara Perang Pandan sebagai bentuk penghormatan pada Dewa Perang
– Kain geringsing, satu-satunya kain dobel ikat di Indonesia, penuh filosofi dan energi sakral...
Nista posebno, sve namešteno za turiste i kupovinu.

Tenganan Village, one of Bali’s oldest and most traditional villages. Nestled in Karangasem, this Bali Aga village offers a rare glimpse into ancient Balinese culture, unique customs, and intricate Geringsing weaving. Wander cobblestone paths, witness age-old rituals, and experience authentic Balinese heritage untouched by modern influence. Thanks javaindoecotourism
More than well worth a visit. I'm sure it's also known as Aga Village. It's reported to be 600 years old and not too far from Candi Dasa.
A place to not be missed. Ancient wisdom and a wonderful local and sustainable way of organizing people and life.

Desa wisata yang sangat cocok dikunjungi terletak di bagian tenggara pulau Bali. Desa yang dikenal sebagai Bali Aga atau Bali kuno yang sudah exis sebelum kedatangan ekspansi Majapahit ke Bali pada abad ke XIIII.

Desa Tenganan Pegringsingan adalah salah satu desa adat Bali yang terletak di Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali Timur. Desa ini terkenal sebagai salah satu desa Bali Aga, yaitu masyarakat Bali asli yang masih mempertahankan tradisi, adat, dan budaya leluhur sebelum pengaruh Hindu Majapahit masuk ke Bali.

Berikut beberapa hal menarik tentang Desa Tenganan Pegringsingan:

1. Tradisi dan Adat yang Unik

Desa ini memiliki aturan adat yang sangat ketat, termasuk sistem kekerabatan, hukum adat, dan upacara keagamaan. Penduduknya hidup dalam sistem komunitas yang sangat terstruktur dan disiplin.

2. Kain Gringsing

Tenganan terkenal sebagai satu-satunya tempat di Indonesia yang membuat kain gringsing menggunakan teknik double ikat, yaitu proses pewarnaan benang sebelum ditenun. Proses ini sangat rumit dan bisa memakan waktu bertahun-tahun untuk menghasilkan satu kain.

3. Arsitektur Tradisional

Rumah-rumah di Tenganan dibangun dengan mengikuti pola tata ruang adat. Jalan desa berbentuk lurus memanjang dan rumah-rumah berada di kedua sisinya dengan bentuk dan ukuran yang seragam.

4. Upacara dan Festival

Festival paling terkenal adalah Perang Pandan (Mekaré-karé) yang diadakan saat bulan Juni dalam rangka menghormati Dewa Indra. Warga laki-laki bertarung menggunakan pandan berduri sebagai senjata dan daun pisang sebagai tameng, diiringi musik gamelan dan ritual keagamaan.

5. Sistem Sosial Tertutup

Dulu, pernikahan hanya boleh dilakukan antar sesama warga desa. Jika menikah dengan orang luar, maka seseorang bisa kehilangan haknya sebagai warga desa. Namun aturan ini kini mulai lebih fleksibel.

Kalau kamu tertarik dengan budaya tradisional Bali yang autentik, Desa Tenganan Pegringsingan wajib dikunjungi.
Salah satu daerah bali Age yang memiliki tradisi Unik.
Awesome walking experience..people are just lovely.
Nice for visit

We really enjoyed visiting Tenganan Pegringsingan Village. It’s such a calm, peaceful place and has a completely different vibe from other parts of Bali. The village is home to the Bali Aga people, and it was super interesting to learn about their unique traditions and way of life.

Everyone we met was really friendly, and it felt like a genuine, respectful look into local culture rather than something overly touristy.

It’s a lovely place to walk around, take in the scenery, and support the local community. Definitely worth a visit if you are interested in Balinese culture and want a more authentic, quiet experience off the usual tourist trail.

Vores besøg startede fint ud med en guide der fortalte ivrigt om byen, bygningerne, det traditionelle tøj og det lokale tempel. Vi blev herefter vidst ind i et hus hvor de laver traditionelt tøj og blev spurgte mange gange om vi ville købe. Blev derefter vidst ind i et andet lokale hvor de laver deres traditionelle kalender på bambustræ. Vi fik fremvist 10 forskellige men gjorde der klart at vi ikke ønskede at købe noget på dette tidspunkt. Det gjorde stemningen meget presset og vores guide ændrede tydeligt attitude og fortalte kun mere om landsbyen når vi spurgte ind til det. Det blev faktisk ubehageligt og vi ville ikke anbefale andre at besøge stedet.

Vieux village de l'époque du 8e siécles. 800 personnes y vivent toujours. On peut visiter les maisons des résidents. Beaucoup de coq et poule libre. Belle ambiance mais pas sous la pluie. Je recommande malgré tout!

Disappointed with visit to this ancient aboriginal village, the guide was apparently the leader of this village for 5 years. He showed no interest in telling me history of the village, asked my occupation to see if I had money, then quickly led me to a shop where I was pressured into buying a small scroll clearly not hand made, for 600000 rupiah. Only told me the price once he had scratched my name on it and said I had to buy it. Very uncomfortable as a woman on my own. The lady who took the money seemed uncomfortable in his presence too!
Nothing happening in the village at all, other than youths riding motorcycles, no other residents around. No view of a traditional home, No ladies in traditional dress, No weaving demonstration of the Ikat, nothing genuine, the items in shop are not made there they look like you see in a market.
As soon as I had purchased something via their card machine, oh yes an extra 2%, as no cash, I was shown the way out! Bali is wonderful but Do not go here it’s very disappointed and lets down the real people of Bali who are beautiful and happy and so grateful for their lives in Bali.

Vesnice plná zvířátek, usměvavých místních a tradiční kultury, kterou zde můžete objevit za vstupné, které si sami určíte. Na začátku vesnice odevzdáte částku “donation” pro vesnici, kterou zapíší do knihy a následně využijí na kulturní rozvoj, většinou různé slavnosti. Místní se zde věnují tradičním řemeslům, jež vám během prohlídky představí s názornými ukázkami a výrobky si zde můžete i koupit (za trochu dráž než normální ceny)

Masyarakat di desa ini adalah suku Bali Aga yang konon katanya merupakan keturunan penduduk Bali Asli atau Bali Aga (mula/awal) yang hidup di Bali..
Fyi, suku Bali Aga selain ada di Desa Adat Tenganan, juga ada di Desa Adat Trunysn dan Sambiran..
Disini terkenal dengan kain tenun gringsing, yang merupakan busana khas masyarakatnya..

An sich ein interessantes Dorf um einiges über die Kultur der Ureinwohner zu erfahren. Man bekommt viele soziale aber auch wirtschaftliche Aspekte erklärt. Ebenso kann man alte Handwerkskunst beobachten, wie z.B. Holzschnitzereien oder das Weben von Sarongs sowie das Färben.

Zum Beispiel dürfen Bewohner des Dorfes nur andere Bewohner des Dorfes heiraten, wodurch sich der Stammbaum schnell schließen dürfte :O Ebenso ist es nicht gedacht, dass Dorfbewohner das Dorf verlassen. Tun sie das, um z.B. zu studieren, müssen sie Gebühren an das Dorf bezahlen. Es finden jährlich rituelle Kämpfe statt, bei welchen sich die Bewohner gegenseitig mit Kaktusblättern auf den Rücken schlagen, bis aufs Blut. Ebenso werden dort Kampfhähne in Käfigen gehalten.

Nachdem uns die Schnitzereien und die dazugehörigen Horoskope sehr freundlich erklärt und gezeigt wurden kam es dann aber von Seiten der Einwohner sehr schnell zum geschäftlichen Teil. Man hat eindringlich versucht uns die doch teuren Schnitzereien (ca. 700.000 IDR, rund 42 Euro zu verkaufen und auf die Karma-/Mitleidsdrüse gedrückt, dass die Familie doch etwas zu essen braucht und auch einen selbst dann Gutes wiederfahren würde. Das alles hatte leider einen negativen Beigeschmack und hat das Bild getrübt, da man etwas "umzingelt" von den Bewohnern war.

Es standen auch im Vorfeld nirgendwo Preise und es wurde eher die Reaktion auf das Gezeigte abgewartet und dann ein Preis entsprechend der Begeisterung aufgerufen. Zumindest war das mein Eindruck.

Der Eintritt ist auf Spendenbasis, aber man "erwartet" ca. 20.000 IDR.

Insgesamt wurde uns das Ganze Erlebnis als sehr positiv verkauft, bei uns hat es aber eher Fragen aufgeworfen. Nochmal würde ich das Dorf nicht besuchen.

It’s a bit sad tbh. If you wanna visit an authentic village drive up the mountain, pass beautiful villages with a view.

Leuk om ook het oude en traditionele Bali te zien. De Tenganan is 100den jaren oud en waren eigenlijk een geisoleerde stam. Éen van de 3 echte traditionele in Bali (Midden, Oosten en Noorden) Het is diep in het oerwoud en er waren geen écht begaanbare wegen naartoe. Dat heeft de regering veranderd door de berg te splijten (rij je ook door) en er een weg aan te leggen. Ze leven en leefden volgens traditionele regels. Zo mochten ze alleen met mensen trouwen uit hun eigen stam en is iedereen dus als het ware familie. Hebben ze inwijdingsrituelen, mannengevechten met een blad met stekels (was dit jaar 25 juni en is opengesteld), hebben ze hanengevechten en aparte zaken die ze gesplitst doen als man en vrouw.
Tegenwoordig is er een gedeelte vd stam dat wel mag trouwen met iemand van buitenaf... maar het andere gedeelte houdt vast aan de tradities.In het dorp Tenganan is het Meulu tot Tengah-concept van toepassing op een woonperceel met de hoogste hiërarchische ruimte gelegen in een gebied dicht bij de voor-/buitenplaats omdat de hoofdweg (awangan) als een heilig gebied wordt beschouwd. Woonhuizen in Tenganan Village bestaan ​​altijd uit vier hoofdgebouweenheden. Bali Tenganan Village als het oudste dorp op het eiland Bali, waar de bewoners nog steeds hun cultuur en cultuur behouden en behouden, maken Tenganan dorp een cultureel toerisme dat vandaag de dag nog steeds bestaat. De beroepen van de bewoners hier in het algemeen zijn ambachtslieden, landbouw, plantages en ook vissers, waar het Tenganan dorp niet ver van dit candidasa strand ligt. De meest dominante zijn handwerk zoals geweven bamboe, houtsnijwerk, schilderijen op palmbladeren en ook de meest bekende is de pegringsingan geweven stof. De persoonlijke gids uit het dorp neemt je ook mee naar zijn huis, waar je souvenirs kan kopen, maar voel het niet als verplichting!
Veel plezier....

Net voor het dorp kan je thee drinken van de zwarte bij ( net zo groot als een kleine vlieg) heel speciaal. Maken in 1 jaar 1 kg honing... Absoluut een aanrader

Wioska zamieszkała przez rdzennych Balijczyków, wejście za opłatą „co łaska”. Gdy grzecznie odmówiliśmy, pan zakończył swoją 15 minutową wycieczkę i odprowadził nas do wyjścia. Jak dla mnie porażka, nie polecam.
