Desa Tenganan Pegringsingan, yang terletak di Bali Timur, merupakan salah satu desa adat Bali yang paling terkenal dan kaya akan budaya. Desa ini merupakan rumah bagi masyarakat Bali Aga, yang dikenal sebagai salah satu kelompok masyarakat asli Bali yang masih mempertahankan tradisi kuno dan cara hidup mereka yang unik.

Salah satu hal yang membuat Tenganan Pegringsingan sangat istimewa adalah proses pembuatan kain ikat tradisional yang disebut **kain gringsing**, yang sangat langka dan hanya dapat ditemukan di desa ini. Proses pembuatannya sangat rumit dan memakan waktu bertahun-tahun, menjadikannya kain yang sangat dihargai dan bernilai tinggi. Pengunjung dapat melihat langsung bagaimana kain ini dibuat dengan teknik yang diwariskan turun-temurun.

Selain kerajinan kain, desa ini juga menawarkan arsitektur tradisional yang indah dan suasana yang tenang. Rumah-rumah di Tenganan dibangun dengan gaya khas Bali Aga, dengan tata letak yang mengikuti aturan adat setempat. Desa ini terasa sangat autentik karena masyarakatnya masih sangat memegang teguh adat istiadat mereka, termasuk dalam kehidupan sehari-hari.

Desa Tenganan juga sering menjadi tuan rumah berbagai upacara adat yang menarik perhatian wisatawan, seperti festival **Mekaré-kare**, sebuah perayaan yang melibatkan pertarungan menggunakan daun pandan berduri, yang dilakukan sebagai bagian dari tradisi spiritual desa.

Bagi para wisatawan yang mencari pengalaman budaya yang otentik, Tenganan Pegringsingan adalah destinasi yang sangat direkomendasikan. Suasana desa yang damai, budaya yang kaya, serta kerajinan khasnya menawarkan pengalaman yang tidak hanya indah tetapi juga mendalam. Sebagai catatan, karena ini adalah desa adat yang sakral, pengunjung disarankan untuk menghormati aturan dan tradisi yang ada selama kunjungan.

Secara keseluruhan, Desa Tenganan Pegringsingan adalah tempat yang memukau dan penuh dengan warisan budaya yang masih terjaga, menjadikannya salah satu destinasi budaya terbaik di Bali untuk dikunjungi.
Cool village to visit. Very talented craftwork on display and for sale.

Tenganan Village is a true hidden gem! The local people are so wonderful. Many creating these beautiful leaf etchings, they instructed/showed us on how it is made, then created a personalised one to take away for very reasonable cost. It’s a real privilege to see such incredible talent. I ended up getting 2, one of the calender with both mine and my husbands name at the bottom ( in both english & ballinese ) There are also wooden handpainted eggs with stands being sold further up into the villlage, all detailed and brightly coloured in many designs. Its a true must-visit for anyone interested in Balinese art and culture. But also to see the confounds in which some people live. A guide is recommended to thoroughly understand what the surrounds.

Tenganan Pegringsingan est un village authentique et préservé de Bali, connu pour ses tissus Ikat uniques et ses traditions ancestrales. Les habitants sont accueillants et la visite offre un véritable aperçu du Bali traditionnel, loin du tourisme de masse.

You make a donation at the entrance in the village. A guide is assigned to you for free and walks you through the village.
To be honest I didn’t saw it quite for free, in my case the first thing the guide did was to take me into his house showing me the work of his wife, the ikat and the calendars they were doing.
Basically he was just trying to sell their work, beautiful art, but I was just not interested on buying something I was curious more to learn about the culture.
Most of the time was spent in his house trying to sell me, starting to show me the most expensive ones, if he saw I was not interested in buying he was just showing me what he has with a lower price.
Always saying me that he understands if I’m on a budget and I don’t buy, he doesn’t do this for business…
In the end I bought a book sign because I started to feel uncomfortable by the situation. Can’t say I learned much about them, in my case it was more about the guide trying to sell. Basically all the guides have their own business, at the end or the beginning of the tour you will end up in their area of selling.
Schönes traditionelles Dorf, was gegen eine Spende einem gezeigt wird. Unser Guide hat sich Zeit genommen und viel erklärt, obwohl wir nix der eignen Produkte gekauft haben

Tenganan Pegringsingan traditional village is one of the most special places on the island. This used to be a very isolated village of the Bali Aga people - the original inhabitants of Bali before the large Hindu-Javanese migration. The surrounding area felt very Polynesian somehow. Tenganan Pegringsingan is known for their double ikat textiles. To enter you pay a donation. They limit the number of tourists who can enter but this place is not crowded. I hope they can continue to preserve their village and culture.

Spent one hour in this lovely quiet local village. You make a donation of your choice as an entrance fee and this includes your guide who brings you around and shows you the village and tells you stories.

The kids (and adults) loved learning about the traditions and observing local crafts.

Highly recommended for a quieter experience with the family.

One of the ancient village in Bali. Was a memorable visit. Got story& understanding of the history, culture & challenges of this village from the charismatic , wise& smart local community leader pak Nyoman Sadre.
Lovely village in linear composition of housing compounds. Very peaceful, surrounded by lush green hill/ mountain as they are not allowed to cut trees.
Many souvenirs are sold directly by locals. From regular honey to kele2 honey and black honey from stingless bee. They have the distinctive tenun Slingsing (means not sick), known as most complex waving technique only exist here, similarly to India & Japan (forgot the names).
They are well organized. Theres big parking area outside.
We try the locally made food by bu Tutni & team. It was delicious. Unique ones: sayur ononan (made from 10 type of leaves), sambal matah terong, also ice tamarind drink

La visita di questo villaggio tradizionale è una esperienza culturale autentica.
E’ un bel villaggio classico, mantenuto nelle condizioni del passato, senza auto e nuove strade, per comunicare ai turisti come si viveva a Bali una volta.
Vi è uno spazio etnico culturale di presentazione, e l’ingresso è libero, viene solo richiesta una donazione.
Pare ben organizzato e chi ci viveva, ci vive ancora, non più da contadino, ma per offrire ai turisti oggetti di artigianato e souvenir.
Qui validi artigiani tessono e creano i manufatti che vendono.
Nella mia passeggiata lungo il villaggio sono stato scortato da alcuni miti carabao.

Tenganan Pegringsingan Village: A Glimpse into Bali Aga Culture
Tucked away in eastern Bali, Tenganan Pegringsingan is a unique village that offers a glimpse into the island's ancient Bali Aga culture. Believed to be one of the oldest settlements in Bali, it's known for its distinct traditions, architecture, and double ikat weaving called gringsing.
The village is laid out in a concentric pattern, with houses facing inward and communal spaces at the center. The architecture is characterized by walled compounds, thatched roofs, and intricate bamboo decorations.
Tenganan is also famous for its gringsing textiles, handwoven using natural dyes and intricate patterns passed down through generations. The village's strict adherence to tradition is evident in its communal living, rituals, and adherence to the awig-awig (traditional laws).
Visitors can experience the village's unique way of life by strolling through the narrow alleys, observing traditional crafts, and witnessing cultural performances like the Perang Pandan (Pandan War). While Tenganan has embraced tourism, it remains steadfast in preserving its heritage, making it the most authentic representation of Bali Aga culture.
Terjemahan Bahasa Indonesia:
Desa Tenganan Pegringsingan: Sekilas Tentang Budaya Bali Aga
Terletak di Bali timur, Tenganan Pegringsingan adalah desa unik yang menawarkan sekilas budaya Bali Aga kuno di pulau itu. Dipercaya sebagai salah satu pemukiman tertua di Bali, desa ini terkenal dengan tradisi, arsitektur, dan tenun ikat ganda yang disebut gringsing.
Desa ini ditata dalam pola konsentris, dengan rumah-rumah menghadap ke dalam dan ruang-ruang komunal di tengah. Arsitekturnya ditandai dengan kompleks berdinding, atap jerami, dan dekorasi bambu yang rumit.
Tenganan juga terkenal dengan tekstil gringsingnya, yang ditenun tangan menggunakan pewarna alami dan pola rumit yang diturunkan dari generasi ke generasi. Kepatuhan desa yang ketat terhadap tradisi terbukti dalam kehidupan komunal, ritual, dan kepatuhan terhadap awig-awig (hukum tradisional).
Pengunjung dapat merasakan cara hidup desa yang unik dengan berjalan-jalan di gang-gang sempit, mengamati kerajinan tradisional, dan menyaksikan pertunjukan budaya seperti Perang Pandan. Meskipun Tenganan telah merangkul pariwisata, desa ini tetap teguh dalam melestarikan warisannya, menjadikannya representasi paling otentik dari budaya Bali Aga.

Pegeringsingan Village is een van de traditionele dorpen in Tenganan, Karangasem Regency, provincie Bali. Pegeringsingan Village zou een inheemse Balinese bevolking hebben die Bali Aga wordt genoemd. De taal die in dit dorp wordt gesproken is natuurlijk de Bali Aga taal die andere medeklinkers heeft dan het Balinees in het algemeen. Daarnaast zijn er ook veel ambachten van geweven stoffen typisch voor Pegeringsingan Village die al honderden jaren bestaan en het centrum zijn van het typische Pegeringsingan weefambacht.

J'ai un avis très partagé sur cet endroit. J'y suis allée à deux reprises fin mai 2023, une fois vers 9 h et l'autre en fin de matinée. Nous sommes arrivés par l'ouest du village où il y a le parking public où l'on fait une donation. Des guides qui habitent le village viennent nous accueillir. Les deux fois il n'y avait vraiment pas grand monde et le village semblait vide. Le guide m'a dit que les habitants travaillaient à l'extérieur en matinée, dans les rizières, mais comme certains le disent dans d'autres avis, il semble que cette partie du village soit un peu "morte", sans âme qui vive, et qu'elle soit réservée aux touristes, comme une attraction où on ne manque pas de vous faire passer dans des petites échoppes pour acheter des souvenirs artisanaux. Attention, il y a bien des souvenirs fabriqués sur place (statuettes , calendriers et surtout le fameux double ikat) mais aussi beaucoup de tissus importés sans valeur, les fameux foulards en polyester. Je ne trouve pas ça très bien de mélanger, c'est trompeur. De plus, il est vrai, comme d'autres l'ont dit, qu'une dame fait un peu semblant de tisser et s'empresse de vendre sa marchandise. Ça ressemble à une mise en scène et ce n'est pas non plus très sincère. Les guides pourraient aussi expliquer davantage les traditions, comme la technique du double ikat, les coutumes comme le statut égal entre homme et femme, l'ouverture du village sur l'extérieur depuis seulement les années 70, les cérémonies traditionnelles, la tour du tambour, etc. Ça manque un peu et j'ai dû me renseigner par moi-même sur internet. D'ailleurs, peut-être que tout ce qu'on lit n'est pas vrai et qu'eux-mêmes pourraient rétablir la vérité sur leurs coutumes, anciennes ou plus récentes.

En revanche, je ne dirais pas que ce village est un attrape-touristes car le savoir-faire unique du village, le tissu tenun double ikat, est toujours bien présent. Il suffit de se rendre dans la partie Est du village pour s'en rendre compte. Partout sèche au soleil le morinda utilisé pour la teinture du précieux tissu. Si vous poussez quelques portes bien choisies, vous verrez les familles tisser de manière ancestrale, à la main, sur des métiers à tisser en bois où la bobine de la chaîne est disposée dans un geste régulier à la main. Ils savent aussi faire du single ikat mais on peut trouver ce savoir-faire ailleurs, alors que le double ikat, bien plus complexe puisque la trame ET la chaîne sont faites à partir de fils déjà teints selon le motif (il faut un temps fou pour aligner le tout), n'est tissé que dans ce village en Indonésie, ainsi qu'à Patan Gujarat en Inde et sur l'île d'Okinawa au Japon. Le prix d'annonce pour une petite pièce récente (5 ans) est de 4 millions de roupies. C'est un tissu aux propriétés spirituelles pour les hindous balinais.
Il n'y a pas non plus un nombre déraisonnable de boutiques de souvenirs bas de gamme, comme on peut en voir ailleurs, mais seulement quelques unes et toujours avec des produits d'artisanat local.
Personnellement je n'ai subi aucun racolage agressif, juste un arrêt dans la même boutique. Pas de vendeur ambulant.
Le village bénéficie aussi de subventions pour sauvegarder son patrimoine. Les rituels, les cérémonies traditionnelles, sont toujours d'actualité dans le village. Nombre de balinais viennent ici acheter le double ikat pour les cérémonies.
De plus, tous les habitants sont respectueux, les guides habitent vraiment le village. Dans la partie Est, nous avons poussé la porte d'une maison de tisserands où nous avons été extrêmement bien reçus malgré notre irruption imprévue.
Les petits magasins sur les parkings vendent le double ikat des familles du village, certaines boutiques sont même tenues par ces mêmes familles, mais là encore tout est mélangé avec des produits manufacturés.

Voilà pourquoi mon avis est mitigé. C'est un lieu unique au monde (faites des recherches, vous verrez) où le savoir-faire demeure, qui bénéficie d'un statut particulier, mais qui cherche comme partout, d'autres moyens de subsister de manière parfois maladroite.
Pas d’entrée. L’accès au village se fait par donation ce qui est mieux pour les habitants. Ils nous ont très bien accueillis. Ce fut une visite hors du temps, loin de la cohue. A voir

English
If you want to witnesses the ancient culture of the people of Bali, a visit to this village is a must. Site of one of the first waves of immigration, the inhabitants of Tenganang have managed to preserve a large part of their way of life and especially the original structure of their village, with the long communal houses that are not found anywhere else on the 'island. You will also be able to witness their artisanal know-how and in this case, the weaving of fabrics (ikat) as well as the art of painting on eggs. A great experience to live if you have never had the opportunity to discover other, more traditional regions of Indonesia

Francais
Si vous souhaitez avoir un aperçu de l’ancienne culture des habitants de Bali, une visite dans ce village s'impose. Lieu d'une des premières vagues d'immigration, les habitants de Tenganang ont su conserver une grande partie de leur mode de vie et surtout la structure originelle de leur village, avec les longues maisons communales qu'on ne retrouve nulle part ailleurs sur l'île. Vous pourrez également assister à leur savoir-faire artisanal et en l'occurrence, le tissage des tissus (ikat) ainsi que l'art de peindre sur des œufs. Une belle expérience à vivre si vous n'avez jamais eu l'occasion de découvrir d'autres régions plus traditionnelles d'Indonésie

Tenganan ist ein Bergdorf auf der Insel Bali mit Einwohnern des Volkes der Bali Aga, etwa drei Kilometer von Candi Dasa entfernt. Es ist eines der wenigen Dörfer Balis, in dem die prä-hinduistische Kultur lebendig geblieben ist. Die Bali Aga bezeichnen sich als Nachkommen der Ureinwohner Balis.

Salah satu dari beberapa desa di Bali yang masih melestarikan budaya asli dan biasa disebut sebagai Bali Aga(Age).  Budaya asli tidak hanya merujuk pada norma dan kebiasaan asli penduduk di tempat ini, namun juga arsitektur dan kerajinan yang bisa disaksikan secara langsung.
Lokasi berada di wilayah perbukitan sehingga berhawa sejuk. Para pengunjung tidak dimintai tiket masuk, melainkan sumbangan seikhlasnya pada bagian loket informasi. Ketika memasuki kawasan ini, atmosfernya seolah membawa saya ke wilayah Bali pada zaman dulu. Benar-benar gaya hidup tradisional dan keasrian yang terjaga. Melihat adanya kendaraan bermotor dan sentuhan barang elektronik seperti tv, ada sedikit kesan bahwa perkembangan teknologi pasti akan terus mengiringi.
Penduduk sekitar juga ramah. Saya sempat berbicara dengan salah satu ibu penenun dan ia menjelaskan dengan baik perbedaan kain-kain yang ada di sana. Seorang bapak juga kemudian ikut berbincang bersama kami, berbicara mengenai keadaan zaman dan pariwisata. Percakapan kami diakhiri dengan ajakan ke festival besar yang diadakan bulan Juli-Juli, sayangnya saya tidak bisa mengunjunginya. Semoga bisa berkunjung lagi.

Quand on nous a invité dans une maison c’était pour nous montrer les conditions de vie et demander de l’argent, quand on a fait une photo on nous a demandé de l’argent, quand on rentre dans le village on vous demande un tips, … la goutte d’eau est quand on nous a demandé (après coup) un tips pour s’être garé. Hors de question, ne vous faites pas avoir…

Ah, Tenganan Pegeringsingan Village in Bali, a timeless enclave where ancient traditions and cultural heritage thrive amidst the lush landscapes of the island. This unique village offers a captivating glimpse into the rich tapestry of Balinese customs and a chance to step back in time to a world untouched by modernity.

As you approach Tenganan Pegeringsingan Village, you'll feel a sense of anticipation building within you. The village is known for preserving its traditional way of life, and you can't help but wonder what wonders await you within its walls.

As you enter the village, you'll be greeted by cobblestone streets and charming thatched-roof houses, exuding an atmosphere of old-world charm. The villagers, known as Bali Aga or "Original Balinese," are warm and welcoming, eager to share their customs and stories with curious visitors like yourself.

The heart of Tenganan Pegeringsingan Village is its unique and vibrant community life. Here, you'll find a tightly-knit society bound by age-old traditions and rituals that have been passed down through generations. Witness the daily activities of the villagers, from traditional weaving to intricate handicrafts, showcasing the artistry and skill that are an integral part of their daily lives.

One of the village's highlights is the mesmerizing process of double ikat weaving, a meticulous technique used to create stunning textiles known as gringsing. The skill required to produce these intricate patterns is a testament to the dedication and craftsmanship of the villagers.

Another fascinating aspect of Tenganan Pegeringsingan Village is its unique custom of "Mekare-kare" or "Perang Pandan." This traditional ritual involves young men engaging in friendly duels using thorny pandan leaves. It's a spectacle that captivates both locals and visitors alike, providing a glimpse into the village's age-old warrior traditions.

But beyond its customs and rituals, Tenganan Pegeringsingan Village also offers a breathtaking natural setting. Surrounded by lush rice terraces and emerald green hills, the village is a haven of serenity and beauty. Take a leisurely stroll through the tranquil landscapes, allowing the essence of Bali's natural beauty to wash over you.

As the day draws to a close, you may choose to stay in one of the village's charming homestays, immersing yourself in the rhythm of daily village life. The experience will leave an indelible mark on your soul, allowing you to connect with the spirit of Bali in a profound and meaningful way.

So, my fellow travelers, if you seek to uncover the heart and soul of Bali, venture to Tenganan Pegeringsingan Village. Embrace the enchanting traditions, admire the craftsmanship, and be captivated by the warm hospitality of its people. It's a journey back in time, where the ancient and the modern intertwine, leaving you with memories that will linger long after you bid farewell to this extraordinary village.

Tenganan Pegeringsingan Village is a hidden gem that exceeded all my expectations. This unique village offers an immersive cultural experience that is truly one-of-a-kind. The village itself is like a living museum, showcasing ancient traditions and a way of life that has been preserved for centuries. The locals are incredibly warm and welcoming, always ready to share their stories and traditions with visitors.

One of the highlights of my visit was witnessing the traditional crafts and arts that are practiced in Tenganan. From intricate weaving to beautiful basketry, the artisans' skills are awe-inspiring. It was a privilege to see their craftsmanship up close and even purchase some unique souvenirs to take home.

The architecture in Tenganan is also remarkable. The traditional houses with their intricate carvings and distinct layout provide a glimpse into the village's rich history.

What struck me the most about Tenganan was the sense of peace and tranquility that enveloped the entire village. Away from the hustle and bustle of modern life, I found myself immersed in a serene atmosphere. The absence of motorized vehicles added to the calmness, allowing me to truly appreciate the beauty of my surroundings.

I highly recommend taking a leisurely stroll through the village, interacting with the friendly locals, and embracing the unique cultural experiences offered. Tenganan Pegeringsingan Village is a must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic, peaceful, and enriching cultural experience. I am grateful for the opportunity to have visited this remarkable place, and it will forever hold a special place in my heart

I really wanted to visit as it sounded amazing, but I was expecting it to be a disappointed; it wasn't!

First of all, there are two villages: the East and the West one, we visited the East that is bigger and has a customary donation suggested.

Indeed the entrance and main road are quite touristic, and feel unauthentic. However if you go into the parallel roads, walk all the way up, get a bit lost inside you will see people do indeed live there and are actually very nice. I got proposed some sate skewers and alcoholic drink that I enjoyed with some local men.

The urban planning of the village and the houses help make it a great experience; we entered a couple of houses, that are also shops, and they are not pushy so do not hesitate - you may end up buying something nice!

Tenganan Village es un pueblo en Karangasem Regency que es un pueblo nativo de Bali era una de las sociedades más aisladas del archipiélago. La mayoría de los aldeanos trabajan como granjeros, pero algunos también trabajan como artesanos. Me tallaron mi nombre en balines y mi diosa y demonio según mes de nacimiento .Precioso y original recuerdo de Bali.Como en todo regateo y más regateo

Ce village décrit comme traditionnel et "hors du temps" fut une déception pour nous. On y voit des motos à tous les coins de rue, et la plupart des maisons sont transformées en magasins de souvenirs. Le guide n'était pas très bavard et nous a uniquement amené dans sa maison pour nous montrer la méthode de tissage: sa femme est arrivée pour utiliser la machine et après 1minute nous a fait comprendre que la démonstration était terminée et qu'on pouvait maintenant passer dans le magasin.

Wunderschönes idyllisches Dorf. Sehr traditionell. Absolut sehenswert durch die Gassen zu spazieren. Der Guide erzählt vieles zu alten Bräuchen. Man fühlt sich dadurch direkt mitgenommen und zurückversetzt. Der „Eintrittspreis“ variiert. Hier bezahlt man eine Spende zur Erhaltung des Dorfes, was ich für absolut angemessen halte. Essen, Getränke und Souvenirs kann man in den alten Stuben ebenfalls erwerben, Achtung allerdings sind diese etwas teurer, als ausserhalb. Fortschrittlich empfand ich, das man mit Kreditkarte oder sogar in Euro bezahlen konnte, der Wechselkurs war tagesaktuell, Rückgekd gabs in Landeswährung
Very touristic way of showing the past, but you're getting a nice impression of it.

In the 1970s, this village was a unique opportunity for anthropologists to study a secluded and traditional community. As a result, this village has become known to the general public for its unique Bali Aga culture and the flow of tourists has started. Both developments which unfortunately make the unique character and culture of the village irrevocably changing. The village has the traditional layout of the Bali Aga: along the longitudinal axis of the village (always aligned between sea and mountains) is a series of communal buildings with the entrance gate of the village on the south side. There are two wide streets on either side of the shared buildings where the residents' houses are located. In a number of these houses the visitor can find the double ikat fabrics for which the village is known. The village is free to visit (a voluntary donation is appreciated), you will not be bothered by souvenir vendors and you can walk around at your leisure. Not an exciting destination (certainly not around noon), but still nice enough to do if you're in the area.

Wij waren op doorreis in dit dorp, in febr 2020.

Desa yang terletak di daerah karangasem manggis ini dihuni oleh masyarakat Bali Aga yang begitu kuat memegang tradisi nenek moyangnya. Masyarakat disana sangat ramah, kebetulan kemarin saya sempat mampir kesana awal masuk saya melihat Sapi ada yang berwarna putih dan hitam, disana juga ada banyak sekali ayam mungkin peliharaan warga, ada juga angsa dan ayam yang besar saya lupa namanya mereka berkeliaran bebas disana. Saya juga bertemu salah saru warga disana yg ramah, saya juga diberikan banyak informasi tentang proses pembuatan kain pegringsingan yang membuat saya tercenang dengan proses pembuatannya yang sangat memakan waktu lama. Menurut informasi di desa ini akan diadakan upacara perang pandan pada bulan Juni... dan ternyata di desa Tenganan ini, mereka masih berpacu pada kalender terdahulu untuk menentukan hari hari besar keagamaannya... unik yaa ...

While taking a taxi to this well preserved village, I got worried about some people mentioning the location being a tourist trap. After spending nearly two hours walking much of the trail and seeing the village I can honestly state that this place is far from a tourist trap. Yes, people try and connect and hope they can sell you something but I never felt pushed and I was probably only asked to come see something only 4 or 5 times. When I did not buy anything after visiting someone’s home and merchandise they did not make me feel bad and remained very friendly and polite. I assume many make their living from selling some locally made merchandise and you do voyeur into their living space so who’s to blame? The village and walking track just give great insight into how people used to live in Bali and some still actually do. Seeing 2 wedding couples in traditional clothing made the trip extra worthwhile.

Notre guide nous a proposé de faire un trekking dans les rizieres et visiter un village traditionnel et nous sommes arrrivés ici (pas lu les avis avant, ne connaissant pas le nom sinon je ne serais pas venue) il nous a dit que le tarif est de 500 000 rph pour nous 4 (pourtant pas de tarif indiqué...) je confirme les autres avis, c est un attrape touriste avec le but de vendre, plusieurs échoppes tout le long du chemin avec une invitation à acheter désagréable.  Le debut etait sympa mais je ne recommande absolument pas, ça m a laissé un sentiment désagréable et nous avons perdu notre temps il y a des paysages plus jolis aux alentours. A fuir

Piacevoli scorci in questo villaggio di campagna dalle tipiche abitazioni balinesi. 
Tra l’altro da qui si parte per un trekking tra le risaie, davvero bello e decisamente meno turistico di altre.

Leider eine absolute Abzocke. Wir haben leider den Fehler gemacht auf die guten Rezensionen zu vertrauen. Angangs war der Guide noch nett, allerdings verloren seine Erzählungen über das Dorf und das „echte Bali“ schnell an Autentizität da er sich mehrmals selbst wiedersprochen hat. Das ganze Dorf war eine aufgesetzte Show der Einwohner sofern diese überhaupt dort leben. Nachdem wir dann in seinem Haus nichts gekauft haben, was offensichtlich nicht selbst genäht wurde, wurde er sehr unhöflich und beendete die Tour sehr schnell. Keien Empfehlung für diese Abzocke und auf keinen Fall machen.

De prime abord, cette visite semblait très intéressante. Nous avons été accueillis très gentiment et guidés par un habitant qui nous a expliqué le fonctionnement et l’histoire de ce village. Très vite il nous a conduit dans une maison pour admirer l’artisanat mais c’était tout simplement une boutique dans laquelle nous étions censés faire des achats. Il s’est avéré que le village compte un nombre impressionnant d’échoppes. Notre refus poli a jeté un léger froid. 
Pour conclure : but de la visite guidée uniquement commercial et un sentiment de malaise avec cet habitant qui m’a fait penser un peu à un gourou… leur philosophie de vie ne m’a pas du tout convaincue !

Questo villaggio caratteristico è tuttora abitato con edifici perlopiù di legno e pietra, anche se è piuttosto turistico e per vederlo bisogna pagare il biglietto. Si percorre su due strade principali parallele.

Short term gain for long term loss. We read some reviews before going so we knew about the sales involved in the tour. We ended up rating this poorly even with this in mind. 

We didn't mind the donation entrance fee. The tour was mildly interesting. But then it turned sour. The guide showed us into his house where him and his wife would try to sell her ikat/sarongs. A lot of the wares were made in factories and I doubt the weaving machine on-show was used to make ikat (we've seen working ones in Flores). There were no signs of dyes, or thread here.

He told his wife (in Indonesian) that we understood Indonesian reasonably well (perhaps so they shouldn't discuss fleecing us too openly). Well fleece they did anyway. It was a really deceitful transaction that left us feeling really manipulated. 

We went to try and support locals and to learn about the people and culture and left with really bad feelings. We were treated like an ATM where the whole purpose of the tour was to gain false trust in order to manipulate you into handing lots over for something that could be purchased in Kuta for minute fractions of the amount they had the audacity to charge.

Don't go. There are much better experiences to be had elsewhere. This behaviour shouldn't be rewarded.

Notre guide nous a accompagné dans le village. Pas d’entrée fixe mais donation selon votre bon cœur. Agréable visite,sans touristes, nous avons été très bien accueillis par les habitants. Village typique et paisible. À voir.

Mooi authentiek dorp waar je een goed beeld krijgt hoe de lokale bevolking leeft.
We hadden het geluk om in de woning van de dame van de weverij te mogen kijken, zij was ook onze gids, en dat was heel bijzonder.

Tijdens ons bezoek waren er geen festiviteiten  wat een bezoek ongetwijfeld nog leuker maakt. Maar evengoed zeer de moeite waard.

We had a very underwhelming tour that left a bad taste in the mouth. Early into the tour our guide offered to show us the inside of his house, where his wife was waiting with a collection of Sarongs on display, much of which was mass produced. He proceeded to try and sell to us for a very uncomfortable and awkward 15 - 20mins. After that his attitude towards us totally changed and he lost all interest in being a good guide. 

We were then taken into another shop with mass produced goods we'd seen all over Bali, which we were again told were hand crafted in the village. We didn't actually see anyone hand crafting anything on our visit or even the tools to do so. We wrongly assumed that paying the donation would prevent these kind of hard-sell techniques, but no it doesn't. From reading other reviews it seems that some others did get to experience tradional village life and culture, while others had a similar experience to ours, so I guess the experience you get is down to luck and whether you get a guide who is genuinely interested in showing you the culture and traditions of their village or one who is just intent in selling his own  goods.

The village is very nice, with remarkable craftsmen, but the highlight of the visit is the beekeeper (A Trigona Bee Farm) at the far end of the village, who sells mango honey and baskets of his own making. He's incredibly kind and will show you his art while offering you lots of little things to taste. A real moment of sharing, we loved it!

So glad we did this village tour! What a lovely and educational day we had with great guides ... funny and informative.
It began with a visit to a local school where we met some kids who practiced their English abilities with us. They were gorgeous! There was a welcome from Barong, a parade through the village with the band and the ladies carrying temple offerings.
Finally we made it to a traditional house where we learnt a bit about Balinese culture, tradition and daily life. We got to see food being prepared, daily offerings made and traditional dance and music while we ate the provided lunch. A family temple is onsite as well as a rice padi out the back of the property. You can have a go at rice planting and/or driving the cow pulled plough!
All in all the day was fantastic and worth every rupiah and a great way to support the village and its inhabitants

Lange rit voor teleurstellend bezoek aan dit oude, met oorspronkelijke bewoners, dorp.
Alleen bij bepaalde ceremonie s lijkt t de moeite waard. Vrijwel alles was dicht en huizen gesloten, op bezoek commerciële weverij na. Bespaar je tijd voor iets leukers

BEWARE of scam. We hoped to see an old fashioned working village but you will be cornered in one of the many shops by extremely hard selling “guides” hawking mass produced stuff that they claim is made on site by artisans. No sign of workshops or production whatsoever. Very awkward and unpleasant experience. If you go, steel yourself. Would not recommend.

This is really exeptional village. Go there early in the morning, because later it is full of turists. Despite turists, you get a good notion of one of Balinese traditions. There are so many - this one is of few preserved.

Don't go if you can help it. We thought paying a nice donation would avoid the "hard sell tactics" but we basically got taken to what seemed like a personal home to buy things. When we said we were here for a tour of the village and not to purchase anything it seemed the tour ended right there. So we stood awkwardly in the little street for a few minutes then just went back to the car and left.... it was a weird experience considering they are probably looking for touristic recommendations.

Superbe très ancien village balinais spécialisé dans le tissage du rare double ikat avec des fils teints de couleurs  naturelles.J'ai adoré assister à ce travail  remarquable  réalisé par les anciennes femmes de Tenganan.
A,noter que Tenganan est au bout d'une impasse au départ de Candi Dasa ,mais ça vaut le détour !

This was our third visit to Tenganan Ancient Village and, frankly, disappointing. Arrived early, office open to receive entrance fee/donation, but no village guides. We were accompanied by our driver and strolled through the village viewing the buildings of which only a few were open. The only people who approached us were the fortune tellers who, for a fee, offered to predict our future.
Amazing place and must visit. Had a little Balinese / Local snacks with great Bali Coffee. Great vibe as well

Ich habe mir mal ein paar Bewertungen durchgelesen und musste teilweise herzlich lachen. Sicherlich ist es kein „Fake Dorf“ - es ist ein antikes Dorf. Die Dorfbewohner darin passen hier und da vielleicht nicht ganz ins authentisch, antike Bild, aber ist ein Dorf wie dieses dann automatisch fake? 

Wir hatten jedenfalls eine schöne Zeit. Etwas lästig ist, dass man an jeder Ecke von Einheimischen angesprochen wir, die einem etwas verkaufen wollen, aber das gehört eben dazu. Wir empfanden die Architektur als wirklich sehenswert. Das Zentrum der Stadt bildet eine längliches Gebäude in welchem damals zeremoniellen Ereignisse stattgefunden haben. Beim nächsten Besuch, buchen wir einen Guide, der uns etwas mehr zur Geschichte erzählen kann :)

We got a tip off by a hotel staff to visit this place. First glance, we liked the place. But soon after we entered the compound, a row of sellers selling all kind of handmade crafts started to call for our attention. The items were overly priced, tourist price. Bargaining  skill comes handy here. 

We walked till the end, passed the small scale restaurant and home from the locals, and then walked back again. We stopped and entered several workshops/homes/ shops. But only 1 which was very interesting (unfortunately we forgot the name). A weaving workshop for the ikat fabric. An old lady was busy weaving the ikat while the host explained to the full length the whole process of the weaving, from how the coloring (tie-dye method) was done to the complexion of weaving techniques. He showed us with the loop the difference between single and double ikat methods on the done product. Very interesting! Because of him, we enjoyed this place.

First off, always strange to go to an “unspoiled” place as a tourist.  Decided to go as it’s been a tourist attraction already for a long time. It’s a lovely little village but it’s odd that it now is mostly focused on ways to sell things to tourists, some not even sourcing from there (ie Javanese antiques).  But the weaving is nice and my child enjoyed the animals walking around. So there you have it…

Piccolo villagio comunitario  abitato da un gruppo che si narra discendere direttamente da Hydra che ha insegnato loro un molto particolare e molto difficile di tessere a doppia trama. Una tappa interessante
No me gustan este tipo de visitas a unos lugares preparados para turistas donde sus habitantes están siendo explotados artificialmente. Nooo

last year i visited tenganan village in November.this year i revisited Bali in June,and came to this village again.this time i came for pandan perang,or pandan war festival.Pandan war was carried out in order to honor the God of War, namely Indra. actually it is not the first time i watch pandan perang. but still want to see. it was hot that day.and the stage for pandan perang is crowded.my mobile phone felt hot too,the system warned me that i must keep it to a cold place.so i cant use it to take photos.luckily,i have other phone,so i wont miss the exiting scene.but this phone felt hot later,so i used my phone alternately.the padan war normally started at 14,00 ,and ended around 15,00, normally the festival is held in june.

Le village est authentique et donne une idée de la culture de cette ethnie,maintenant reconvertie vers le tourisme au vue du nombre de boutiques 
L’endroit est très différent des autres villages de Bali , peu de sourire,et une ambiance assez hostile pour ma part

Can't believe how many years I've been coming to Bali and not been here. Tenganan Dauh Tukad -- not to be confused with the Bali Aga village on Jalan Tenganan - is a beautiful gem. Peaceful - no traffic and so clean and tidy. Entrance fee by donation and taken around by a resident of the village who explained all about the history. Very interesting  and well worth the visit. No pressure into looking around and purchasing.

last month i revisited here when i was going to candidasa,i had a tour with a driver. tenganan village is the last stop.i remembered the first time when i visited here,i bought a lontar painting book.on the second time i visited here,i bought a ikat weaving cloth. and i watched its famous pandan war twice.this time, i visited double ikat weaving workshop and ratten basket shop.i didnt buy any double ikat clothes,cuz the price quite expensive.but i bought two small rattern baskets,the seller explained to me why rattan basket is expensive,cuz  the quality is very good.i agreed with her.that day,i was the last traveller ,so the village is quiet,i felt comfortable.i will come here again,maybe watching pandan war again, or maybe shopping again,or just wandering around the village.

Abbiamo visitato questo antico villaggio insieme alla nostra guida Ari che ci ha spiegato come vivono, cosa producono etc. L'ingresso è a offerta libera. Ci sono anche piccole botteghe dove poter comprare sarong, lavori fatti con il legno o bambù etc. Siamo anche entrati in una casa privata durante la commemorazione di un defunto e l'ospitalità è stata il top.

En soi le village est bien avec les vieux bâtiments.  Pour le reste, c’est un endroit de vente aux touristes.  

Des coqs vivants colorés, très beau à voir, mais pas naturels.

I cant say I know anymore upon leaving than I did on arriving.  Our driver took us here telling us it was a traditional village, like a working museum. When we got there we made an expected 'donation' which I'm happy to do.
We were the only ones there so the village guy took us on a walk through the village.  A very slow walk with a couple of explanations of a few buildings that all seemed to have the same purpose.  We saw a couple of the village children but that was it apart from a few caged roosters (used for cock fighting) and a couple of buffalos.  The only building we were taken inside was a batik fabric place but it was literally just a shop, there was no demonstration or anyone doing anything inside the place. Bit of pressure to look/buy but we kept walking because we didnt find any of the pieces appealing.
It could have been great, but its sadly lacking. If this is a working museum/village then there wasnt much working going on.  It could be beautiful even in an authentic way but it was quite boring because it was literally walking up one street and then down the other.  We didnt visit any homes or learn about any traditional crafts, cooking, music, art or anything else you would expect to at a traditional museum/village.

We visited on a hot sleepy afternoon - wonderful tranquil village where you can visit homes and learn about traditional crafts and ceremonies. Our guide was a really decent man and there was absolutely NO pressure to buy. It's a living village - not a museum - and a precious bit of Bali. Definitely recommend.
Er was letterlijk niks hier. Alleen maar winkeltjes. De mensen zitten buiten, op zich fotootje waard. Misschien dat met een hele bus erheen leuker is, met zn tweeën niet

Our hired driver took us here without doing any research. If I had have read the comments on TA I probably wouldn't have gone. In saying that our guide in the village was fantastic. He was very educational. We did end up in his home where he tried to sell us sarongs and artwork at exorbitant prices. We ended up buying a Bali map for 400k to save face as we felt a bit embarrassed. Think twice before going.

We were really excited to do this tour and gain insight into traditional Balinese life. It started with meeting our local guide who was lovely, friendly and full of information. We were then asked if we’d like to see his house, we walked inside and it was basically a shop with his wife standing there. We were then stuck there for an awkward 20 minutes while he continued to pressure us to buy sarongs and maps. When we eventually got out by basically just walking out, his demeanour completely changed and he barely spoke, power walked and was almost rude as he whipped us back to the car. Once there he continued to pressure our driver to tell him where we were staying. 

It’s sad to have to leave this review but I feel that other visitors should be aware of what happens here. While I understood that this is how they make an income, it was an extreme amount of pressure to buy while in someone’s home and was a very uncomfortable experience.

Helt sikkert et besøg værd. Spændende at se hvordan de gamle lokalsamfund var bygget op. Vores guide var en lokal mand fra byen, og vi fik mulighed for at se hans hjem. Han fulgte os rundt i byen i ca 1,5 times tid. Flere steder blev vi hevet ind for at se på håndlavede kalendere (laves af mændene) og håndlavet stof, saroner, tørklæder (laves af kvinderne) - i håbet om at vi ville købe noget. Så hav lige i baghovedet at de naturligvis meget gerne vil sælge til jer. Vi takkede nej, men betalte et valgfrit beløb i indgangen (vi lagde ialt 200.000 for 2 prs) og så gav vi guiden drikkepenge bagefter. Tag forbi hvis det er første gang du er på Bali.

Nous avons eu la chance en allant découvrir cet ancien village préservé de tomber sur le tournage d'un clip pour une chanteuse Balinaise avec des jeunes filles et garçons habillés de manière traditionnelle avec de beaux costumes et aussi 2 couples de futurs mariés qui faisaient des photos en vue de leur mariage….  un supplément très agréable en plus de la visite de ce village tranquille

Byn Tenganan var en gång områdets mest isolerade del. Men än i dag så bevaras den gamla s.k. Bali Agakulturen och traditionen i byn. Vi var där på förmiddagen och det syntes inte till så många människor. Men vi blev visade runt i byn. Det hände inte så mycket i byn. Nån som gick och sopade bort skit.

Wij hebben Tenganan 2 maal bezocht. Toen er een bijzonder feest aan de gang was was het geweldig leuk om hier rond te kijken. De Bali Aga die hier leven horen bij de rijkeren van Bali. De bevolking is niet echt vriendelijk. Toen wij tijdens ons 2e bezoek aan Bali nog een keer dit dorpje bezochten was het uitgestorven, leuk om even rond te lopen maar Penglipuran bijvoorbeeld is dan interessanter. 

We visited Tenganan 2 times. The first time there were religious festivities so this was very nice to see. The Bali Aga people who live here are one of the richest in Bali. The second time we visited it was just a nice village to walk about, nothing extraordinary. The people don't talk to you (only when they want to sell souvenirs), not very nice. As a village Penglipuran is much more interesting to see.

Wir waren auch dort. Absoluter Fake. Die Frau am Webstuhl konnte das Gerät nicht einmal bedienen und erklärte uns wie viel Schals sie produziert. Handys, Mopeds und Strassenhändler alles vertreten wie sonst überall auf Bali.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: The Government of Bali has decided to preserve Turtles. Therefore this activity is started. Once in a while it is okay to visit to see the exact process of turtles.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Pelayananya bagus

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Something felt incredibly wrong the moment we arrived here. The animals looked terribly depressed and stressed. I felt like they needed rescuing from this place! We kept getting pressured to ‘adopt’ a turtle even after paying $50 per per for entry. I would like this place to undertake a formal review to ensure animals really are being released back into the wild.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Part of the glass bottom tour. They do try to sell you a lot of stuff - release a turtle, pictures, etc.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
UNNGÅ!!
Super triste tilstander, unngå om du bryr deg om dyrevelferd!! Skitne og små akvarier til voksne skilpadder hvor de har noen som er opp til 80 år. I tillegg har de fugler som er lenket fast i små bur, og skylder på at de er er lenket fast på grunn av kineserene som kommer for å ta bilde med dem (?).

I tillegg skal de ansatte gi deg dårlig samvittighet for at de ikke får lønn, og at du må kjøpe souvenir. Vi endte opp med å betale for slippe løs en en baby skilpadde, var bare en vond opplevelse, aner ikke om den overlevde ettersom man slipper den løs midt i havet der jetski og båter kjører i full fart. Drar derfra med en dårlig magefølelse.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Worth the visit if you like a close encounter with sea turtles.

The road leading there was quite horrible and close to the water cliff.

Entrance costs 300k for 2 adults and 2 kids.

The large pond didn't have enough water to cover the upper shell of the 80yo sea turtle. His back was quite hot from the sunlight.

100k bucket full of seaweed (and plastic straws etc accidentally stuck inside) was thrown to our kids without the parents agreeing in advance. That was unethical in business.

350k per turtle to be released. With boat it'd cost 1M. Certificate was full of typos.

Showed around the other animals. Huge python with mouth taped off. Keepers claimed that the tape will be taken off at the end of the day. Press X for doubt.

Keeper was banging the bat cage for the guy to wake up. Owl was distressed and kept on a rope leash.

Strongly encouraged to buy pictures that the guy shot constantly. 150k per picture.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Hello everyone we are transportation around Bali island

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: I visited this site with family, and the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable and seemed to genuinely care about the turtles and other animals. Some reviewers complain about the animals conditions, but everything was fine when I was there, and all the turtles and other animals seemed very happy and welcomed our interaction with them (well mainly our treats!). A lot of tourists seem to forget this is Bali, and the conditions of the facility are no different than 90% of the island, they do their best with their limited budget.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Good experience for kids
They can close contact with the animals here and the sea turtle.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Saya baru aja dari pulau Penyu..cuma nggak suka cara pemandu meladeni kita ,dari awal sdh menstatement utk pembiayaan selalu diomongin hanya uang saja.Kita paham mrk butuh dana utk pemeliharaan penyu itu,Tapi kita kan niat mau wisata jd kesal dengernya…berikan kami menikmati dulu baru stelah selesai itu di jelaskan klu ingin donatur…….di persilahkan..
Nah klu spt itu para wisatawab jd mls kesana lagi.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Unforgettable experience. Thank you so much, for showing us around, you are doing amazing work with your heart and care❤️.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Great experience. Per pax 100k.Rp. Tips Per pax 50k.Rp. Conservation 500k.Rp.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Pricey

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
The Deluang Sari Turtle Conservation Center aims to protect and rehabilitate sea turtles, offering visitors a chance to learn about these creatures and their conservation. The center provides educational insights into the life cycle of turtles, to release the turtles for a fee.

The area also had an area where there were animals which you could hold and take photos.
Printing of photos was available.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Nice place to enjoy the wonderful water creatures of Island like turtles and fishes. Also you can spend beautiful time with well trained pets like Eagle, Rare Owl, Macao Parrot, Iguana and also very sharp and intelligent pair of Toucan Birds.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Ganz schlimmer Ort, reine Tierquälerei. Bitte nicht hinfahren!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Had the best time. Our guide( who volunteers) was very knowledgeable.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Penyunya banyak, ada yg berumur 80th lhoo, bisa ngasih makan juga. Ada hewan lain seperti burung, ular, biawak, kelelawar. Ada warungnya bisa jajan2 dl lah yaa, kmren beli kopi segelas 20rb, es krim 20rb.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
One of the most horrific and distressing trips we have ever been on. We were taken here by a guide we had trusted as a spontaneous stop, as it was en route to another spot.

I wish we had done a quick Google search before handing over 1.4m IDR for two people (should be mentioned, we were originally quoted 2.4m!!). The glass bottom boat was nothing but a fishing boat with a very small window in the bottom, through which you could only see seaweed and water. We were given a crust of bread to hurriedly feed the fish, of which we saw only one species.

The island itself was nothing more than a tourist trap with some incredibly sad-looking animals, either caged up or in tiny tanks. There were at least 10 large sea turtles in one horrifyingly small pool. All the animals were being handled by everyone and used for photo ops - for example, you were encouraged to enter a cage to look at a fruit bat up close and clap to wake it up, after being told it sleeps during the day!

The staff were pestering for donations, as they claimed they were no longer receiving government support. Apparently the 1.4m IDR we had already forked out was nothing to do with the island, but who knows. We can’t believe that this relates to legitimate conservation work at all. The whole experience was awful, and we would urge everyone to avoid at all costs.

I want to add that this is written by someone who is visiting Bali for the first time, and looked forward the most throughout the trip to seeing sea turtles for the first time in his life, along with his wife. The experience was distressing and left us feeling very sad, disappointed and cheated.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Dari nusa dua nyebrang pakai kapal bayar 100k/ org trus sampai disini kayak ga bisa nyantai.. dikejar2 gitu

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Excellent fun, well worth visiting.. the staff are amazing as well

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Ik walg van deze mensen.!! Ga hier niet heen!!! Als ik -5000 sterren kon geven deed ik dat, alles maar dan ook echt alles in dit zogenaamde turtle preservation park is opgezet om geld uit te slaan. Op geen enkele wijze blijkt dat deze dieren ooit nog vrijgelaten worden. Slangen met dichtgetapete bekken, vogels aan de ketting en schildpadden die in veel te kleine bassins zitten puur voor toeristenvermaak. De dieren die hier zitten zijn puur en alleen om geld aan te verdienen en zitten in een slecht onderkomen. De hele opzet van dit gebeuren is om geld aan toeristen te verdienen met werkelijk alles, ze proberen je ter plaatse van alles aan te smeren. Ze willen je laten betalen voor het voeren van de dieren, goedkope nepsouvenirs aansmeren, foto's verkopen en zelfs naar het toilet gaan moet voor betaald worden. Woekerprijs van 76 euro betaald voor 2 personen voor een 10 minuten durend boottripje met een zogenaamde glassbottom boot om "schildpadden te zien" (die er niet zijn) om op deze plek te komen. Dat terwijl het helemaal geen eiland is, het ligt gewoon aan vaste land. Pure ripp-off om "domme" toeristen te scammen  nogmaals trap er niet in!!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Actually dunno how to feel about this. Our guide was so nice told about that is non govr. organisation. We adopt turtle for two of us was it 700 000 rp all together we felt great after visiting organization seems really improved after I saw reviews. But still have weird felling when I saw snakes in taped heads.When we visited water was clean, they seems really curious w turtles,we got answers on all our questions. On our visit was no snakes.We didn't feel there is any currently on animal people there seems to be so good and they love animals. Maybe they just good liars :D hard no say really. If is it how they said I realy recommend to visit. Other aminals like iguanas,monkey,olw been in cages they told us bc of actually rainy season here. They mentioned they are free to room around during the day, but closed at night, when it rains.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Je déconseille fortement cette visite.

Les conditions de vie des tortues sont alarmantes : elles sont enfermées dans de petits bassins, à peine profonds, sans aucun respect pour leurs besoins naturels. On est très loin d’un vrai centre de conservation : c’est une attraction touristique déguisée, sans finalité éducative ni écologique. Les tortues sont manipulées toute la journée pour des photos, ce qui cause un stress évident chez ces animaux sauvages.

Le personnel est également très insistant tout au long de la visite, vous pousse à acheter des options supplémentaires et n’hésite pas à réclamer des pourboires à la fin, ce qui rend l’expérience encore plus désagréable. On se sent clairement piégé dans un circuit purement commercial.

Je regrette d’y être allé. Si vous tenez un minimum au bien-être animal, passez votre chemin et renseignez-vous sur de vrais centres de protection comme celui de Serangan, qui lui fait un travail sérieux et respectueux.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Visite mitigée… La Ferme des Tortues propose effectivement un grand nombre d'animaux différents, mais très vite, on se rend compte que tout est pensé pour le tourisme de masse. Chaque enclos, chaque bassin semble n'exister que pour permettre aux visiteurs de prendre des photos "exotiques", souvent au détriment du bien-être animal.

Le lieu manque clairement d’authenticité et de pédagogie : on en ressort avec plus de selfies que de connaissances sur les tortues ou sur leur préservation. L’approche est malheureusement très superficielle.

Le seul véritable moment touchant et porteur de sens reste la libération des bébés tortues en mer. Ce geste symbolique, bien que court, reconnecte à l’essentiel et donne un peu de sens à une visite par ailleurs très commerciale.

En résumé : une attraction très touristique, presque trop, avec une belle idée de départ qui se perd un peu dans la recherche de rentabilité.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
It's a horrible place with all the animals in a terrible state. I was told the animals were all rescued and they are released once they have recovered.  Frankly, this is a total lie.  Do not go there, the place need to be shut down.
I was so angry and upset when I got there! Shame on them!

review_text: ANIMAL ABUSE !!!! THIS PLACE NEEDS TO BE SHUT DOWN IMMEDIATELY!!!! Most of the "good" reviews are from bots or people who must be blind to animal torture!!!! Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Mixed feelings about our visit here. We came mainly because the kids were excited to see turtles up close — and they absolutely loved the experience. From their perspective, it was magical, and they were completely oblivious to the bigger picture.

But as a parent and someone who cares about animal welfare, I couldn’t ignore the concerning conditions the turtles and other wildlife were kept in. The enclosures felt small and poorly maintained, and the presence of other animals like birds and reptiles didn’t seem aligned with a true conservation effort.

Sadly, while the experience was memorable for the kids, it will be our first and last visit to this place. I’ll definitely be looking for alternative sanctuaries or centers that prioritize the health and dignity of the wildlife in their care. I truly hope to see more transparency and better conditions here in the future.

review_text:
Musím říct, že už bych sem nejela! Mají zde zvířata, která rozhodně nejsou zachráněna, ale pouze pro ukázku a držená na řetězu. Průvodce nám od první chvíle vysvětloval, z čeho je on placený a z jakých peněz krmí zvířata. Dost na nás tlačil, i když říkal že netlačí.
Podle mého názoru je celý koncept strašně špatně postavený. Spíše je to hra na city “adoptujte si želvu”. Zaplatíte 400k za adopci želvy a její vypuštění do moře. Pak 100k jako spropitné pro průvodce. Před výletem samozřejmě poplatek za loď a vstup do “rezervace” na ostrově.
Doufám, že jsme alespoň pomohly vypuštěným želvám, aby na tomto místě neuvízly.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Di sini kita bisa melihat penyu langka di lindungi, di pelihara sebelum kembali di lepas liarkan. Pengunjung bisa berinteraksi langsung dg penyu dg cara memberinya makanan yang sudah di siapkan. Kita juga di jelaskan secara detail dg sangat ramah oleh petugas. Selain melihat penyu pengunjung jg bisa berfoto dg ular, burung hantu dan burung engang. Sedikit info di sini untuk bayar foto sedikit lebih mahal anggap saja untuk menyumbang kawasan konservasi ini.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Deluang Sari Turtle Conservation Center: Nơi Ươm Mầm Hy Vọng Cho Đại Dương
Đặt chân đến Deluang Sari Turtle Conservation Center, bạn sẽ cảm nhận được một không gian yên bình, nơi những nỗ lực thầm lặng đang ngày đêm vun đắp hy vọng cho tương lai của loài rùa biển quý hiếm. Không ồn ào, náo nhiệt như những điểm du lịch khác, trung tâm mang đến một cái nhìn chân thực và sâu sắc về công tác bảo tồn đầy thách thức.
Chứng kiến những chú rùa con bé xíu vừa nở, những cá thể rùa trưởng thành đang được chăm sóc tỉ mỉ, bạn sẽ không khỏi xúc động trước sự kỳ diệu của thiên nhiên và ý thức được trách nhiệm của con người trong việc bảo vệ chúng. Các bể ươm sạch sẽ, thông tin giáo dục trực quan và sự nhiệt tình của đội ngũ nhân viên đã truyền tải một cách mạnh mẽ thông điệp về tầm quan trọng của việc bảo tồn rùa biển.
Deluang Sari không chỉ là nơi bảo vệ mà còn là cầu nối giữa con người và thiên nhiên. Du khách có cơ hội tìm hiểu về vòng đời, tập tính của rùa biển, những nguy cơ mà chúng đang phải đối mặt và những hành động thiết thực mà mỗi người có thể đóng góp. Rời khỏi trung tâm, trong lòng mỗi người sẽ đọng lại một sự trân trọng sâu sắc đối với đại dương và những sinh vật kỳ diệu đang sinh sống ở đó, cùng với một niềm tin vào những nỗ lực bảo tồn đầy ý nghĩa này. Đây thực sự là một điểm đến mang tính giáo dục cao và khơi gợi cảm xúc mạnh mẽ.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This place doesn't exist. As we were travelling there, we were accosted by a lady at a different turtle farm, claiming to be the same place. (Take note "farm" not conservation centre or sanctuary). Keep in mind they will all claim to be the place that you actually want to go to.

We walked away to where it was located on the map and saw some pitiful sights of animals kept in unsuitable conditions through back alley fences along the way there.

When we got there, it wasn't even there. It's just a big bike shed. And we were once again greeted by a lady from a different farm, claiming to be this business.

Just be wary of these turtle businesses around this area. Very shady.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Terbaik

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Where do I being. Firstly, this place is not worth the price. We took a glass boat that only had a small portion of it as glass to feed fish and that was not exciting in the least. We were told we had to pay for the boat to get to turtle island which doesn't make sense since we can't walk there.

Secondly, Its not an island of turtles as I previously thought since it's called "turtle island"... but when we arrived, it was a few tanks with turtles and and a small pond with alot of turtles ( i don't know how they all manage to fit in this habitat).

The other animals were a snake, an owl, a toucan, a bat and some iguanas. Their enclosures look terrible and unkept. What was unsettling was seeing how tight the snakes mouth was taped. I hate seeing animals kept in environments like this (chained, and in old, small cages).

We were told that the people that work here are volunteers but as soon as we arrived all we could hear was talk about "donations."

This place is not worth any price and the animals should be in better facilities. Nothing about this place impressed me.

We didn't want to go here in the first place but the lady was persistent and got upset that we wanted to leave. Eventually someone else came and dropped the price to half which should have raised my suspicion immediately.

review_text: This place is an absolute hole.  DO NOT GO!  We were told it was a sanctuary and paid a small fortune (almost AUD200!!!) For the glass bottom boat tour where were promised a variety of fish and reefs but only got a few mins of fish feeding and then zooming through.   This hole was so distressing as we have actively avoided exploitative animal attractions and i feel so silly and wish I'd read the reviews first instead of being pressured in.  The turtles were sad but nothing could have prepared me for the birds chained up in dirty cages.  Awful place.  And then to top it off the staff are so pushy for tips.  Please do not visit!

review_text: A definite SKIP. We were given two different price lists. One “meant for foreigners” at insane prices, and for locals, then were told that they’d give us the ‘local price’, which were still really expensive. The glass floor boats were useless because the water is really dirty and murky. The turtle island itself is really dirty and feels like a fish market. Avoid at all costs. End up spending more than 1 million IDR and for nothing.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
NICHT HINGEHEN!!!!!!!
Extrem schlimme Erfahrung. Uns hat eine Dame rumgeführt, die angeblich für das "Schildkröten Spital" freiwillig arbeitet und kein Geld erhält. Die Schildkröten leben auf extrem engen Raum mit schmutzigem Wasser. Zusätzlich gab es weitere Tiere (Fledermäuse, Vögel, Eulen, Schlangen), die genauso schlecht behandlet werden. Fotos werden von dir gemacht, damit sie dir dann verkauft werden. Der Guide hat sämtliche male erwähnt, dass sie freiwillig arbeitet, arm ist und nur von Trinkgeld lebt. Als wir auf ihre Frage hin erzählt haben, dass wir aus der Schweiz sind, hat sie davon geschwärmt wie Europäer viel Trinkgeld geben, immer lieb sind, Chinesen/Inder seien aber frech, da sie nie Trinkgeld geben usw. Trinkgeld war definitiv nicht verdient. Man zahlt Eintrittsticket, alles innerhalb des "Spitals" kostet. Immer wieder wird das Thema Geld, Trinkgeld erwähnt und jegliches (Fotos, Futter, Souvenir) verkauft mit dem Anreiz "den Tieren zu helfen". Und jedesmal wird behauptet, dass man nicht unter Druck setzen will, aberrr...... das probieren sie definitiv. Hat uns leider den Tag versaut.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Opis wycieczki nie pasuje do miejsca totalnie... Polecił nam to miejsce kierowca, zakładam że coś z tego ma z perspektywy czasu. Za 4 osoby zapłaciliśmy 1 600 000 rupii, ale jakby nie pieniądz jest tu problemem. Miejsce nastawione na biznes. Przewodnicy proszą się o napiwki, zwierzęta można dotykać ale przy samych żółwiach jest się chwilę. Pozostałe klatki to egzotyczne zwierzęta. Pamiątki mają ceny mocno z kosmosu. Czas zwiedzania max 60 min. Po drodze są karmione rybki... Chlebem.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Do not recommend. We were under the impression that this was a “conservation” or a “sanctuary” for turtles. They said the turtles were there in the hospital for rehabilitation from being in the ocean with plastic and predators, however one of the areas they were keeping the turtles was full of rubbish. The other turtles were swimming in dirty shallow water in a very small and crowded tank. They then showed us other animals- cockatoos, owls, toucans, snakes, bats, turkeys and iguanas. This made us very sad. The owl was chained up and was trying to fly away at one stage, the snakes had their mouths taped shut, one of the toucans looked so miserable and frightened (I’m not even sure why they have these animals in a “turtle hospital”). They were very persistent and wanted us to all get photos with the animals, when told no they kept egging us on. They then wanted us to purchase photos that they took of us with the turtle statue, they took us to a shop with random stuff to buy, we also noticed a sign in the toilet saying 2000 rp!! Why are they charging us to use the toilet?!! The lady showing us around also mentioned a few times that she was just a volunteer and she only gets paid off of tips, insinuating she wanted us to give her money. Do not waste your time here! I wish I had read the reviews on this place before coming and I hope this enough to deter people from spending their money on going.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Absolut schrecklich!
Bleibt diesem Ort fern. Ich kann die 5-Sterne-Bewertungen nicht verstehen. Wer diesen Ort mit einem guten Gefühl verlässt, hat kein Herz für Tiere. Schildkröteneier, die aus ihrem natürlichen Lebensraum entrissen werden, um sie dann penetrant an Touristen "verkaufen" zu wollen. Man wird gedrängt eine Schildkröte zu adoptieren, nicht um den Schildkröten mit dem Geld zu helfen, sondern damit der Mitarbeiter bezahlt wird? So eine Ausbeutung von Tieren sieht man selten.
Ältere Schildkröten, die absichtlich nicht gefüttert werden, damit sie zu den Touristen kommen, damit sie etwas zu fressen erhalten. Sie leben in einem dreckigen Tümpel übereinander gereit. Auf die Nachfrage, wieso die älteren Tiere hier sind, kam die Antwort, "für die Touristen".
Leider sind die Schildkröten nicht die einzigen Tiere, die hier leiden müssen. Vögel, Eulen und Fledermäuse, die angekettet auf einem Metallstab sitzen und sich nicht frei bewegen können. Schlangen, denen das Maul zugeklebt wurde, damit man Fotos machen kann. Und dann sieht man zurückgebliebene Touristen, die davon freudig ihre Fotos und Video machen und dies als ein tolles "Rescue-Projekt" sehen? Da stellt sich die Frage, ob manche Menschen ihre Menschlichkeit verloren haben.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This is a terrible place. They say they are a conservation for turtles and they release them after a certain age. They had 4 areas with turtles. The babies, young, middle age, and old. The oldest turtle there is 20 years old. I asked why that turtles wasn’t released yet and the answer I got was “he isn’t old enough yet.” The other turtles were 4 years and 10 years old. The lady said they kept those for breeding. The babies she said they release once matured. I asked an age of released and her response was “well you can adopt one and we will release it.” Then she said we could feed them so our group fed every ounce of food they gave us and the poor turtles were stepping on each other to get to food. Then, I turned the corner only to find other animals. Amongst these animals were birds that’s were chained and a snake that had his mouth taped. I couldn’t even ask questions, I got so mad I walked away as she was talking to me.

The only positive thing about this place is that they use a filter system so when it’s high tide the turtles get actual ocean water into their tanks. But then again the ocean was so full of trash I truly do not know if it is a positive thing or not.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Animals are in deplorable conditions. Tiny turtles in like a 20 gallon tank and big turtles in shallow pools, one on top of the other. Birds are chained up and snake has tape around it's mouth to keep it from biting. Please do not support.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I wish I’d read the reviews of this place before going. I thought it was a turtle sanctuary / conservation based. The conditions made me cry and still hours later I feel so conflicted that I went here with my family. This place is unethical, animals are not treated well and the place is so run down. I wanted to leave and was probably naive to the spiel initially that more money was needed to improve conditions. Birds in small cages, snake’s mouth taped over, turtles in dirty water. My heart breaks for what is an animal jail.

The Boat ride over on a glass bottom boat where the glass was so dirty you couldn’t see anything.

Expensive scam that is basically torturing animals. Do not go.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Turtle Island is a must visit. You will see 100 years old turtles and other creatures.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Nous étions deux personnes et avons payé 90 € par personne pour une excursion censée inclure une heure de snorkeling et une visite de l'île aux tortues. Malheureusement, ce fut une déception totale.

1. Conditions des animaux : Les tortues sont enfermées dans un enclos rempli d’eau sale avec de nombreux excréments. C’était vraiment triste à voir.
2. Mauvais traitement des animaux : Un singe était attaché avec une chaîne en fer, et nous avons vu un serpent et deux pélicans qui semblaient drogués. C’est inacceptable.
3. Aucune valeur : Le snorkeling était tout aussi décevant, et l'expérience globale ne vaut absolument pas les 90 € par personne. Vous finissez par payer cher pour une activité sans aucun intérêt.

En résumé, je déconseille fortement cette excursion. Cela n'a fait que nous faire perdre notre temps et notre argent, tout en étant témoin de la maltraitance des animaux.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This place was more of a concentration camp for animals than a conservation place ,  exploiting animals for profit is their modus operandi,  they put sticky tape on the snakes mouths which is great for the timid tourists handling them , but rather distressing for the snake , the chains around the legs of the exotic parrots was a nice touch,  also the filthy pond which had baby turtles both living and dead ones floating aimlessly was another brilliant attraction,  if you enjoy watching animal cruelty you need to visit this place

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Itu tempat nya turis trap. di web harga nya Rp. 10.000 tapi pas datang digetok Rp100.000. untuk survey juga mereka tidak memperbolehkan, dan penangkaran sekitar nya pun sama digetok harga yang mahal Rp.100.000. Mereka mau menurunkan RP50.000 tapi itu juga masih sangat mahal untuk sekedar melihat penyu, mereka mempermainkan harga!

It's a tourist trap. On the website the price is $ 0,66 but when you arrive they charge you $6,60. They also don't allow you to do a survey, and the surrounding breeding grounds also charge a high price of $6,60. They want to lower it to $3,30 but that's still very expensive just to see the turtles, they're playing with the price!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Avoid at all costs. It deserves -5 stars as a minimum.
There is no animal welfare whatsoever. God knows how many fully grown adult turtles are living in a muddy puddle.
This place is designed to separate you from your money in as many ways as possible.
Don’t be fooled into a boat trip to “the island” from the Bintamg water sports centre.
It’s actually on the same peninsula and can be reached by car. We couldn’t get out of there fast enough.
