The most disturbing thing is the bird who was terrified of the keeper, very stressed, when approached the bird was squawking, hissing and bristling its neck feathers, the bird would obediently jump on to the visitors arm when the keeper approached, running off terrified after, when I mentioned its stress the guide said “ he likes it “ or they love massage, it was encouraged to hold and pat each animal.
 There was a very big group of kids and families, kids chasing the birds anything goes here, appalling !!!! , I felt very sad after visiting.
Needs urgent action 
Worst of all the people are so friendly and lovely making a living as best they can, completely unaware of what is ethical or of basic animal care they just can’t comprehend how to care for the animals if only somebody could show the way here.
Why are the monkeys there and not at the monkey park orphanage? We where told they where hurt and will be released in two years

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We bargaind down to $80 US and what a frigging rip off. Boat was dirty, the operator stopped over some fish and just about gased us all, we told him to keep moving. The water was full of trash on the 10 minute boat ride to the most horrendous cages and dirty pools of water to supposedly see animals in a conservation area on the inlet not an Island.  Then you pay for a someone to take you through the cesspool and to use their gross bathrooms.Don't fool yourself every guide gets a cut of where they take you that charges admission and thats how we ended up there to get a ride on the boat with his friend. Do not let them take you to places to eat that they pick, choose your own and have them stop there. If people stop going then maybe those animals can be set free.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Only gave it a 1 because I had too. Please do not visit this place and continue the suffering of these poor animals. Concrete pens with inches of water so you can get in and pet these majestic creatures. Other animals kept in inhumane conditions. We will be reporting this place to international authorities for urgent action.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is an amazing place and you enjoy the ride in the boat. You feel you are with thr turtles. The guides are very helpful.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
The visit to Turtle island was awful.it is claimed that it is for turtle conservation. It is like a zoo out of the dark ages.animals kept in concrete enclosures with no vegetation. The big poor sea  turtles have not enough water to swim and are crowded into a small space. 
There are other animals like snakes and they have their mouths taped together so they can't bite. Owls sitting on a perch without a tree.
The whole place is horrible and a money making scam .I hope they do have eggs in the sand and release hatchlings but there is a better way without being cruel to the animals.
The business should be banned! Until they take care of the animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Das Ganze wird als Auffangstation und Hilfsprojekt für Meeresschildkröten getarnt. Tatsächlich ist es eine Art Zoo, wo die Tiere unter katastrophalen Umständen gehalten werden
Den Schlangen wurde mit Klebeband Augen und Maul aufgeklebt und die anderen Tiere in kleinen verdreckten Käfigen gehalten. 
Ich rate dringend von einem Besuch ab.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Not that nice but we enjoy it.. it is not clean and messy.. i hope they clean it and utilize the place in better way

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I failed to do my "homework" before going. We were running out of places to go to, and our guide-cum-driver spontaneously suggested this place, saying the kids would like it. We agreed, without any idea what it was all about.

We got to the jetty where we had to haggle with the boat operator to get us to the island. This was when it should have set alarm bells ringing, but I failed to pay heed because they did a good job getting the children excited about seeing animals etc as a distraction. 

The operator first quoted some price that was plain insane, to probably test our "appetite", observing our facial expressions carefully. When he noticed we were not impressed, he quickly add "but... because we are all Asians, I give you big discount" and offered a less ridiculous, but still ridiculous, price.

I was about to walk away when he offered another "best price", and this to-and-fro on the endlessly adjustable "final best price" just went on for several rounds before it got to a point when at I was just tired of the process, and when I knew at least I would not be feeling silly and kicking myself, and agreed, just to get on with our day.

We had a boat to ourselves (my family and our guide). The boatman must have been the most accomplished sailor ever, being able to steer a boat with his foot and save his hands for cigarettes. He brought us somewhere five minutes out where he handed out some bread to the kids to throw in the water, to attract fish which we could see from the small glass panel at the bottom of the boat.

After getting rid of the bread, we continued on the ride to the island, about 10 minutes away. Upon approaching, we saw the signs which informed us we were approaching a "sanctuary", and the boatman added that the amount we paid for the boat ride actually included a "donation" to the "sanctuary" on our behalf. Sounded like we were doing something nice for the animals at this point.

We were assigned a "guide" at the entrance who would bring us around the place. To his credit, he was friendly and tried his best to keep the children happy. However, his individual efforts could not get us to ignore the signs that "sanctuary" was quite likely a misrepresentation.

The guide claimed that many of the animals were rescued and brought to the island for conservation. To give them the benefit of the doubt, since there was no way of verifying the animals' histories, it was possible to take their word for it that the animals were indeed rescued from somewhere. However it did feel like they were brought to the "sanctuary" for exploitation rather than conservation. 

There were no rules of engagement for the tourists, and we were even encouraged to pick up the animals (ignoring the animals' and our discomfort) for picture-taking. In some instances, the island guide literally shoved the animals at us, telling us not to be shy, and even suggested silly poses with the creatures for the camera.

My children (2 and 5 yo) do like animals in general, and did enjoy themselves on the visit, thinking it was a treat to be allowed to interact with the animals up close, and being to young to be able to fully comprehend the ethical issues. However, the adults did not feel too comfortable on the visit. Guess we learned our lesson, to do some research and read some reviews before visiting the next "sanctuary".

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Don‘t visit this “sanctuary”. It is a living hell for the animals. Look at the pictures and see for yourself!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: It’s a relatively small place with a lot of turtles and also other kinds of animals. You can do a quick trip while doing other water sports activities at the tanjung benoa beach. It’s about 5 minute boat ride to this place from the main water sports center.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Did this as part of a snorkeling trip, it is horrible very cruel the poor turtle are kept in only a little water and the snakes have there mouth tapped together, please don't support this

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: ヌサドゥアのグランドミラージュホテルのビーチからグラスボートに乗ったら、途中で休憩地としてここに到達。最初は何か怪しい物でも売り付けられるのか？と身構えてしまうような見栄えの施設でしたが、従業員さん達はみんな優しくてサービス精神旺盛。ウミガメへの餌やり体験や、ニシキヘビ、イグアナ、ペリカン？との触れ合いなど、小さい場所ながら濃い時間が過ごせました。入場料はひと家族60万ルピアなので500円くらい？あと動物保護への支援、ということで動物との触れ合い写真を買うと150万ルピア(約1200円)かかりましたが、この施設を応援したくなって喜んで払いました。とにかくチャンスがあれば是非子連れで訪れてください。

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Despite having read poor reviews we decided to take a boat trip here to decide for ourselves. From the first seconds of arriving you are under no illusion at what a hellhole this is for the animals. Loads of Adult turtles in a concrete pool, families wandering amongst them, touching , and generally filling the pool with bacteria. Even witnessed a young lad laying in the water to the hilarity of the staff. The turtles are treated so poorly its unbelievable. One adult Turtle was in a pool alone in about an inch of water, I asked what the deal was with the animal, the lady said it had been unwell for 3 months and was recovering.  I then asked the man who appeared to be running the show and he told me that it was sleeping. Upon challenging what he said he then barked at his staff member for telling me it was unwell. This particular character walks about the place shouting at visitors to pick up the various animals including a massive lizard,Snakes, various chained birds and even encouraged people to go into a bats cage, which suspiciously hung from one leg,for photos while it supposedly slept. I have never seen anything like it in my life. Please do not go there, it is barbaric.  I do not claim to be the worlds most dedicated animal lover but what I saw has left me with sadness and total disbelief. The squalor,  poor treatment and disregard for the animals here speak for itself. Avoid this place if offered a trip.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We visit turtle island while staying with Grand Mirage it was great, my boys loved seeing all the animals, our tour guide was very happy and informative, shame a monsoon came while visiting we just had to wait it out

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: The guide that met me was lovely but then proceeded to very quickly move me through the various animal enclosures. My driver had said that you were able to hold a turtle but the guide gave me 2 fake turtles to hold. For a turtle rehab facility, it was extremely small and disappointing. At the end of the 5min tour, the guide asked me for a tip, not impressed. This was a waste of my time and money.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: DONT GO! Its hell on eart.. poor animals, i start to cry.. its the most horror place i ever see in my life.. please do not support this curel.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Animal cruelty at its finest, snakes with tapes mouths, all animals in very small enclosures. Was told it was a sancuary it deffinatly is not .. please don't make the same mistake we did by going here and accidentally supporting this.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This island was part of the package we booked.
The speed boat was nice and clean but the island itself was a bit disappointing.
They have sections for huge turtles, baby tutels and a big lizard and birds.
So many locals are trying to sell their products in a very expensive price compared to other places (do not buy anything from there).

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
0 stars if I could. We were first told it was turtle island, and then that it was turtle beach, so we expected to see turtles in the wild and be able to swim with them and see them on the beach. When we got there it said Turtle Farm, and it was absolute disgust. They capture these animals and tell you they rehabilitate them and release them into the wild, and there is 0 proof of it, and they have 50-70 year old turtles swimming into walls trying to get out. Absolutely terrible conditions, they had over 50 turtles in a puddle crammed in. Don’t get me started on the other animals they had caged in with terrible conditions. 

DONT SUPPORT THIS TREATMENT OF ANIMALS!!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Animal Cruelty at its finest.
Filthy conditions. Concrete jungle for turtles that have no space to move. Tourists sitting on turtles for photos. Animals mouths are taped together.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Zero stars if I could. The hotel we were staying at had excursions available and the one we chose, myself reluctantly, was a “turtle sanctuary”. We got to the start point where we boat out of. The sales guy is telling us all the price is 80 a person. We ask why exactly and his English get really bad all of a sudden. I told him the 80 dollar package included snorkeling and we didn’t want to snorkel. We only wanted the $50 package that includes the glass boat in crap water and a trip to “turtle island” which actually isn’t an island by the way. He tried to charge us 70 a person anyway and when he realized we only wanted what the hotel had quoted us in print he gave in. We get there and as soon as we get off we meet our “tour guide”. They immediately ask where you are from so they can gauge their prospects on getting money out of you. My only satisfaction here was that after telling them we were from California I am hopeful they were really let down after not leaving them one cent. I don’t want any tour guide I want to explore myself but there was nothing to explore anyway. Beautiful sea turtles in shallow concrete tanks, then they show us their other animals. A couple of crappy toucans, a snake and finally f’ng turkeys. I flew 20 hours to see turkeys? They ask if we wanted pictures with the animals to which I replied “Not at all”. We didn’t give them a dime. They make us take a picture in front of a turtle statue and try to sell it to you. No thanks. Beverages?? As much as I wanted a beer to take a little sour out of the experience, hell no again. No to any “contribution” or money in any of their pocket. 
Do not ever go. The biggest waste of an excursion you can ever have trust me.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
En mycket trevlig dag med båtresa och besök på Turtle Island.
Dom lägger ner mycket arbete på att rädda sköldpaddorna.
Man fick även mata dom.
Det finns även andra däggdjur och fåglar där som man får mata.
Vi bokade en chaufför vid namn Wayan som är chaufför åt Get Your Guide.
Vi bokade honom privat en heldag för ca 300 SEK.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Unfortunately we wanted our driver to take us to the turtle conservation and education centre which has great reviews on TA. He drove us to the port in Benoa / Nusa Dua and we got sold to by the boat people to take speed boat to the alleged above turtle conservation Centre. Ended up paying 700,000 rupees for 4 of us for speedboat. Massively ripped off. 
Get there and realise this is turtle island not the conservation centre. ☹️ no baby turtles no opportunity to release into ocean. Just a poorly run zoo with poorly treated animals and reptiles. 
Beach was dirty full of rubbish, plastic and overrun with boats and Chinese tourists. 
Very pushy volunteers who expect you to donate and buy souvenirs ☹️
Always 'funtastic' for nature and health lovers

On our tour we positively identified over 40 species of birds including the critically endangered Bali Myna and endangered Black Winged Myna. We also saw multiple black giant squirrels, countless monkeys (black lutung and long tail macaques), and deer.

My only complaint about this park is the garbage that can be found on the west beaches. This park really needs an initiative by the Indonesian government to clean up this park as it's so stunning.

The West Bali National Park is a hidden gem located in the western part of Bali. The park boasts of stunning natural landscapes that are sure to take your breath away. The park is home to a wide variety of flora and fauna, including endangered species like the Bali starling and Javan rusa. Visitors can enjoy activities such as hiking, bird watching, and snorkeling in the pristine waters surrounding the park. The park is also home to several historical sites, including the Pura Giri Kencana temple, which offers a glimpse into Bali's rich cultural heritage.

The West Bali National Park is the perfect place to escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The park is a haven of peace and tranquility where visitors can relax and rejuvenate amidst nature. The park offers several accommodation options, ranging from basic camping sites to luxurious villas, ensuring that visitors can find a stay that suits their budget and preferences. The park is also home to several restaurants and cafes that serve delicious local cuisine, providing visitors with a taste of Bali's unique culinary culture.

In conclusion, the West Bali National Park is a must-visit destination for nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts. The park offers a unique experience that combines natural beauty, cultural heritage, and adventure activities. Visitors can explore the park at their own pace and indulge in activities that suit their interests. Whether you're looking for a peaceful retreat or an adrenaline-filled adventure, the West Bali National Park has something for everyone. So pack your bags and head to this hidden gem in Bali for an unforgettable experience.

Located in the North West of Bali island, in two regency of Buleleng area +Jembrana area.  It's nature conservation area which has the original ecosystem, working to protect a wide variety of wild flora and fauna. Covering the sea, beach and the mainland coast, lowland forests, and mountains, as well as coral reef, coastal waters and small offshore island called Menjangan. The latter is a very popular diving destination and shows high bio-diversity in a relatively small marine area. At the end of the last century, 110 species of corals belonging to 18 families were recorded, of which 22 species were of the mushroom coral family (there are only 29 species of mushroom corals recorded worldwide), and there were at least 27 species of Acropora coral found in a relatively small area of only 2 hectares.Unspoilt beauty lies at the west end of the fabled island of Bali: lush green forests, picturesque mountain range, crystal clear blue water, and vast stretches of pristine beaches, those are what await at the West Bali National Park.

Home to over a hundred species of wildlife. You can see more than 200 species of plants as well as black monkeys, leaf monkeys, macaques and mouse deer. The national park is best known as the sanctuary of the exotic white Bali Starling , an endemic iconic bird of the island of the gods Leucopsar rothschildi or "Jalak Bali" balinese bird habitat. Since 1966 it has been entered into the Red Data Book, the book includes species of flora and acre fauna endangered by IUCN ( International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources).West Bali National Park is truly a natural treasure of the fabled island of Bali.

Most visitors to the park arrive along the north coast road from Lovina (about 90 minutes) or Pemuteran (about 15 minutes). Others come from the south via Gilimanuk harbor which is the main port that connects Java with Bali (about 15 minutes). From the capital city of Denpasar, the trip will take roughly about 4 to 5 hours along the main west road that connects Denpasar to Gilimanuk.

All visitors should check in at one of the two park offices (PHPA) for information, and to obtain permits and arrange guides. The headquarters is at the village of Cekik just south of Gilimanuk in the west. The other is at Labuan Lalang on the north coast from where boats to Menjangan Island depart. The main ranger station is on the road between the two offices at Sumber Klampok.

Quite a mismanaged national park, Indonesian style. The road going into the national park is in very bad condition and not inviting to use your car to go deeper into the national park. So I parked at the front office and went in by foot. During my 5km walk in there were often local fishermen passing with loud motorcycle engines obviously not caring for any birds or wildlife. So clearly no birds or wildlife around that route! Also some cars passing with local people bringing offerings to the temples inside the national park. Overall disappointing experience. Both for management and wildlife sightings. There are much better areas around the national park where you don't have to pay (such high) entrance fees and much more wildlife/birds around there. A national park where birding is better outside than inside, can you imagine??
Also, the entrance fee is 20 times more for foreigners (200 000) than for locals (10 000), even with the correct permit documents and already living a long time in Indonesia. IF the experience would be worth it I would not mind to pay 200k  but it is NOT worth it. Better go birding just outside the national park boundary areas and have some great sightings there! Enjoy...

Visited the place and taking the easiest trail, Brumbun trail at the East side that face Menjangan Island. We can see deer, Bali starling and two types of primates. We took this Brumbun trail since we shall continue with snorkeling trip at Menjangan Island, thus taking the whole day trip by taking boat from  Bangsal Harbour (30 minutes boat ride one way) and playing in the same vicinity. It was a sea bed that was propped up to become land above the sea. The ground is made from sharp coral, thus ensure you are wearing a good protected tracking boots. Do not wear sport shoes or sandals. You may need also walking stick since descending the coral hill may produce nasty cut if you fall down.

The view from the hill top is nice, with wide view to West to Mt. Ijen at Java island and Menjangan Island at the East. However once I reached the top, I figure that most of the other trail will have the same experience. Thus this half day excursion should be enough to get the experience of the whole park, unless you are really keen into observing animals in the full day trail on the West side of the park.

We contacted Idris (not a Welshman but a local Balinese) well in advance and he sent us a list of the various trips that he offers. It is best to contact him via WhatsApp on the following number:

+62 823 4018 5768

Compared with many things on the island, his trips are not cheap but they really are excellent. 

On the first morning he met us really early and took us into the park for about 3 1/2 hours of bird-watching. In that time we saw over forty species of bird, each of them new to us. This included a pair of Bali starlings and many different species of kingfisher.

The next day we set off to towards the ferry port of Gilmanuk but then went down a side track and out on a boat in the secluded cove. We learnt a lot about the mangroves but the birdwatching was disappointing, although we did see a small blue / cerulean kingfisher diving for fish and had a great sighting of a lesser adjutant stork, fishing for eels. When we returned to the car, there was a pair of Bali starlings in a tree by the car park.

We then went back towards our hotel (The Menjangan ecolodge) and set off in a long-tailed boat to Menjangan Island, where the snorkelling was superb. Idris came in with us and pointed out many fish which we may well have missed. He provided a great lunch on the island where we were watched by a couple of the local deer (Javan rusa or Sunda sambar).

At times Idris is not that easy to understand, which can be a bit frustrating but his knowledge of the fauna and flora more than makes up for this.

When we were back in the hotel, in the evening, in came messages from Idris, sharing links to the relevant pages on the Merlin app, letting us know which species we had seen throughout the day; excellent service.

My recent trip to the park was truly unforgettable. The wildlife was abundant, and I had the chance to spot black monkeys, deers and bali starling. The trip were simply stunning. I highly recommend this park to anyone who loves nature, beach and adventure. A contact if u would do the trip there 
+62 877 5839 4786

I did a bird walk with Idris. I have his whatsapp number -. Knowledgeable and likeable , he was a great guide. Picked up at Mimpi Hotel and returned there 4 happy hour later.
He provides binoculars , snack water etc if needed - not in my case.
Cannot make head or tail out of the supposed entry fees to the Park. I just paid my guide about £50 for the full deal. Expect to pay more when the season gets underway.

Had an amazing trip with Idris. First we did a 20km cycle through the forest (national park) which was truly breathtaking. Idris alerted us to wildlife that he spotted along the way which we would have definitely missed. The bikes were extremely good quality, better than anything I’ve ever ridden, and he provided us with a helmet and gloves too as well as water. 

After this, he took us on the boat to Menjangan Island where we enjoyed snorkelling, and lunch on the island.

Everything was extremely well organised and seamless. 

The snorkelling was amazing, crystal clear waters and Idris again spotted two turtles.

Lunch was lovely and the island was really special. 

Idris is a kind and empathetic guide, we felt truly safe and would not hesitate to recommend him in future to anyone who wants a knowledgable and passionate tour guide.

We did a national park safari and a mangrove boat with Idriss. On th safari we saw lots of black monkeys, including babies, both types of deer, the giant squirrel, the Bali starling, family of pigs, a monitor. The mangrove boat tour was awesome. The locals have a mangrove reveg project that is truly impressive. Idriss was an excellent guide, so knowledgeable and passionate about conservation. I highly recommend his tours.

We had an amazing time in West Bali National Park and did a private snorkeling tour and a private birdwatching tour with Nono who is the most excellent tourguide!  He is a true lover of the environment and is working hard to protect the water from plastics and to preserve the beauty of the National Park.  We snorkeled far away from the tourists and were able to see the most amazing rainbow of fish and even a sea turtle!  On our birdwatching trek we saw many birds that were unique to Bali and Nono had a way of attracting the Banded Peeta bird that is rare unique to the area.  Please be sure to contact Nono if you want to have the best snorkeling and birdwatching experience possible! His email is nono.friendsofnature@gmail.com and his WhatsApp is +62-813-3850-4831.  You will have the best time of your trip here!
Helpful, careful, happiness all the time! Make good vibes! We learn health by plants! See birds, black monkey, deers, turtles and fish! We say thank you so much!

Wir haben eine ca.  3 stündige Wanderung und dann Schnorcheln an zwei Orten gemacht. Unser Führer war Idris.
Er machte das super gut!
Augen wie ein Sperber, hat er uns Vögel, Tiere und ausserdem viel über die Heilkraft der Bestandteile der Bäume erklärt.
War sehr spannend.
Und beim Schnorcheln half er mit seiner ruhigen, professionellen Art unserem Sohn die Panikattacke zu besiegen, sodass er ebenfalls Schnorcheln konnte.
Wir haben unter anderem Nemofischebujd zwei Schildkröten von ganz nahem gesehen.
Idris nimmt sehr auf Flora und Fauna Rücksicht.
Er ist als Parkguide angestellt.
Wir können ihn sehr empfehlen. Er spricht gut englisch.

A fantastic option for solo travellers. I went on a guided tour from the back of a scooter with park guide, Wayan, who was very knowledgeable. He picked me up from my accommodation in Pemuteran. Park entry was 200k IDR and 500k IDR for 4 1/2 hours with Wayan (including pick up and drop off). I recommend going early. We saw most animals before 9:30 am. The roads were good and all the park staff were really friendly. A fabulous experience.

We saw Idris recommended on TripAdvisor and texted him over WhatsApp to book a tour of the park. It was very easy to make a booking with him. He also came to our hotel the evening before the tour to go over logistics.  We trekked through the Savannah Forest in the morning, then did the best snorkeling we’ve ever done at Menjangan Island, then went on a boat tour through the mangroves. It was a packed day but Idris planned it perfectly.  He was extremely knowledgeable and generous and his enthusiasm for the park was infectious. He organized everything including transport  to and from our hotel and lunch. Highly recommend Idris and visiting the park. You can contact him on WhatsApp at +62 823-4018-5768.

The ride itself was a lot of fun and Idriss was a nice helpful chap. Saw monkeys and dear. But bikes were in bad need of attention. Brakes and gears didn’t work which kinda soured things a bit but the big one was price!

3 million Rp  (300 Ozzie dollars- two people) for a 2.5 hour casual bike ride on very poor bikes. Really cannot believe we actually paid that.

Advise you don’t. There is a lot more to do for that kind of money ☹️

We found Idris through our Bali travel guide book. 
There are a couple of pictures here with his business cards, so I don’t have to repeat those information, only that it was definitely an amazing experience and we recommended for anybody who wants to:

1) see the sunrise on the open sea, 
2) have an amazing guided tour through the national park and 
3) close with easy and colorful coral snorkeling.

It’s been a perfect couple of hours and Idris is a very experienced tour guide.
He arranged the pick up from our place and of course drop off as well  :-) 

Thank you very much. I’m happy that we did not miss this day in our life!

Found by chance in a travel guide. Fast and friendly contact.

Short briefing to clarify the snorkels equipment and food the evening before. Complete organisation. All you had to do was organise a little breakfast, Idris had even thought of hot coffee and warm tea. 

Pick-up by a friend directly from the house and transport to the harbour. From there, continue by boat towards the national park. Relaxed (easy) hike (at ground level) with short stops for explanations about medicinal plants and animals. 
Deer, black monkeys, many different bird species and the white Bali starling. 

Then take the boat to Menjangan Island for snorkelling. 
Idris was always there to make sure that everyone was well and safe - as well as for plants and animals.

Perfect tour to explore the region and spend a wonderful moment in the north!

We found Idriss in a West Bali guide and we sure are glad we did. He comes HIGHLY recommended. He was extremely competent, friendly, and reliable. His knowledge surrounding West Bali National Park, its plants, and its animals made our tour extremely valuable. He is a real special guy. I highly recommend doing a tour with Idriss, whose WhatsApp number is: +6282340185768.

We went on a day trip with Idris. It was amazing, we really enjoyed! Idris came to our hotel the day before to discuss all details. On the day of the trip we were picked up at the hotel at 6.30am (Pemuteran). We were driven to the park, then we went a bit further by boot. We did a bird watching trekking and saw different kinds of birds, but also deers and black monkeys. Idris also explained about different trees used for herbal medicine. After the trekking (about 6km, 3 hours) we took the boat to Menjangan island for snorkeling. First place for snorkeling was amazing, lots of fish and corals. Then we had lunch on the island (Idris prepared this for us). Then another snorkeling where we also saw a turtle. After this we took the boat back, where we could shower and then we were brought back to our hotel. We were back around 1-1.30pm. The tour is not cheap (around 100 euros per pax), but it's a private tour and everything was taken care of (transportation, lunch, snorkel gear etc). Idris is very kind and also made photos of us. Would recommend!

Nous avons passé une excellente journée en compagnie d’Idris, un très bon guide qui nous explique le bien fait de certaines plantes et arbres. Il connaît les meilleurs endroits pour observer les animaux. Il est d’une gentillesse incroyable !  
Je le recommande, hésitez pas à le contacter directement par whatsapp : +62 823-4018-5768

—
We had a great day in the company of Idris, a very good guide who explains the good done of some plants and trees. He knows the best places to observe animals. He is incredibly kind! 
I recommend it, do not hesitate to contact it directly by whatsapp

Idris was the best tour guide and made our trip to this national park amazing!! We saw over 40 species of birds and even the Bali Starling! He is one of a kind tour guide who knows the birds, trees, and wildlife so well. We also snorkeled and saw big fish and sea turtles. The whole tour with bird watching, lunch, snorkel, and boat ride, admission to park was 3.400.00 rupiahs. 

Activities: bird watching and snorkeling 

Highly recommend Idris!!! WhatsApp number: +62 823-4018-5768

Very beautiful part of Bali, we had the most wonderful time. We did a brilliant trek in the national park, our guide Idris was very knowledgeable of the wildlife and we loved our tour with him. Then took a boat over to Menjangan Island for snorkelling a saw so many fish and turtle! Great day and would recommend getting in touch with Idris if you want a great adventure.

After reading reviews recommending Idris we decided to send him a message over Whatsapp. He easily set us up with the tours I was looking for as well as transportation. We saw so many birds and animals in their natural environment, obscured as would be expected, but it was precisely what I was hoping for - not the zoo experience.  He was super helpful in ensuring we saw what he saw and he took some great candid photos that he later sent us. 

This was one of the more pricey tour we took in Bali but considering its one of the last protected areas for wildlife I thought it worth it and hope it can remain natural and available for the future. 

Idris: +62 823-4018-5768

Went with Idris and did the trekking and birdwatching in the savannah forest, sunrise boating, snorkeling, and safari trip. It was a great experience, Idris was very helpful and was great at guiding us for the birding! Idris was also able to give us references for drivers to take us to and from Seminyak, which was very helpful as well.

The sunrise boating and the snorkelling was phenomenal, despite the trash caused by the rainy season. Would highly recommend it although you need to get lucky with weather!

We were unlucky with the safari trip and went during a religious festival - many of the locals did a pilgrimage to the temple in the park and the animals were not present. If you're doing a safari, check to make sure it's not a religious holiday!

We visited West Bali National Park during the CNY holidays in Feb'24. While we stayed in The Menjangan, we spent most of our time birding outside of The Menjangan. The birding packages in the resort is very limited and confines only within the resort boundaries. We recruited the services of Idris, and we were not disappointed. He knows the place in and out and took us to the right birding spots. We had 3 sessions of birding roughly 4 hours each session and every time it was a different place and a change of habitat for spotting some birds which we had mentioned we wanted to see. We spotted Bali Myna, Javan Myna, Malkohas, Trillers, Woodpeckers, Scarlet flowerpeckers, Sunbirds, Nightjars, Bulbuls, Munias etc. Idris made sure we spent sufficient time out in the field and infact also helped arrange these sessions in the budget we had in mind. Weather was a bit of bummer at times, but overall good sessions. Do reach out to Idris (+62 823-4018-5768), apart from birding he also organizes other activities like snorkeling etc.
Tempatnya masih alami, laut dengan gradasi yang memukau. Cocok untuk melepas penat dengan lokasi yang gak jauh dari pelabuhan gilimanuk. Sometimes masih liar di beberapa bagian

We had a great trekking-bird watching experience in the Evergreen forest, saw black monkeys, giant squirrels and a lot of species of birds. We even saw an eagle, an owl and a falconet.
The finishing touch was the mangrove forest trip by boat which was also nice. 
We booked a trip with Idris (+62-823-4018-5768) and it was the right decision. He has an eagle eyes for animals and a great way of conducting the tour, he basically takes you on the journey with him to see some cool animals and it's fascinating.

We really changed pace in Bali heading northwest and doing a combined birdwatching and safari tour with the famous Idriss, starting early enough to see the sunrise. We saw 40+ birds and animals and really enjoyed mindfully looking for birds first with our naked eye and then through binoculars, as we slowly walked through their relatively open habitat backed by a handsome mountain peak in the distance. Booking was easy via Whatsapp +62 823 4018 5768. We took water and snacks but Idriss supplied some too, and lunch was tasty. Would love to do an on-water tour next time.

As recommended by people here, we used Pak Idris as our guide. We opted to do three activities in one day - trekking, followed by the traditional boat mangrove tour, and finally the safari. We left our hotel (the Plateran) at 7.30am and returned by 4.50pm. Idris met us at our hotel the day before to discuss the plan and take payment. He gave us a 600k rp discount, as national park tickets (at the weekend price of 300k pp) were already provided by our hotel. 

If you’re going to just do one, I’d recommend the trekking, as it was the best experience close to nature. However it was still worthwhile doing the safari later too as we were able to see some of the other animals we missed on the trek. The mangrove tour was the least worthwhile, it was just an hour’s boat around the mangrove where we were told about its conservation. However it was nice and relaxing and the sea breeze was much welcome after the stifling heat of walking round the jungle. By the mangroves, just before we boarded the boat was also the only place we saw the incredibly rare Bali Starling in the wild, which made it well worth it.

On the walk we saw giant squirrels, quite a few black monkeys, lots of different birds, macaques and different plants, including some poison trees. The walk was around two and a half hours, and was tough later on as there was no breeze and it was incredibly hot (as we’d been sensibly advised to wear long trousers - which we changed out of immediately before the next activity). On the safari we drove around for about two and a half hours, reaching further in the park than we were able to by foot, but getting out of the car on a few occasions to see the animals more closely. We got to go to one of the artificial watering holes where we saw a lot more, less timid (as the ones on the trek had quickly run away when they saw us) black monkeys, including a ginger haired baby. Plus some wild pigs, the mejangan deer, muntjac and many many macaques (a few of which tried to jump in the window if we slowed!). The safari is done in an ordinary 4x4 car rather than a jeep, presumably to stop you being attacked by monkeys.

For lunch we were taken to a local warung, which was fine. However, I did say I couldn’t eat anything spicy and the food was still spicy, so I couldn’t eat anything. My husband enjoyed the food though.

Idris was incredibly knowledgable about the animals and plants around the park, and had some great stories to tell us. He was also friendly and well organised. However we did find his accent really quite hard to understand, even my husband who is usually quite good with strong accents. This made it more difficult to communicate and learn all the things he knew. However we would use him again.

I’d absolutely recommend visiting West Bali National Park if you have time. It’s far less busy and overly touristy than other parts of Bali and feels like a very different climate. You can also include a day snorkelling on mejangan island and a night / morning in Banyuwangi (Java) to climb Ijen.

Nous avons été déçu par cette balade. Les seuls animaux que nous avons vu  sont les écureuils et les mêmes singes qui sont sur les bords de la route.  Le prix de l’entrée (200 kf par personne et le guide 400kf pour le groupe ne sont absolument pas justifiés) Nous ne recommandons pas cette excursion

We wanted to book with Idris as we had seen lots of reviews recommending to use him if possible. You can do this easily by dropping him a whatsapp message - His number is +62 823-4018-5768.

We booked in for the Safari trip which lasted about 3 hours, and also the Mangrove Boat Tour for the afternoon which was around 2 hours. Both were great and saw lots of wildlife, in the Safari we saw several groups of the long tailed black monkeys unique to the area and also lots of other monkeys too, we saw the smaller menjangen deer in there natural habitat hcih also involved a small jungle trek to track them. Some of the other deer wwe sa were massive! We was also lucky enough to see the Wile Boar and a Large Water Monitor Lizard! On top of that we also managed to site the Giant Bali squirrel. We then stopped and have a very tasty lunch at a local Warung and as very filling and plenty to eat.

After this we took a trip to the Mangroves via Boat for the afternoon, the sites and views are just amazing. It's wworth it just to be out on the crystal clear water, but on top of that Idris gave us a full explanation of the different mangrove types and exploring the wildlife that relies on them, we managed to see Lizards, Monkeys having a swim, Eagles and a variety of colourful birds which were amazing diving in and out of the mangrove areas. The icing on the cake were the jumping fish we saw a few times near the boat!

All in all we had one of the best days we have had in Bali to date, and we have been here for 5 weeks so that's saying something!

Dont pay attention to any negative reviews as if you go with the right guide and book the right activities you are going to have the best day :)

Thank you so much Idris it was incredible.

Andy & Katie

When did we go; september, during Bali dry season.
How long; 4 days at west Bali, 3 days of tours.
What did we do (costs IDR/duration); 
- First day; Evergreen forest trek and Mangrove tour by traditional boat (1.8mljn/4hours)
- Second day; Bird watching and trek (1.7mljn/5hours)
- Third day; Jungle cycling and snorkling (2.8mljn/6,5 hours)

If you love nature and animals in their natural habitat and do not like touristic crowded areas, West Bali is definitely a good idea to visit! 
Note: do not expect animals to wait for you to make an instagram selfie, they‘re wild animals ;)

Experience;
Prior to the first tourday, Idris met with us to discuss the tours and what was necessary, e.g. mosquito spray, long pants etc.
1. Day. Idris gave us two binoculars to watch the animals and we went into the national park. Very soon we saw a big black animal - Idris excitedly stated it was a black giant squirrel, it was big like a bever and not like small European squirrels, very cool! - soon after that we saw a group of black monkeys in the trees who quickly tried to hide from us, also very interesting. During the hike there were several bird species and Idris knew all of them from a far distance (he didn’t use binoculars), notifying us about them (it was not even the bird tour yet). In West Bali there are approximately 250 bird species, the national icon is the Bali Starling bird, very beautiful birds. After the hike we went to the boat for the mangrove tour. After a short trip we came to a small opening and went deeper in the mangroves. Again, Idris explained all about different mangroves, how they grow, how the roots are etc. Also that they have several local projects to support the growth. After the forested part it was a nice trip to the beach where you were able to see Java and the harbour.

2. Day. This was like a very long hike where we saw mostly birds at the start, then went deeper into the jungle where it was difficult to see the birds. Aside from the birds, there were also black monkeys again and we also saw a glimpse of a large lizard. This tour was really into the jungle with small pathways and thick bushes at the end. On this day it was very hot and therefore probably did not see that many animals. It is wildlife so there remains always the risk that they are resting and you don’t see them ;) keep that in mind!

3. Day. Prior to this day he asked about foot sizes etc. to prepare snorkling and lunch. We met with Idris and he already prepared the bicycles. We got gloves and helmets (which seems odd but believe us, you’ll need them in the jungle!!). One of us was wearing flipflops, which is okay for the jungle cycling when you are Dutch, otherwise not recommended! XD
We went into the jungle and since we were faster with the bicycle, the black monkeys (yes we were lucky to also see them during the third tour!) did not see us coming until we were almost next to them! This allowed us to surprise them and we saw how they jumped from high trees, almost 6 to 8m down into the bushes to hide, very fascinating sight to see! We came by the Menjangan Resort were you have a cool first view of white beaches and clear sea. As we drove further into the park, itgot more dry so the jungle became more like a savannah with beautiful acacia trees. After approximately 2 hours we arrived at a small ranger house with a sanctuarium for the Bali Starling (several were dlying around, really beautiful!). Here they also breed them as they were almost extinct around 2005. Now in 2023 there were over a few hundred again due to this program! (We know all of this due to Idris!!!) While we had a break, around 40 wild Javan/barking deer came to the ranger house to drink at the water well that the rangers made. Fabulous sight again! We then took the bicycles on the boat and went to Menjangan Island. Here Idris explained the snorkling and how to use the flippers (good to know when its the first time ;) ).
In the water, which was super clear, there were uncountable amount of different fish, starfish, sea urchins and a lot of coral! Some of the coral was bleaching but also here, to support growth of the coral, there are programs of the locals (again, knowledge from Idris!). After the first part we had lunch at Menjangan and continued with the last snorkling tour, again very beautiful! We then went back to the beach and cycled to the starting point.

About the tour guide, Idris;
I found him here on Tripadvisor and communication was super from the start! He is super supportive, sympathetic, helpful and has an immense amount of knowledge about West Bali National Park! You can ask him about anything you see during the tours and he most likely has a story about it! We could’ve not imagined any other guide than Idris! Wonderful guy, and funny :P
His whatsapp is; +62 823-4018-5768

Een enthousiaste vriendin tipte ons Wayan als gids voor het park. Ook wij hadden een zeer goede ervaring met hem en hebben veel gezien tijdens de wandeling door het bos. Het mooiste was een ‘zwarte apen familie’, waarbij een moeder met haar ‘oranje’ baby. Helemaal prachtig te zien door de telescoop die Wayan mee had. Deze zeldzame apensoort leeft hoog in de bomen, in tegenstelling tot de makaken die je overal op de grond ziet lopen. We hebben ook vele mooie tropische vogels gespot. En zagen een grote (!) eekhoorn door de takken ’glijden’. Heel imposant. Wayan spreekt goed Engels en heeft tussendoor ook veel interessants verteld over de flora in het park. Hij haalde ons op vanaf onze accommodatie in Pemuteran en bracht ons weer terug. Kortom, we hebben als gezien (met 2 tieners) genoten van dit natuuruitje.

Nous ne sommes pas restés longtemps dans le parc, mais nous avons pris beaucoup de plaisir à prendre notre café tout en haut de la tour fait en matériaux naturels.

Très belle vue et atmosphère reposante.

Contact opgenomen met Idris. Hij is gids in het park. Goede referentie van hem gevonden op TripAdvisor. Ik zou hem zeker aanraden op badis van mijn eigen ervaring. Zijn nummer is +6282340185768.
Via whatsapp contact gezocht voor een Jeepsafari van 3 uur door het park.
Idris heeft een mooie 4wd en gaat hiermee ook over onverharde wegen.
Om 8.00 zijn we opgehaald en 12.30 waren we terug.
In het Evergreen Forest heeft Idris ons veel verschillende dieren laten zien. 2 soorten apen, herten, vogels en een reuzeneekhoorn. In het park staat aan het eind van de onverharde weg een grote tempel. Ook deze is erg mooi om te zien.
Tijdens de rit zijn we vaak gestopt om uit te stappen en voorzichtig de dieren te gaan bekijken.
Voor ons was het een geslaagde ochtend, ook dit deel van Bali is zeker de moeite waard om te bekijken.

Nous avons choisi l'excursion bird watching dans l'evergreen forest avec Idris. Le trek de 4h s'est avéré super avec divers paysages et observations de nombreuses espèces d'oiseaux avec des explications sur chaque animal et sur les plantes de la jungle. Il nous a également amené voir des black monkey dans leur milieu naturel, et malgré leur crainte nous avons eu l'opportunité de les observer grâce aux jumelles amenées par Idris.
C'est un guide que je recommande, il vient la veille de l'activité choisie à votre rencontre pour discuter du déroulement, des modalités et envies de chacun. Il a même arrangé un transport de notre logement vers le parc, et nous a trouvé un chauffeur le lendemain pour notre départ vers Kuta.
Voici son contact : +62 823-4018-5768

We booked an excellent trip to West Bali NP via Idriss. He wasn't available, but he organised for another guide, Wayan, to take us for a birding walk in the forest, safari and finally a boat trip to some mangroves. All really well planned and Wayan was  great - so enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the flora and fauna. So many birds and some great views of Ebony Leaf monkeys and Giant Squirrels. Highly recommended.

We visited West Bali National Park during the dry season of 2023 for trekking and safari. It was not supposed to rain, but it did. Our guide Idris (thanks for the recommendations!) met us at the hotel the day before to explain what we would do the next day, and despite the rain we decided to continue with the activities, although there was less chance of seeing the animals. I'm a primatologist and I lived in the jungle for more than two years, and I can say that Idris has incredible skills when it comes to tracking and recognizing all the species in the park! We were eventually able to locate several groups of leaf monkeys, two Bali starling (critically endangered), deer, and of course many macaques. The park is in an area quite different from the "better known" Bali, much quieter and simpler. The main problem is that the strong sea currents bring a lot of garbage from Java, so the wonderful landscape is full of garbage (including the National Park itself)... quite sad. From Ubud it takes about 5 hours by taxi (counting the traffic) and it costs considerably more than the bus, but the route goes through incredible places so it's worth spending more money and having the freedom to stop at the rice terraces, villages and temples that are along the way.

I had a marvelous morning bird walk with Idris!  He is incredibly knowledge, very professional, and very, very good at identifying the birds (and other wildlife).  It was an amazing walk and one of the highlights of my visit to Pemuteran.If you are into a nature safari, I highly recommend contacting Idris with a Whatsapp message: +6282340185768

We searched the reviews here on Trip Advisor to find a guide to take us birdwatching and snorkeling in West Bali National Park. Many of the reviews mentioned Idris as an excellent guide so we contacted him via WhatsApp and received a very quick reply with lots of information about the many tours available with him. 

We chose to birdwatching in Brumbun Savannah forest and snorkeling around Menjangan Island. Idris even came to our villa the evening before the trip to explain everything to us.

We saw many bird species, black moneys, macaques, deer and many Bali Starlings.

After birdwatching we did some snorkeling then had an enjoyable packed lunch on Menjangan Island before doing some more snorkeling.

We thoroughly enjoyed the trip. Idris was the perfect guide. He was enthusiastic, knowledgeable, helpful, caring and friendly.

I would highly recommend Idris as a guide. You can contact him on WhatsApp number +62 823-4018-5768

Snorkeling, bird watching, sunrise from a boat. Our guide Idris was very knowledgeable and spotted lots of birds and animals for us, and enthusiastic which kept it interesting, and tailored the tours to fit our needs and desires.

We had a great bird watching trip in thr National Park yesterday with Idris as our guide. We went through the forest as well as an open area which was previously farmland which currently provides a great habitat for so many species and makes them easier to spot. As per other reviews Idris is a fantastic guide. Our main focus was birds and binoculars are needed as many of the beautiful birds are small. Amongst the birds we saw were different species of kingfishers, bee eaters, barbets,  bulbuls, savannah nightjar etc and of course the Bali Starling. We also saw black  monkey and a giant squirrel and several monitor lizards. You can Whatsapp Idris to arrange your activity .. he has lots of options. +62 823-4018-5768. Thank you Idris and we will see you again on our next trip
Precioso, naturaleza exuberante, bien conservada. Muy recomendable para quien le guste la selva. Precaución con las manadas de monos, son muy listos y bastante agresivos.

We highly recommend Pak Idris +62 823-4018-5768 (whatsapp) for taking good care of us. He is knowledgeable and well-organized. We came from Singapore, went on a 2-hour bird-watching trip at Brumbun Savannah at West Bali National Park, followed by chilling on Menjangan Island for another 2 hours. The birding started at 630am at sunrise, perfect timing, saw treepies, bulbuls, barbets, woodpeckers, kingfishers, munias, drongos, mynahs, fantails, and balinese black monkeys. The beach are not as clean, so let's do our part to consume less and create less trash.

Hiking through a tropical rainforest, spotting a large family of black monkeys , spying a macaque monkey further on, having our guide use his machete to cut through the branches and vines, discovering the most amazing trees...a once in a lifetime experience  for all those who don’t live in the tropics ( that would include most North Americans and all Europeans). A totally marvellous experience.
Forget the reviews vaulting such and such a guide. You don’t get to chose. You go with who meets you at the we one station.
Yes it costs a bit ( $35 -$45 depending on your currency), but well worth the experience.
Not to be missed.
Apparently, the rainy season is a better time to visit,

I met I Ketut Sulatra (from Starling Bali), one of the park rangers of the TNBB. 

We went on two excursions together and both were incredible. I learned so much about plant and animal life in West Bali. First excursion was in the monsoon forest and second in the tropical forest, I’d definitely recommend both. Had the chance of tasting so many new plants and fruits and would trust Ketut as a survival guide for sure!! 

Ketut has an almost impeccable English which is self-taught. He is also a very kind and generous person!! He really cares about the life in the park, the environment and people. 

Looking forward to going back again!

Thanks to trip advisor for the recommendation for Idris.  (What’s Ap +62 823-4018-5768)
The bike ride on trails through the field, jungle and Mangrove Forest to the ocean was a lot of fun as was the sunrise snorkeling trip.
Idris was easy to communicate with and took really good care of us. He took lots of photos that he shared with us.

We stayed at Naya Gawana Resort .  It was a beautiful place, a little remote but most places are. We were able to walk down the long driveway to go to a different restaurant for a change of scenery.
Naya Gawana had water bottle refill stations on the property which was appreciated. At least it shows some effort to help protect the environment. However so much more has to be done. 
It’s great to snorkel by the coral reef but it wasn’t great to see all the plastic film floating in the water above the reef. Not to mention the litter that was washed up in the Mangrove Forest at high tide. 
I suppose I wouldn’t be as sensitive about this if we hadn’t just come from Bali where I saw a beach covered in soft plastic with more coming in on every wave. 
Please Indonesia; get it together and stop poisoning the ocean!

The tour with local guide Idris was amazing! 

We cycled through the National park before getting a boat to the island for snorkelling. We saw all sorts of amazing colourful fish, sea turtles and coral gardens. The surrounding landscape of Java and its volcanic mountains was otherworldly too. 

Idris was very friendly, knowledgeable and passionate about the area. I would highly recommend him and this tour. You can reach out via whats app - +62 823-4018-5768

We spent three days at The Menjangan - a wonderful on-the-beach luxury experience.  And we filled two of our days with trips arranged with Idris.  Having found his details here in TripAdvisor we followed many recommendations to arrange both a safari ride through the West Bali National Park with him, and a day out snorkelling to Menjangan.   There's nothing to fault - Idris corresponded with us immediately across WhatsApp, sent photos of what we should expect (the boat, the car, etc), laid out the inclusions and we agreed on private trips but you can also join-in with group tours.  He reconfirmed things and met us a day before the trips to talk through what to expect.   Both trips have been well reviewed here so I won't rehash but just say we HIGHLY RECOMMEND contacting Idris.  He'll handle everything - arranging snorkel/fins, the boat rental, entrance to the various national parks and he really knows his wildlife, medicinal trees, and helped to point out reef life that we would have otherwise had missed - turtles, black tip shark and even a lobster!   WhatsApp him well in advance of your dates as he's super popular.  +62 823 4018 5768.

Went with my family and Idriss (found his number here) to the West National Park of Bali. Idriss is a good guide who will show you lots of things and adapt to your needs.

Thanks for you help and the nice hike.

Olivier

My boyfriend and I decided to go to West Bali on short notice. We were slightly worried that we’d left it too late however we got in contact with Idris on +62 823-4018-5768 after finding his details via trip advisor. Idris responded to our WhatsApp messages very quickly, he provided detailed information/recommendations for both the activities in the national park as well as for our accommodation and transport. We already had transport arranged from Canggu to West Bali however we were let down last minute - I contacted Idris and within minutes he’d arrange a new driver for us! 

Idris’ communication is fantastic, he met us at our hotel the day before to explain the activities and advise us on what we needed to wear/bring. On the day of activities he picked us up on a boat from our hotel at 6am, we travelled about 15 minutes to the spot that we started our first activity - bird watching - Idris’ knowledge of birds is phenomenal he also had binoculars and a bird book which he shared with us as we didn’t have our own. The bird watching was amazing but it got even better when Idris pointed out wild deer and a family of black monkeys!! Once the bird watching had finished we got back on the boat and were taken to 2 different spots snorkelling - we saw many incredible fish and were lucky enough to see a few turtles. Idris very kindly provided water and delicious fruit for the day and also took some amazing footage of me and my partner which he sent to us afterwards. 

A truly special day which we will never forget - thank you so much Idris - from Laura & Tom.

We did a trekking + snorkelling tour with Idris (+62 823-4018-5768 whatsapp).
When I texted him he explained al the options. 
The day before we had the tour he came to our homestay to explain everything from beginning until the end. 
The trekking with Idris was a great experience, he knows everything about the park. He can spot bird and other animals within seconds and can explain a lot about them.
We saw deers, black monkeys, the bali bird and lots of other birds, turtles and millions of fish. 
It was definitely worth it.
He made pictures of us the whole trip with his phone and sent al the pictures after the trip!
10/10 book with Idris. 
+62 823-4018-5768 
He will recommend you to wear long trousers. We didn’t do it but there will be some mosquitoes. If you want to walk ‘off-road’ you should definitely wear long trousers.

We got in touch with guide Idris via what's app: +62 823-4018-5768 - his communication was amazing and he helped us planning our National Park adventure. He made it super clear what the cost was and where to meet. During our cycling trip (3-4 hours), we went through 3 different ecosystems and saw Bali starlings,  black monkeys and deers. We also saw some colourful birds in the forest and the most beautiful butterflies. We stopped by in a restaurant to have a cold coconut which was perfect after a hot cycle. Idris has an exceptional knowledge of all the local plants and how they are used in traditional medicine and for treating ailments. He can 'call' the black monkeys and is just a wonderful guide to have with a great sense of humour.

If you are thinking about doing the cycling, you should be aware that it is mostly treks and can be challenging for balance. If you are into mountain biking, this will be super easy but if you are used to normal roads, the jungle cycle will perhaps feel like a challenge. 
As mentioned by someone, there are a few twigs and branches which will get you but this is part of the adventure and did t hurt.
In terms of clothing - I dressed in long sleeves and long trousers for extra protection but it meant that I quickly overheated and felt a bit unwell. Looking back, shorts and a light T-Shirt would have been a much better choice for me personally. Take plenty of water for hydration 
Idris provides a helmet and cycling gear and we had a wonderful day out. I cannot recommend Idris enough! 

Snorkeling: the experience was fantastic - Idris explained the different names of fish and we also saw sea turtles. He can advise on the best times to set off.

We read all the reviews and decided to follow the recommendation to contact Pak Idris. Despite very short-notice we were able to join a trekking and snorkeling trip,  which were both absolutely worth it. Trekking was challenging, especially without proper foot wear, however we were able to see the Bali starling, black monkeys and deers very close. Snorkeling trip was a lot of fun, very well guided and we even saw a sea turtle.
We would absolutely further recommend Pak Idris, as he knows how to get to hidden spots to see more than just the minimum and is very open and helpful towards visitors.

Wir sind vom Norden in den Park. 
Gleich an der Straße, hinter einem Garten begann die 2 h überteuerte Tour. 800000 für den Guide, der einen über 2 h über Trampelpfade durch einen Wald führt. Wenn man im Wald zuhause durchs Unterholz krabbelt, hat man das gleiche Erlebnis „ for free“ . Den Mangrovenwald bekamen wir nicht zu sehen, Affen gibts am Straßenrand und wer knien Vogelkundler ist spart sich besser diese Tour.

We visited the West National Bali Park in end of July 2022, it was a dry season with the temperature was around 30°C. It was warm, but bearable and less humid. We took two activities (cycling and snorkeling) with Pak Idris, he is a certified guide from West Bali National Park. The cycling track was around ~33km, took us about ~6.5hours. It included quick breaks here and there, and lunch. The cycling was fun! We passed beach, mangrove forest, savannah, and monsoon forest. We also get to watch barking deers, black monkeys, giant squirrel, macaques, and Bali Starling bird. Prepare yourself with uneven, rocky, or sandy terrain in the National Park. If you think that ~33km is too much, Pak Idris can arrange a shorter trip. The snorkeling in Pulau Menjangan was also fun! We get to see many beautiful fishes, colorful corals, and sea turtles! Pak Idris is also very friendly, knowledgable, and helpful. Definitely recommended! You can contact him via WhatsApp: +6282340185768, or come to the office of West Bali National Park at Labuan Lalang.

The national park is interesting with mangroves and mostly jungle. Did a 3 hour cycling tour and snorkeling with Idris one day and and then did a sunrise boat tour and a 2 hour trek the next day. 

The cycling is very tiring if you’re not an experienced cyclist and the paths are very narrow and with lots of bushes and branches on the sides you get scraped up so you need to wear long sleeves (I told Idris that he should tell guests about this and also show them pictures of the bike “path” so they know what to expect. It was definitely very challenging to cycle through the jungle so be ready for that. 

The snorkeling was beautiful and I saw sea turtles. I also requested for a more comfortable boat for sunrise tour and Idris accommodated that. Saw black monkeys, deers, and bali starling during the trek. I think the trek is mostly interesting for those who are really into birds. Idris is knowledgeable about birds and plants. 

Overall Idris is a good guide, he just needs to give people more forewarning about what’s coming up and to show them some pictures.

Nous avons passé une très belle journée avec Idris.
Nous avons choisi la combinaison de 2 à 3 heures de trekking (10km environ) et de 2  snorkeling.
C'était magique, magnifique. Nous avons adoré.
Idris est un guide attentif qui aime son travail et le parc national. Il nous a montré les animaux (biches/cerfs, singes noirs, oiseaux) dans leur milieu naturel, il nous a donné des explications sur la faune et sur la flore.
Idris se charge de tout. Il est venu nous chercher le matin (6h30), il avait prévu le déjeuner (délicieux plat de riz jaune et fruits frais) et il nous a ramené vers 14h.
Les spots de snorkeling sont à tomber. Nous avons pu découvrir tout un tas d'espèces de poissons et admirer de magnifiques coraux.

Amazing trip! We stayed at Menjangan Dynasty which has the best views and the tent was so cozy. 

Decided to contact Pak Idris because of all the good reviews in tripadvisor. Definitely would recommend!

We did the savannah trekking and scuba diving - both were beautiful and Pak Idris knew everything about the flora and fauna both under and above water. 

Will pass on the good deed found in tripadvisor and post pak idris’ number here - 082340185768. Really recommended for activities in the park!

Overall would recomment the national park- worth the 3-4 hour drive up!!

We saw the review on Tripadvisor and decided to contact Pak Idris.

We did the tracking trip to the National Park and it was amazing.
Pak Idris is very knowledgeable about the native plants (most are medicinal and rare) also the animals.
We saw a group of Black Monkey, Bali Myna, Blue Sterling,teeth bones of deer, lots of wild boar footprints.

The walk to the top of the hill was amazing and our kids loved it !

Just be careful that the thick savannah grass are sharp and sticks on cotton !

Definitely contact Pak Idris again on our next trip. 
082340185768 this is his contact number.

Мое впечатление даже лучше, чем я рассчитывала. Скажу честно, зная особенности сафари в разных местах, когда можно заплатить и не увидеть зверей и птиц, я не питала каки-то надежд, но взять гидом Идриса было действительно отличной идеей. Он прсото нюхом чувствует, где звери, где какие птицы и мы в лучший сезон увидели действительно очень много и животных и птиц. 
Мне кажется можно сэкономить и не брать гида и не увидеть ничего, а можно довериться знающему гиду и получить действительно удовольствие от проведенного времени. Если кому-то будет нужно, тел Идриса  +62 823 4018 5768

We had so much fun with pak Idris! We joined for tracking and snorkeling tour. He’s very knowledgeable of the plants and animals. We were able to spot a few families of the black monkey, bali starling, deer at the park. The hike brought us up to an amazing view of the ocean and the islands. It was our son’s first time snorkeling and it was wonderful. We had our prepared lunch and brought in some fruits from his garden to share with us on the island. The island was absolutely beautiful with the crystal clear blue water. My kids had fun playing on the beach and the shallow water. Pak Idris is very attentive and met us before our tour to make sure everything is communicated well and took care of our special requests for the lunch.

We had an incredible experience yesterday with Idris, He was our tour guide and took us though the west coast national park, he was very good at explaining the nature around us and tracking the animals that live in the park!!
We spotted deer, monkeys and eagles  and the famous white Bali bird,
He then took us by boat to a a snorkeling spot and wow the fish and coral were the best I have seen in a very long time, he was great with the kids and would highly recommend Idris and the tour to anyone coming to the west of Bali, it’s beautiful.
His contact number +62 823-4018-5768

We spent a fantastic day with Idris in the National Park. The day before we visited the park, Idris met us in our Hotel and made sure, that we knew what was waiting for us and that we choose the best activity. You can choose between sunrise-boat trips, birdwatching, trekking, cycling and snorkeling or combine them however you want. 

The bike tour was very nice, but at the end of the ride we were really tired! The path is not really flat, so do this tour, if you are used to ride bikes in uneven terrain.  The snorkeling after lunch, in the middle of the tour, was just great!

Idris was a fantastic guide, he showed us many different animals and plants. We also had a lot of fun learning a bit of Balinese with him! 

The tour was planned to take 4-5 hours, but in the end it took us a lot longer and we still payed the same price, which was nice.

If you want to contact Idris, just write him a Whatsapp message:

+6282340185768

Just got back from wonderful trip with tour guide, Idris. WhatsApp contact info: +62 823-4018-5768

I HIGHLY recommend booking a trip with Idris. 
This is ESPECIALLY true if you are interested in birdwatching! He was AMAZING!

He also knows allllll the trees, AND their medicinal benefits and expertly guide us through the forest that would have been impossible w out him!
Really fabulous to see a true expert at work!

And Pak Idris is just plan a lovely, wonderful man, with a wonderful heart!

Our trip to this park without such a guide would have just been like 10% as amazing as it was. And was great to be able to support the local economy!! 

I HIGHLY recommend Idris!  +62 823-4018-5768

Nous sommes allées au parc de Bali Barat dans l ouest accompagnées de Idriss notre guide pour une jolie ballade de + de 3 Heures 
Avons pris un bateau pour 10mn de traversée vers un Îlot.. avons pu admirer les cervidés se reposant à même la plage, puis marcher à travers la jungle en écoutant les commentaires et explications d Idriss passionné par cette nature généreuse 
Vous pourrez prendre de magnifiques photos ( comme ma fille passionnée de photo)
Je vous conseille de prendre Idriss comme guide c est une personne généreuse, professionnel et adorable!!! Merci à lui on a adoré ce dépaysement

In retrospect, we wish we'd skipped this part of our 10-day trip to Bali.  The drive up from Ubud was lovely and the most interesting part of this trip segment.  The resort where we stayed in Pemuteran was lovely and well run, although not as "homey" as the homestay that we left and ultimately returned to for the remainder of our stay.

The turtle sanctuary in Pemuteran was another draw for us and another reason to make the trip up to the northwest, but another disappointment.  There was one box filled with sand that included some buried eggs (which you couldn't see because they were buried, so it just looked like a sand box).  There was a tank with about a dozen young turtles swimming around, then another tank with a large turtle swimming in circles.  Done.

The National Park was, frankly, an expensive disappointment (2,800,000 rupiah for a day with the guide to do bird watching and a jungle safari).   We didn't realize that the "park" was actually segmented places interspersed with bunches of villages and regular traffic, with lots of trash everywhere.  The cobbled road into the jungle part of the park was incredibly rough (bumpy) and uncomfortable.  Although there were some black monkeys - very cool to see - they were in distant trees (they're very shy) and there weren't that many of them.  The ubiquitous Macaque monkeys were everywhere, not unique.  We saw a few wild hogs, which were nothing special, and a few deer, again nothing special.  Overall, we spent 1-1/2 uncomfortable hours bumping our way in to the end of the road, then 1-1/2 uncomfortable hours bumping our way back out again.  Good thing the spa at the resort had great massages!

Overall, I'd say skip this and see another part of the island instead.
My husband and I spent the day birding in park with our guide Harry. We thoroughly enjoyed the day and harry was an excellent guide and had a real eye for spotting birds!

We just spent a beautiful half day snorkeling in the West Bali National Park with our great Guide Idris. The underwater world there is fantastic, it felt like in an aquarium. It did not feel like normal snorkelling more like scuba diving from the variety of fish and corals. Idris showed us 2 spots and we had a very nice lunch on the island at the beach. I can strongly recommend this tour with Idris, was a blast!

Had a fantastic day snorkeling guided by Idris.
5 of us on the boat and 2 fantastic snorkelling locations split by lunch on the island . The lunch was good with nice fresh fruit aswell .

Idris was an amazing tourer, he helped out a lot and made sure we swam in the right paths, amazing views under the sea and very respectful people.

I would highly recommend any to visit him

The two of us have been birding with the guide Idris for 7 hours on 22 of January. It costed 1 000 000 IDR per person which is awfully expensive in my opinion. Idris is a good guide, we visited 3 locations with him. He is very good for the unexperienced birders, he spots birds very well. Though I really wanted to learn how to distinguish different species of swifts and at this point Idris was no help. So we are still in confusion here. The best moment in this trip was searching for the javan banded pitta, Idris used audiorecording to attract the bird. So, if you are looking for any particular species, it is a good idea to contact Idris.

If you are an experienced birder with wide interest in species, it is more practical to buy the entrance ticket and ask the locals about the locations. The local guide will show you just the same things that you are able to see yourselves. Also, don't do just the West Bali National Park, go to different locations and to mountain forests, there are lots of completely different species.

Very expensive entrance fee ticket Rp.200.000 per person on the weekdays and 300.000 for weekends! Crazy ripoff price for tourists! 
If you stay in a Hotel in this area prepare to pay the obligation park fee! We went to snorkeling in menjangan island and end up paying 2 Million rp for 5 adults. They charge you not just for the entrance fee but also for toilet use, snorkeling or even just sitting on the island which is ridiculous!

My friends and I had a wonderful day with Idris! We booked him because of all of the good reviews we read and he lived up to his reviews! He is a guide who goes above and beyond.

We loved starting in his village, riding bikes, seeing monkeys, a wonderful lunch and wonderful snorkeling. I was blown away at the quality of bikes. We have rented bikes many times in Asia and they are always crappy bikes, but fun. Idris has amazing quality bikes, better then our bikes at home! Great for a ride through 3 different forests. 

This was definitely a highlight on our Bali trip!!!!! Thank you SO much Idris! 

Idris - +62 823 4018 5768

Menjangan岛的浮潜体验堪称一场无与伦比的海洋盛宴。当我身着浮潜装备，缓缓踏入那片湛蓝的海域，仿佛开启了一扇通往神秘海底世界的大门。阳光穿透清澈的海水，洒在五彩斑斓的珊瑚礁上，折射出如梦如幻的光芒。各种热带鱼在身边穿梭游弋，它们色彩艳丽，形态各异，仿佛是一群灵动的精灵。这里的海底能见度极高，每一处细节都清晰可见，让人不禁感叹大自然的鬼斧神工。这次浮潜之旅，不仅让我领略了海洋的壮美，更让我感受到了生命的奇妙。我深知，Menjangan岛已经在我心中种下了一颗眷恋的种子，下次，我定会再次踏上这片梦幻之岛。

Superbe journée de snorkeling à Menjangan, avec des fonds marins incroyables et surtout un guide au top : Nano. Il nous a emmenés sur des spots loin de la foule, où on a pu nager en toute tranquillité au milieu de paysages sous-marins magnifiques.

Grâce à lui, on a vu des tortues, des raies, des requins de récif, des poissons clown… Ce n’est pas toujours évident de les repérer seul, mais Nano connaît parfaitement la zone et sait exactement où chercher. Il prend aussi le temps de tout expliquer, toujours avec bonne humeur et bienveillance.

Le petit plus : des videos GoPro incluse qui permet de revivre ces moments magiques. Le tout à un prix très correct pour la qualité de l’expérience.

Franchement, c’était l’un des plus beaux snorkelings qu’on ait fait à Bali. Merci Nano pour ta passion et ton œil de pro. Je l'ai trouvé sur Secretoo !

The reef around the island is alright for snorkeling with a lot of different fish. Unfortunately, the corals are not very colorful anymore, most of them already died (not sure if it just wasn’t the right season). I hope that there are taken measures to prevent the dying of the corals. Also, I hope that the guides take better care that no one steps on the corals, touches or picks up sea animals (especially star fish) and doesn't throw ones trash into the ocean (cigarettes includes trash). I was very shocked to experience these things. The water contained a lof of plancton and jellyfish, my whole body was covered with bides for several days (might also be due to the rainy season). Not only in the ocean but also the island itself is not taken care of, there's trash everywhere. So the deers actually lay in the trash and are feeded by the tourists. I hope that the locals and the local government to protect this area so that it doesn't get further destroyed by climate change, carelessness and masstourisms.

With a relatively small area, Menjangan Island has high biodiversity. From Coral Garden to underwater cliffs, it is a paradise for divers. Menjangan Island has been acknowledged as the best place to dive in Bali. Using modest equipment we can experience the world-class coral reef which is still in West Bali National Park.
