Spot snorkeling yang ada di Banyuwangi, tapi lokasinya ada di Pulau Bali. Tempatnya indah dan luas. Datang weekday jadi sangat sepi pengunjung, bahkan terlihat hanya rombongan kami saja yang datang. Ada kamar mandi cukup bersih, tapi tidak ada orang berjualan, bisa bawa minum atau jajan sendiri. Spot snorkeling dan bawah lautnya indah sekali, ombak cukup besar jadi harus hati-hati. Terumbu karang juga lumayan besar dan banyak ubur-ubur. Kalau siang terasa panas sekali namun terbayar karena pemandangan sekitar pulau juga sangat indah.

Pulau ini airnya jernih dan pasirnya putih, suasananya tenang, walaupun terlihat tidak ada yang berjualan. Disini ada penangkaran rusa sayang kami tidak bisa melihat langsung rusanya. Di sekitaran pulau ini kita bisa snorkling melihat langsung terumbu karang dan hewan laut di dalamnya. Sayangnya pulau ini banyak sampah di tepiannya krn mgkn terbawa arus. Tolonglah rekan rekan yg berkunjung kalau kesini bawa sendiri kantong sampahnya dibuang setelah sudah sampai di tempat yg memang ada tong sampahnya. Buat yg mau kesini disarankan bawa makanan sendiri ya kecuali dari jasa penyedia wisata kesini sudah menyediakan makan siang langsung. Saya kesini menggunakan jasa wisata dari banyuwangi namanya pulautabuhan (cek ig) sepaket dengan makan siang, snorkling, foto bawah laut dan paket ke pulau tabuhan. Sangat worth it pulau ini dikunjungi. Alamnya masyallah sekali.
Pantainya tenang dan dangkal. kebanyakan yg k sini berangkat dari Banyuwangi. Banyak spot buat snorkeling

If you're not planning to go into the water, there isn't much to do here. The lack of shops and poorly lit (and potentially dirty toilets were disappointing). The only highlight was the "check-in" spot at the welcome sign, which seemed to be a popular photo opportunity where throngs of local tourists stopped by.

If you're looking for activities or amenities beyond water-related ones, this may not be the ideal place for you. However, if you're solely interested in beach and water activities, you might find it enjoyable, especially as it is a destination for snorkelling in Bali.

As a friendly reminder, don’t leave your litter on this beautiful island, which is home to majestic deers ️

Best diving spot in this area.

Please read on... Are we talking about the island or the marine park? The island it's beautiful and so is the surrounding shore line. My reason is the extreme admission fee for tourists. Probably just as many local tourists from Java, (very very wealthy tourists)
Local price (national) 10000 IDR or $1 AUD
Tourist price
200000 IDR or $20 AUD, $30 at weekends per day..!! Thats 20-30 time more expensive.

I am all for protecting the environment but I can't see where the money is going... elsewhere park fees have been for single of multiple days and you got a keyring as proof of payment which is nice.

No one likes getting ripped off especially me so from that perspective I give it 3 stars. Today is Sunday and I am not diving there today. How do we even know the dive shops are declared every visitor! We have no token.

Ok the marine park, yes very beautiful, so dived very similar to other parts of Bali, some I bit more interesting.. Not a great deal of marine life... plenty of the usual fish you see all over Indonesia.. but not as my creatures as I saw in Amed.  Well worth a visit, but the park fees are a sting in the tail.

Tempat snorkeling yang bagussssss dari grand watu dodol sekitar 20 menit menggunakan speed boat. Kalo mau ikut open trip bisa langsung nyamperin di grand watu dodol kalo sewa kapal sekitar 1.5 jt, 1 kapal bisa untuk 15-20 orang (beberapa penyewa kapal udah termasuk makan siang dan alat snorkeling).

La isla de Menjangan forma parte del Parque Nacional de Bali Occidental y es uno de los mejores destinos para el buceo. Es una isla poco frecuentada por los turistas, ya está despoblada y prácticamente deshabitada. Sin embargo, sus arrecifes de coral y la variada vida marina la convierten en uno de los mejores lugares para el submarinismo. También es buena idea si te gusta la naturaleza, ya que en la Isla Menjangan podrás ver ciervos salvajes y monos negros.
Seru bgt pulaunya bersih diyambah trip dgn yg 1 frekwensi

Un isola al nord di Bali inserita nel Park Taman National Barat nelle sue acque circostanti si può fare snorkeling trovando un quantità variegata di pesci varie dimensioni e coloratissimi e tartarughe che ti nuotano vicino, mentre secondo me i coralli sono monocromatici ( a nusa penida sono molto più colorati rossi, viola, verdi, rosa). Nel tour ti fanno salire sull isola dove troverai una piccola spiaggia bianca...... Ma aimè troverai tanta immondizia bordo riva e molta plastica abbandonata anche se all entrata troverai un CARTELLO cin  raccomandazioni in merito (visto che gli addetti puliscono soltanto l area picnic ASSURDO)

It is a PROTECTED AREA. It’s part of West Bali NATIONAL PARK. Please be aware of your surroundings and do not pollute it. Do not touch the coral reefs, stay a little far from them - you will be helping to conserve the corals as well as you will get a great view of fishes if you stay a little far from the corals and shallow water. This is one of the very few places where you will be able to see ALIVE CORAL REEFS, please keep it clean and educate yourself on how to protect corals before doing snorkelling or other water activities around.

I saw some boats stopping right on top of beautiful, alive corals and it breaks my heart to see their harpoon killing a coral right in front of me. Please do not take such tours. Be sustainable, do echo tourism. Boats can and should park a little away from corals without damaging them.

This is what we called paradise
A small island located in west Bali, most beautiful place i've ever known! The name is menjangan island. I think because in this island there are so many deer or local people called "menjangan". The fun fact is this island without village it makes the vibes is so peacefull. You can diving here or just praying.

Menjangan Island is an absolute paradise for anyone looking to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life and immerse themselves in nature. I recently had the pleasure of visiting this stunning island and I must say, I was completely blown away by its beauty.

From the moment I arrived on the island, I was greeted with the crystal-clear waters, white sand beaches, and lush greenery were a sight to behold. The snorkeling and diving opportunities are some of the best in the world and I was lucky enough to witness some of the most colorful and diverse marine life I have ever seen.

The island is also home to a variety of wildlife including deer, monkeys, and a wide range of bird species. It was amazing to see these animals in their natural habitat and to be able to observe them up close.

Overall, my experience on Menjangan Island was nothing short of magical. I would highly recommend this destination to anyone looking for a peaceful retreat surrounded by natural beauty. I can't wait to return and explore more of what this stunning island has to offer.

This small island is famous for its snorkeling spots and deers. You can reach this island from Banyuwangi in East Java and Bali by boat. There's a Hindu Temple on this island for the Balinese Hindu people to pray. The corals are pretty with numerous fish and other sea creatures.

What was not enjoyable was the enormous amount of trash on this island, you could build a skyscraper from the trash if you really wanted to. Very sad that nobody is doing anything to clean it, locals mostly just contribute to it instead of picking it up.
The water is very very clear. The corak is good and the fish are best. So many different kind of fish. Would absolutely go back here again

The island is part of West Bali National Park. It can be reached by roads from Gilimanuk and Singaraja, or by using ferries from Ketapang Harbour, East Java.

You can go to worship (official guide said that there are 9 temples here), or.. you can sinking in mercy's sea.  I checked in Labuan Lalang Port to reach park headquarters for information & permit.

PS.
Full snorkeling gear rental: IDR 70,000
Half snorkeling gear rental: IDR 40,000 (without fins)

Tujuan saya kepulau menjangan adalah untuk sembahyang, tp selain untuk persembahyangan umat hindu pulau menjangan juga cocok untuk snorkling,  jadi mungkin lain kali sy akan kepulau menjangan untuk snorkling.

Sekarang kita ulas pura2 yg ada di pulau menjangan ya.

Untuk menuju pulau menjangan harus menyeberang dulu dg boat.  Waktu itu sep 2020 sy menyewa 1 boat untuk 8 orang penumpang membayar 465.000.  Ketika baru sampai di dermaga,  langsung saja menuju loket dan membeli teket nya.

Setelah sampai di pulau menjangan kita cukup berjalan kaki untuk menuju pura2 nya,  ada sekitar 10x sembayang.  Setiap pura sudah ada pemangkunya.  Jarak antar pura juga tidak terlalu jauh jadi kalian tdk akan merasa kelelahan.  Sepanjang perjalanan kalian akan melihat hamparan laut yg indah, dan beberapa rusa yg jinak juga akan kalian temui di sepanjang perjalanan. Sangat memanjakan mata.
Oh iya tatanan persembahyangan juga tidak sama di setiap pura.  Ada yg hanya panca sembah,  dan ada juga yg menyebutkan mantra2 tertentu.  Kalian akan diarahkan oleh pemangkunya.

Kalau kalian sampainya siang,  sangat perlu membawa payung dan menggunakan tabir surya,  karena cuaca akan sangat panas.

Had a wild experience lol  it was choppy as hell on the way to the island on the boat. But totally worth it. So many species just from snorkeling.. I’m sure if you’re a diver you’ll be even more amazed. By the way , lots of wild deers in the island.. nuts!!

We came to the beach during the rainy season and in cloudy weather, the beach was empty, with dark sand and the water that washed ashore was full of grass and fine dirt. At the moment I can't say whether this is the case during the summer season, but I personally wouldn't go swimming in the water. There were bars and pubs on the street leading to the beach, and there was also a massage parlor nearby, so there are activities and services near the beach. Personally, I prefer the lighter sand beaches on the south side of the island, but wanting to discover the northern part of Bali, I was able to visit and see that part of the island as well.

Sortie en mer pour nager avec les dauphins et snorkeling organisée par Secretoo
Nous sommes ravis de la matinée passée avec Paskal.
Le trajet avec le driver depuis notre hôtel était agréable et nous avions pu convenir d'un retour un peu plus tardif pour profiter donc parfait.
Sur le bateau nous avons beaucoup apprécié le petit déjeuner préparé par la femme de Paskal dégusté au milieu des dauphins, vraiment top.
Nous avons vu de nombreux dauphins et nous avons aimé le respect de Paskal pour ces animaux de ne pas se précipiter sur eux contrairement aux autre bateaux BRAVO.
la séance de snorkeling est très sympa également. On nage dans un aquarium tellement il y a des poissons différents.
Parfait pour les dauphins
Great place here.

No ethics!!! 100 boats chasing and hunting poor dolphins!!! Staying too close!!! Bringing noise and rubbish, we are disturbing their living and harming their safety!!!!!

It always looks glorious on instagram side but reality is too ugly!!!!!!!!

The sunset are spectacular. There are restaurants and shops. I didn't like the many tour guides trying to get you on dolphin tours and vendors trying to sell us things. I guess that's normal in most of Asian countries. It becomes a little annoying when you want to have some peace.
جميل

Wer vorher in Amed am Strand war, ist hier enttäuscht. Wasser war nicht klar, ganz viel Plastik und Müll am Strand und zum Teil aufdringliche Händler.
Zudem sollte man Delfinbeobachtungen kritisch hinterfragen, am Morgen gehen hunderte von Booten raus um Delfine zu "beobachten", für mich eher um diese zu "jagen". Das muss aber jeder selbst entscheiden. Es gibt schönere Strände und Ort auf Bali . Positiv waren die super schönen Sonnenuntergänge in Richtung Java!!!

Une expérience magique organisée par Secretoo ! Dès l’accueil autour d’un petit-déjeuner local, nous avons été séduits par l’ambiance conviviale et l’attention de notre guide Paskal, vraiment gentil et prévenant.

La sortie en mer à bord du bateau traditionnel était incroyable : voir les dauphins nager librement autour de nous restera gravé dans nos mémoires. J’ai particulièrement apprécié l’approche respectueuse de l’équipage, qui observait les dauphins sans les déranger.

Nous avons ensuite fait du snorkeling dans des eaux cristallines, avec de magnifiques coraux et une grande variété de poissons tropicaux. Une excursion parfaitement organisée, authentique et enrichissante. Merci à Secretoo et à Paskal pour ces souvenirs inoubliables !
Great place to chill and rest

Overall: Arrived at 515am. The air there in the morning was FRESH, I felt my smokey lungs getting a cleanse which breathing in the air. Hire a private boat it costs about 700k. Sharing is painful, watching how others had 8 people squeezing on 1. Boat runs slower with that much weight also.

View: Spectacular, to view the sunrise. Water was so chill with no waves at all. However, I really hope the village people start taking care of this beautiful sea that they are blessed with. The water is clear but filled with rubbish. If this were to continue they would slowly destroy marine lives and dolphins may just start migrating.

Dolphins: Left for the sea at 6am sharp. All of them have a group to communicate to each other if they sight dolphins which honestly is smart for the first batch but not after. Imagine 40-50 boats flying at high speed to a group of 5 dolphins. They just gonna end up hiding. Even after they hide and reappear, everyone just starts chasing it also… 700k for 2hours, only saw the dolphin 3 times.

I spent a night in Lovina. It’s a big change from Seminyak or Ubud — less traffic, fewer crowds, and way more peace. The early morning dolphin tour was the highlight: we saw several pods swimming around the boat as the sun rose. Magical, even if there were a few too many boats at times.

The beach itself isn’t the white sand you might expect, it’s black volcanic sand, which is cool in its own right. I also visited Banjar Hot Springs and the Brahmavihara monastery nearby, both worth a stop if you’re into nature and spirituality.

Not much of a party scene here, which was perfect for me. Some nice cafes and warungs, and the locals were very welcoming. Overall, a good place to unwind and enjoy a quieter side of Bali.

Nettes Örtchen, schön ruhig und kaum Touristen. Die besten Zeiten sind wohl vorbei. Dafür hat man den Strand fast für sich. Schnorcheln am Strand direkt im Zentrum bringt nichts, weden Korallen noch Lebewesen.
Beach is very dirty - going out on a boat for dolphins and snorkeling is fantastic

Lovina Beach est une jolie plage de sable noir avec une eau chaude agréable pour la baignade. L’endroit a un certain charme, et nous avons eu de belles rencontres avec des locaux curieux, ouverts et très sympathiques.

Cependant, il faut savoir que la plage est très fréquentée par des vendeurs qui ciblent les touristes. Dès notre arrivée, plusieurs personnes ont tenté de nous vendre divers produits ou services. Jimmy, par exemple, nous a proposé d’assister à un spectacle d’enfants, avec une pression implicite pour faire un don. Une dame nous a abordés en nous complimentant avant de sortir paréos et robes à vendre. Une autre vendait des fruits, et un homme proposait des bijoux faits à partir de coquillages.

Ce côté très insistant peut rapidement nuire à la tranquillité de la visite. Il faut s’y préparer pour en profiter sereinement.

En résumé : belle plage et ambiance chaleureuse, mais attention à la forte sollicitation touristique.

While staying in Ubud, my friend and I booked a dolphin tour through our hotel and departed around 2:30AM. We arrived about 1.5 hours early despite a slow and incredibly winding road.
Overall, I would say it was an underwhelming experience but we managed to make the most of it. Our hotel had given us a price that we would pay our driver, for the transport and dolphin adventure. However, upon arrival, the tour guide basically forced us into paying $20CAD extra to go on our own boat and have the opportunity to “swim” with dolphins. We insisted that we didn’t want to pay more and were fine with sharing the experience however, he persisted and eventually got us to agree to this.
For this reason, I believe here were way too many boats in the water and I counted upwards of 75 boats in the area.
There were not many dolphins for the first hour however, they then started to appear in pods. We didn’t get many chances to see them as there were so many other boats flocking to wherever the dolphins swam. We were able to get in the water and snorkel next to the boat, hanging on and body surfing, while our driver sped over to the recent sighting location. The excitement and idea of swimming with dolphins definitely encouraged our interest however this is in no way a “swimming with dolphins” experience, so don’t fall for any false advertising like we easily did!

We booked a dolphin-watching tour through Klook. We arrived early in the morning, before sunrise, to board the boat. It took about an hour to reach the dolphin-watching spot, and during the journey, we enjoyed the stunning beauty of the sunrise over the sea. The calm, early-morning atmosphere made the experience even more peaceful and magical. Along with us, there were hundreds of other boats heading to the same destination.

When the time came, the dolphins began to appear, swimming in pods and occasionally leaping out of the water. We were lucky to see them playing around our boat three times, which made the experience even more special. The dolphins were lively and playful, creating a joyful atmosphere for everyone onboard. The tour also offered an option to swim with the dolphins, but I wouldn’t recommend it since it’s challenging to spot them underwater amidst so many boats and the movement in the water.

The experience was truly breathtaking, and the boat captain was delighted by our satisfied smiles. On the way back, we noticed the crystal-clear water and the beautiful coral reefs beneath the surface.

Besides dolphin-watching, this is also an excellent spot for snorkeling and exploring the underwater scenery, making it a must-visit destination for nature lovers.

Lovina Beach est un endroit magnifique à découvrir. Sa plage de sable noir est unique et l’atmosphère y est paisible. C’est l’endroit idéal pour se détendre, se promener le long de la plage ou simplement admirer la beauté naturelle. Un vrai coup de cœur pour les amoureux de la nature et de la tranquillité.

nice beach to watch the dolphins and chill for an afternoon. Along the beach there are may different shops, cafes and entertainment. after a few nights in Lovina, we met a local who was doing a project for school where he had to interview people. He was really wanting to interview tourists and a lot of people shut him down or didn't give him the time of day. He was really sweet and wasn't aggressive. We interviewed with him and then he introduced us to his friends and chatted more about our travels and where they would like to visit. We enjoyed our time talking to locals no matter where we were and it made us feel more connected. I enjoyed this part of our trip because it was relaxing, genuine and gave us a bit more perspective into their lives.

By sunset this beach is full of people but there is still so much room to lay down, play games with friends or just chill and watch the sunset.

Leuk strand. Soms zie je wat afval liggen, maar dat heeft elk strand, lijkt me. Het strand is een zwart strand. Rondom het strand zijn er enkele leuke bars en restaurants gevestigd. Bij sommige kun je voor een bepaald aankoopbedrag de ligbedden gebruiken, andere bieden dan weer zitzakken aan. Je moet je wel ervan bewust zijn dat verkopers (zowel kledij, souvenirs als tripbegeleiders) je zullen aanspreken om kun zaken aan de man te brengen.
Dit strand is ook het vertrek een aankomstpunt van de dolfijnentrip.
Ik raad aan om je trip niet in de ochtend (vanaf 6:00 a 7:00) te doen, maar eerder vanaf 9:30 a 10:00. De dolfijnen worden dan minder opgejaagd en er zijn veel minder boten op het water dan..

Rekomendasi jika ingin melihat sunset (17.50-18.50 WITA sesuai dengan kondisi), entrance terdapat 2 gate, baik dari Banjar ke Lovina atau dari Singaraja ke Lovina, terdapat penjual perhiasan pantai hingga pakaian dan restoran makan (yang saya rasa khusus untuk user dengan budget), jika ingin berbelanja saya rekomendasi gunakan skill Nego halus agar dompet tidak cepat kering, toilet juga tersedia, dan saya rasa daerah pantainya (pasir) mulai berkurang akibat dijadikan restoran/warung. Dan seharusnya... Ada tempat untuk menyewa perahu biasanya bisa surfing maupun hanya untuk melihat lumba-lumba (sekitaran tahun 2019an ada/sebelum pandemi, dan khusus untuk pagi-sore hari).

Dalam beberapa menit berjalan di pantai, kami sudah didatangi 4 atau 5 orang yang terus-menerus mencoba menjual berbagai barang kepada kami. Kami harus mengatakan dua kali kepada salah satu orang, "tidak, terima kasih pak, tetapi kami tidak tertarik," namun dia masih memaksa menawarkan beberapa layanan tur kepada kami. Semua ini terjadi di kota pantai kecil yang sepi!

Honestly one of the most underrated beaches I've been to. There are very few tourists there so it's peaceful and not crowded. The water is very clean and has great visibility. There's even some coral if you go out far enough, and a turtle! Sunset was nice too. There are quite a few touts selling wares and such, but they're not aggressive and will leave you alone if you're assertive.

We arrived in Lovina for only 5 days and were incredibly excited about it. The beach is a bit dirty, and swimming is difficult as there are many areas where it's not allowed, which the locals inform you about when you go into the water. We just wanted to lie in the sun and relax, but that's impossible here. There are very few tourists on this beach and in Lovina in general. As soon as you step onto the promenade, all the vendors selling items and services swarm around you. It's impossible to relax on the beach as someone approaches you every second trying to sell something. Sometimes several vendors come up at the same time. Often they approach just to talk and get to know you, and only then start selling, making it very hard to get rid of them. After an hour there, without swimming even once, we packed up and ran back to the hotel. We didn't go back there again. Instead, we went on excursions and swam in our hotel pool.

Be cautious with locals offering dolphin-watching tours! It's better to book through an agency or an official site. We had a bad experience with one of them: once we were on the boat, he wanted to charge us double for renting snorkeling gear to swim with the dolphins, even though we had agreed on the price beforehand. The guy became aggressive. It's essentially a scam operation targeting tourists, just like many places in Bali. It's a shame how they treat tourists when they depend on them for their livelihood.

Sangat indah

Arrivés du sud, nous avons réservé 8 nuits à Lovina pour visiter le coin.
A peine arrivés ici, en 2 heures nous avons été alpagués par au moins 5 personnes qui cherchaient à nous vendre des tours en bateaux, pour voir les dauphins ou les planctons, ou toutes sortes de produits.
Nous avons essayé de décliner gentillement leurs offres à chaque fois, mais au bout de 5 jours nous partons ailleurs et avons perdu 3 nuit de notre réservation car cela devient insupportable. Non seulement nous ne pouvons plus passer un moment tranquille sans nous faire harceler, mais en plus ils deviennent agressifs lorsque nous refusons leur offre. L'un d'eux a même essayé de nous vendre une journée de plongée mais bizarrement il n'avait ni carte à nous donner, ni un shop ou aller pour se renseigner. Il nous a même suivi jusque chez nous pour nous faire payer une sortie à l'avance. Lorsque nous avons senti le truc venir nous avons décliné et il s'est énervé.
Garez vous dans les rues et non près des plages, car des gars sortis de nulle part vous demanderont de l'argent pour le parking.
Les prix des commerces sont abordables, et nous avons rencontré une poignée de personnes qui ne paraissent pas intéressés par notre argent et à qui nous pouvons parler tranquillement sans se méfier, mais à part ça nous en avons ras le bol.
Le point positif est que nous avons visité une super plantation de café vers GitGit, et que nous avons passé un bon moment au bar Funky Place.
Désolés Lovina, mais nous ne reviendrons pas! Nous retournerons au sud la prochaine fois.

Lovina n'est toujours envahi par des hordes de touristes, et c'est tant mieux. On y trouve des petits warung bien sympa qui attendent le client à bras ouverts. Méfiez vous, ils ne ferment pas tard.
Par contre la sortie "dauphins" et à organiser, dans la mesure du possible, sur place avec un pêcheur local. Il vient à vous et cela vous revient pas cher du tout. Mais au moins avec lui, vous éviterez les 150 bateaux qui "pourchassent" le dauphin pour que le client ait la chance d'en voir un. Une fois encore l'argent au détriment de la nature.

I have thought long and hard about whether or not to write this review, but I feel that as much as people talk about the good, a bit of reality is also needed. Before visiting Lovina you have to keep in mind that it is very different from the more touristy parts of Bali such as Uluwatu or Ubud. Being a less busy area the locals take the opportunity to sell their products and tours.

I don't blame them, the situation becomes desperate both for them and for you as a tourist if you are looking for a bit of peace and quiet.

I come from Spain, specifically from the Canary Islands, so the sea and the beaches are very present in my life. By this I mean that if you come from a coastal and beach area I think that Lovina is not an essential destination that you should choose.

Regarding to the dolphin tour, please, if you have any sensitivity and love for animals, don't do this tour. It is an endless 'hunt' of more than 100 boats all with the same purpose 'dolphin spotting'.

I believe that many parts of Bali can offer you an authentic and enriching experience. It is a shame that the situation in Lovina is like this, and I take away a bittersweet taste from this experience, but we as tourists can't do anything to change it.

Pływanie z delfinami to raczej pływanie ze śmieciami. Ocean bardzo zaśmiecony, w pewnych momentach po prostu pływało się z brudnymi kubkami, foliami itp.  Bardzo przykre ale i po prostu obrzydliwe. Co najsmutniejsze na plaży tuż przy łódce do której wsiadaliśmy leżał zdechły pies. Nikt się tym nie zainteresował, nawet po zwróceniu przeze mnie uwagi, organizator się tylko głupio uśmiechnął. Ten pies podczas przypływu zostanie zabrany przez wodę. Niesamowicie przykre jest to jak balijczycy podchodzą do zwierząt i zarządzania odpadami. „Pływanie z delfinami” jak się okazało też do najetycznoejszych nie zależy. Mnóstwo łódek goniących i osaczających delfiny po to żeby zobaczyć je przez kilka sekund podczas 2h wyprawy. Nie wspominając już o tym że woda w której się pływa jest kolorowa od spalin. Po wejściu całe ciało piecze niemiłosiernie (inaczej niż po prostu od słonej wody)

Hati hati bagi pengendara yang baru yang akan menuju lovina dari denpasar. Setelah melewati danau Beratan jangan ambil jalur munduk. Ambil jalur ke arah gitgit singaraja, walaupun lebih jauh tapi jalurnya lebih aman.

Salah satu tempat yang bisa dikunjungi apabila melakukan perjalanan ke Bali utara tepatnya di sekitar kawasan Lovina. Di sini kalian dapat merasakan pengalaman unik yaitu melihat sekumpulan lumba-lumba berenang di lautan pada pagi hari. Perjalanan akan dimulai pada saat matahari terbit. Jadi pastikan anda tiba di pantai ini sebelum matahari terbit.

Namun ada kekurangan yang kami rasakan saat berkunjung, yaitu pada saat pencarian lumba-lumba di tengah lautan, terlihat lebih seperti mereka diburu oleh segerombolan kapal yang sedang menantikan kemunculan mereka untuk sekedar dilihat dan diabadikan melalui kamera. Ekspektasi kami adalah lumba-lumba akan berenang di sekitaran kapal pada saat melakukan perjalanan ke atau dari lautan. Namun yang pada saat hari itu terjadi adalah kapal-kapal bergerombol di satu titik saling mengabari satu sama lain tempat dimana munculnya sekawanan lumba-lumba. Lebih banyak kapal yang kami dapat lihat daripada lumba-lumba yang berenang. Mungkin karena memang jumlah lumba-lumba yang dapat dilihat ternyata jauh lebih sedikit dari perkiraan.

Agak sedikit disayangkan namun tetap menjadi pengalaman yang cukup berkesan selama berlibur di Lovina.

Fijn strand waar locals en toeristen samen genieten van onder andere een prachtige zonsondergang. Er zijn veel verkopers van fruit, souvenirs, dolfijntrips, snorkeltrips en taxi services. Het is leuk om hier een praatje met mensen te maken.
In het water vind je helaas best veel plastic en andere troep. Daar eenmaal voorbij heb je eigenlijk waterschoenen nodig om je voeten niet te verwonden door de vele scherpe stenen. Snorkelen kan bij vloed al heel goed vanaf 30 meter van de kust. Je ziet gelijk veel vissen en we hebben zee-egels en zeeslangen gezien (genieten maar ook oppassen dus).
Om goed te eten kun je het beste naar Spice Beach Club/Bar lopen.

3 months ago, I went to Lovina Beach, located in Singaraja Buleleng, I got there at half past 5 in the morning and arrived there at 7 o'clock, the road to get there is rather narrow and steep, and also a little damaged, but cars can still pass there, the facilities there are decent complete, such as stalls, toilets are pretty good, the parking lot there is also quite spacious, there I saw dolphins and snorkeled on coral reefs, to see dolphins can only be in the morning, everything is good, it's just that it was cloudy, so it was a bit dark, after that, I ate at the small shop, bought packaged rice and coffee, the food was standard, and the price was only 5 thousand and enough to fill a hungry stomach

Pretty beach to watch sunset and sunrise. There are several fishermen boat. Although it is a famous tourist destination, it’s not as touristy as beaches in the south of Bali. You can still relax and enjoy the laid-back atmosphere. You will meet some locals who will offer you dolphin tours.

Lovina Beach is a serene destination on Bali's north coast, offering black volcanic sand beaches, calm waters, and dolphin watching. Visitors can explore charming fishing villages, waterfalls, and hot springs or experience local Balinese culture with a visit to the Brahma Vihara Arama Buddhist monastery or by attending a traditional Balinese dance performance. Popular restaurants include Warung Ayu Lovina, Spice Beach Club with stunning ocean views, and Warung Bule for affordable Indonesian favorites. With its tranquil atmosphere and delicious dining options, Lovina Beach is a great alternative to the busy tourist spots in southern Bali.
Cold way to go. Breeze in the night.

Terdapat patung lumba - lumba sebagai penanda bahwa di Pantai Lovina ini anda dapat menyaksikan lumba - lumba dengan menaiki perahu yg disediakan oleh pengelola. Direkomendasikan datang pagi bagi yang ingin melihat lumba - lumba sekaligus sunrise. Bagi anda yg ingin berjalan - jalan, berenang maupun sekedar duduk menikmati pemandangan bisa datang disore hari menjelang sunset.

I have no idea why but there seems to be less tourists here than usual which means that the few that are here are constantly plagued by touts.
Before I had parked my scooter I was told that in this spot I need a ticket for parking and a guy pulled up beside me to ask if I wanted a dolphin tour. Within 20 mins on the beach I was asked if I wanted to try mangosteen by one, dolphin tour by another, snorkel by the next, sarong, massage... I think there were 8 tourists that I counted.
The beach is pretty average but it's about 40k for a cocktail on a beach beanbag so not bad.

Ми плавали з планктоном ввечері і це справжня магія! Всім рекомендую спробувати цей досвід, якщо ви будете в Ловіні. Ми заплатили 400к за приватний човен для двох. Також зранку ми відправилися дивитися на дельфінів. Ми зустріли дуже багато їх, це просто якась казка. Також на пляжі дуже затишна атмосфера ввечері. Ми зустріли захід сонця на пуфіках зі смачними коктейлями та живою музикою.

Tempat wisata yang wajib Anda kunjungi ketika berada di wilayah Bali utara. Selain memiliki pemandangan alam yang cantik, di mana sunrise maupun sunset yang mempesona bisa Anda dapatkan dua-duanya setiap hari, yang khas dari tempat wisata ini adalah pemandangan sekawanan lumba-lumba di laut lepas pantai. Tentu saja Anda perlu menyewa perahu motor dengan seorang pemandu untuk mengabadikan momen ini. Sekedar jalan pagi menyusuri jalanan pantai akan bisa Anda peroleh damainya hari. Atau mungkin malah hingar bingar musik cafe di sepanjang pantai yang akan Anda dapatkan ketika menyusuri malam yang bertaburan bintang.

Pantai Lovina dengan pengejaran lumba-lumbanya yang rutin adalah puncak pariwisata eksploitatif di Bali. Bayangkan dikejar tiap pagi dan tak mendapatkan apa-apa kecuali polusi yang lengket di kulitmu. Uang pariwisata memang menggiurkan, sehingga merusak lingkungan hidup. Ini dua bintang bukan untuk menghentikanmu main ke sini, toh aku juga suka berkejaran dengan lumba-lumba, tapi rasanya untuk bisa bilang cukup sekali saja main ke sini. Aku enggak tahu dampak polusinya seberapa luas di sini, mudah-mudahan saja bisa dibatasi. Kalau tidak, maka harus ada tindakan-tindakan perlindungan untuk mempertahankan wilayah Pantai Lovina.

Lovina Beach with its regular mass dolphin pursuit is the epitome of exploitative tourism in Bali. Imagine to be chased every morning for show and gained nothing in return. Tourism money is really lucrative that it is polluting the beaches around Lovina. I’m giving just two stars not to stop you for coming here, I liked the dopamine as well, but I think once is enough. I don’t know how widespread is the sea pollution, but I hope it could be limited to this area only. If not, there must be some protective measures to preserve the Lovina Beach area.

If there is anyone telling you the beach is nice in Lovina... ufff i dont know... we have done whole Bali and in general, Bali is not about beaches, but Lovina is faaaaar faaaar from place that you "must" vist because of the beach... if you want to see grean nature - lovina, if you want to see waterfalls - lovina, if you must go dolphin watching and chase the poor animals with another 30 boats.. okie.. i am no greenpeace but this is not how you want to watch them.
And everytine they go above water there are 5-7 boats with full speed ahead so again those poor little animals are back in water hiding...

But back to the beach... ufff.. full of boats, dirty, full of ppl trying to sell you something, and more dirty ....

Pantai Lovina terletak di Kabupaten Buleleng dipesisir utara pulau Bali. Dan ada di sebelah barat dari kota Singaraja.
Dengan suasananya yang tenang, pasirnya cukup halus. Pemandangan laut yang indah.

 Recommended.
Sadly rubbish gets washed up daily

We live in Lovina. So we are biased.
Lovina is a slow pace, like Bali of 30 years ago.
We don't have 50 shops of the one thing but 1 or 2 shops to buy from. So who needs 50?
We are so lucky to have the acclaimed 10th Table restaurant here in Lovina. And The Lovina resort.
But we also have Warung Ayu that every European who comes to Lovina knows about. $13 for dinner for 2 with beer. Who can beat that?
And Bhuda bakery with fresh croissants and ciabatta daily. And their beautiful restaurant.
The villagers are so friendly and will help you with anything.
Do yourself the biggest favour on your Bali trip and go see Jimmy Hendrix School of Dance. Kids do the traditional dancing and pantomimes. You will laugh and laugh.  Attendance is by donation so please be generous as the money is used to school the children in the village.
Please give more than the 3,000rp (30c) that a Dutch family of 4 once gave. I think they got their zero's mixed up.
Lovina is the gateway to waterfalls, Banjar Hot Springs, the beautiful Buddist
Temple complex, old Singaraja and more.
People who come to Lovina always come back. For the lifestyle and the people.
See you at the Mu Bar for a Bintang!

파도 많을 때 돌핀 투어 하지마세요, 돌핀을 못 볼 수 있으며 멀미가 심합니다 도착한 지 거의 한시간 됐을 쯤에 돌아왔습니다, 우기 추천 안 함

Pengalaman lihat lumba-lumba dari dekat di habitatnya.. Orang bilang untuk lihat lumba-lumba itu tergantung dengan keberuntungan nya Masing-masing.. Ada yg bilang pergi dr subuh supaya bisa lihat lumba-lumba, ada bilang lumba-lumba tidak muncul kalau matahari sudah terbit.. Sedikit cerita kami dengan keluarga besar berencana ke lovina di malam hari, tp karna kita belum tau tempat dan jalan nya kita dengan PD jalan hanya bermodal google maps.. Ternyata perjalanan kita penuh drama, mulai jalanan yg sepi dan berkabut, jalan kecil berliku curam, dan tidak ada nya pom bensin di sepanjang jalan.. Astungkara, saat sampai daerah lovina sudah mulai lagi dan ada beberapa warung bensin eceran yg sudah buka.. Kita naik mobil saat itu.. Sesampainya di lovina tidak ada tiket masuk, hanya saja mulai berdatangan calo perahu ( kita naik perahu untuk lihat lumba-lumba) harga yg di tawarkan lumayan tinggi 100rb/ orang.. Sampai akhirnya saya buka aplikasi tiket. Com juga google untuk cari tau pembelian tiket murah.. Akhirnya singkat cerita saya dapat tiket 50rb / orang jauuuuhhh lebih murah.. Bapak nya pun sangat baik.. Sempat ragu untuk naik karna matahari sudah muncul tp suami bilang sudah sampai kenapa ga di coba siapa tau bisa liat lumba-lumba nya.. Maka kami semua naik, dan setelah agak jauh dr pantai, perahu2 yg lain justru maju ke arah kita.. Tidak disangka ternyata lumba-lumba justru datang dan menyambut kita.. Beberapa kali mereka muncul dan lompat tepat di samping perahu, sangat berkesan.. Anak dan keluarga happy..

Такое счастье открыть для себя этот дивный подводный мир дельфинов. Великолепие раскрывается когда видишь их под водой, это очень интересно. Ваши впечатления зависят также от капитана. Если не впечатлились меняйте капитана, только не сразу а на следующий день)) и будет вам счастье )

Toller Ort auf Bali. Nicht zu überlaufen. Es gibt viele Restaurants und viele Geschäfte. Wir waren über Sylvester / Neujahr hier. Es gab eine fette Party am Strand. Viele Leute unterwegs.Die Menschen genießen es nach Covid Mal wieder richtig Party zu machen.

Пляж грязный, много кораллов, глубины нет, искупаться особо удовольствия не принесло, как собственно и ожидалось, ведь мы не первый раз в ловине. На пляже пристают к туристам с просьбой что то купить, предлагают грибы мутные типы, поэтому брать не стоит само место красивое, но никак не благоустроенное) ехать стоит ради поездки сквозь горы, однако проверьте свои тормоза- очень частые случаи, когда они отказывают от перегрева на длинном спуске, и у тачек и у байков. Спускаться стоит с перерывами/перекурами
Bagus.
Der Strand ist ganz okay, aber er ist voll mit Strandbars und Einheimischen die versuchen einem alles mögliche zu verkaufen. Also zum entspannen eher schlecht geeignet.
Отлично место! Можно поплавать с дельфинами
Rekomen lumba²
Beautiful place. Good shopping and restaurants.

De beste plek van Bali voor 100%!! (als je van een rustige en relaxede sfeer houdt). Ik ben hier een week geweest en vond de rest van Bali veel minder leuk, dus heb de laatste week van mijn reis hier ook afgesloten. Het strand is rustig en je hebt een leuke plek waar je op een zitzak kan vertoeven met een drankje aan de rustige zee. Verder kan je met wilde dolfijnen zwemmen wat super gaaf is, snorkelen vanaf een bootje, naar de watervallen (bijvoorbeeld de Sekumpul waterval waar het super rustig is en zeker de mooiste waterval van Bali is), naar de tempel (lijkt op heaven gate) en een cooking class bij een local thuis volgen; eigenlijk dus alles wat je wilt doen op Bali maar dan in een rustige omgeving en super aardige locals. Omdat het rustig is, vragen de locals vaak om iets te kopen of bieden je iets aan om te doen. De locals doen dit dus niet voor niks, weiger niet gelijk maar toon interesse en het zijn vaak ook leuke dingen die ze aanbieden. De wereld wordt er niet slechter op om elkaar een handje te helpen en wat te geven ;) Ik ben fan van Lovina, GA HIER NAARTOE! <3
I love fishing, but here... The fish are too lovely to be fished. They are Dolphins .

Great hotel for family fun
Near the beach and any swimming pool
At the evening we had enjoyed sunset with a music and had dinner near the beach
The hotel room is comfort and completed amenities , ( balkon area, coffee and tea, hairdryer, refrigerator).
At the morning before sunrise,  we can see the dolphins using a boat and the ticket for it can be bought at the receptionist hotel (on the spot for buying ticket).
Тихое и довольно чистое село с вулканическим  песком на пляжах. Другой Бали с другими людьми, поймёте мои слова, когда побываете там ;)
Nice tranquil beach.

Встреча с дельфинами. Рассказываю о нашем опыте посещения этого места. Сразу по ценам:
- плата за 1 человека 250 к рупий
- если хочешь приватную лодку еще 200 к рупий доплаты
В стоимость входят: аренда оборудования (маски, трубки, желеты), наблюдение за дельфинами, снорклинг на рифах и завтрак (жаленные бананы + кофе). Вся поездка длится 4 часа.

Утром дельфины приплывают, чтобы позавтракать и лодки с туристами за ними гоняются, чтобы посмотреть поближе. Можно спуститься в воду и наблюдать за дельфинами в маске под водой.

В целом советую, классная экскурсия. Дельфины приплывают с 8 до 10 утра. Позже их не застать. Снорклинг тоже не плохой, караллы, рыбки и морские звезды, под водой есть пару статуй в форме черепах и дельфинов.
Keren dan asiek untuk liburan keluarga
Quiet beach,  It's lively at night
Karena disana ada air yang sangat banyak

Ayo kawan datang dan nikmati pantai lovina dengan ombak yang melambay, nonton dolphin sunrise di pagi hari dan melakukan snorkling, nikmati sun set di sore hari

Loved this place. Guaranteed to see plenty of Dolphins. They take you out deep into the ocean in fishing boats and amidst the pods of playful dolphins. Must go quite early in the morning to see plenty of them and also avoid the crowds.

Very nice, clean relaxing place really liked it there. Nice beach safe for children. Can go out to see dolphins early morning and see the plankton glowing in the evening.
Some nice bars and restaurants there along with some well priced hotels I like My Lovina Hotel very close to the beach and restaurants.
Nice drive through the middle of Bali, stop off at the lakes for lunch.
Mantap!

Совсем не мону сказать, что пляж чистый..... все пляжи на севере очень грязные и этот не исключение. Никто не купается... Песок черный (вулканический), красиво. Местные предлагают посмотреть на дельфинов, стоимость 150к рупий с человека,  около 2-х часов, но в 6 утра. Есть статуя с дельфином на пляже, много палаток для туристов и кафешки, но не на пляже, а за парковкой.

сам пляж не впечатлил, наверно я еще не готов к черным пескам) познакомились с гидом, предложил тур с дельфинами соответственно, за 150к/чел, до 6 пассажиров в лодке, отбывает в 06:00 утра, не знаю пока не договаривались но интересно.

It was such an amazing experience to see the dolphins in the early morning. I really appreciate how the captain respected the animals by keeping some distance, and we could admire the dolphins without chasing them .

Di pantai Lovina wisatawan akan disuguhkan dengan atraksi lumba-lumba di alam bebas yang menari-nari dan melompat-lompat. Untuk bisa melihat lucunya hewan laut ini wisatawan harus ke tengah laut sebelum matahari terbit dengan menyewa sebuah perahu nelayan milik warga setempat. Selain menyaksikan atraksi lumba-lumba, pantai Lovina merupakan spot menyelam paling populer di Bali Utara. Di pantai ini juga kita bisa menyaksikan matahari tenggelam (sunset) yang indah sama seperti pantai kuta.
Pantai yang harus dikunjungi oleh wisatawan asing
Trop de bateau, une vingtaine qui fonce sur les premiers dauphins qui sortent de l’eau… si vous aimez les animaux, à éviter
Excellent place very peaceful

Wir waren gegen Mittag hier. Es war fast menschenleer. Auf dem Platz vor der Delphinsäule kostet das parken 2000IDR. Es kam mir so vor als ob nur ich zahlen müsste, also ziemlich willkürlich. Zu sehen gab es nicht viel. Der Strand wird durch ein in das Meer fließendes Bächlein nach Westen hin unterbrochen. Das Meerwasser selbst war ziemlich trüb aber komplett ohne Wellen. Schwimmen sollte daher grundsätzlich möglich sein.
Beim nächsten Mal würde ich einfach an der Straße parken. Vielleicht ist es gegen frühen Abend schöner hier.
Great beach with plenty of parking spaces available. Best to visit during sunset & the highlight of my visit was the ice-cream stall near the carpark area. A much needed refreshing break.

We really enjoyed our stay on the beach.

The sand is black and there are no waves due to there being a coral reef out to sea.

So it makes for easy swimming.

I would suggest that you wear sand booties as there are urchins deeper in the ocean.

We snorkeled and saw small fish with lovely coloring and lots of coral. The coral is scattered with pretty colours. Don't expect a spectacular vibrant reef... it's not that.

Just keep an eye on the boats chugging past you. Give them a wave.

One of the restaurants on the end lets you use their canoes if you have a drink there.

There are shower spots on the way to clean off before heading back.

We had rain which lasted 30 minutes and got hot again.

It isn't a large wide beach, so if you want that, this is for you.

The beach restaurants have beanbags to sit on the beach. So that's lovely
Hotelnya kamar langsung menghadap pantai,,, bagus banget pemandangannya
Baguss bngtt tempatnyaa

Wer mal Ruhe brauch von dem ganzen Trubel auf Bali findet sie hier. Es war wirklich niemand dort. Es war einfach leer und ruhig…aber auch dementsprechend nicht spannend. Zum am Strand entspannt essen ist es super cool! Schnorcheln haben wir leider zeitlich nicht geschafft dann wäre es noch cooler gewesen. Aber nur um den Ort zu sehen würde ich es nicht empfehlen:)
Tempat yg asyik buat healing

liburan singkat bersama rekan-rekan kerja di sela-sela kegiatan yang padat, alhamdulillah

If you are going for some activity/tour might be ok. If you go just to walk and enjoy the beach, expect someone to disturb you the entire time. The vendors are constant - one after the other. Everyone is nice and polite but it becomes unpleasant after a while. I understand it’s how they make a living but…if I want to shop- I will come see you. Would be nice to just go and enjoy a moment alone without all the hassling.
Good place to stay overtired to experience the beach view relaxation.

La plage de lovina est en sable noir et rempli de bateau. Tout dépend de vos goûts mais personnellement je n'ai pas apprécié.
Aussi, j'ai trouvé la population vraiment insistante limite agressive dans ses interactions, commercialement on sent que le covid est passé par la.

Terrible beach! Sand is very dirty, all the seashore full of boats, waste water tube in the middle of the beach, and there is no place to swim. If you are planning to go to the beach in Bali, this is definitely not a good option.

The way to get to Lovina is in very bad conditions.

If you want to see dolphins you might see some being harrased by lots of boats, so unless it is your life must do, you will be disappointed.

Schöner dunkler Strand. Müll ist zwar da, aber nicht unangenehm viel. Im Juli kann man hier gut den Sonnenuntergang angucken. Zur Zeit extrem wenig Touristen hier. Schön, dass es leer ist, aber man wird von jeeeedem Einheimischen angesprochen, weil die einem was verkaufen wollen. Viel Leerstand & zum Teil sehr runtergekommen. Wenn man nicht eine super Unterkunft hat, reichen hier 2-3 Tage auf jeden Fall aus.
Dua kali mengunjungi tempat ini dan ga pernah bosan. Tiket masuknya pun masih sangat terjangkau.

Pantai dipatok 10.000 untuk parkir mobil.
Begitu mobil masuk area parkir langsung banyak mata mengintai. Baru turun mobil ditunggu oleh orang-orang yang langsung menawarkan lihat lumba-lumba dan barang jualan. Pantainya sendiri tidak cukup bagus.
Saya paling benci diganggu ketika ingin sight-seeing bersama keluarga.

Quiet beach but not with white or golden sand. There are a lot of shops and food places around if you are looking to relax on the beach. Swimming in the sea wasn’t best experience as the water was grey on the day we went.
Pantai pasir hitam kebanggaan masyarakat Singaraja. Bagus cukup bersih tetapi kurang penataan. Toko toko cendera mata kurang tertata rapi. Tanaman bunga sangat sedikit. Harus di tata ulang.
Nice view but too many hawkers trying to get you to see their dolphins and selling Junk

Tempatnya lihat lumba lumba tp bila mau ke sini harus bener bener pagi jam 6 sudah ready di sini bila tidak ya kita hanya bisa  scotling melihat terumbu karang dan ikan ikan bermacam warna. Luar biasa mantap.

Kalau anda selepas penyeberangan Ketapang Gilimanuk lewat Bali Utara maka bisa singgah di Pantai ini
Teman traveler bisa sewa perahu untuk melihat kumpulan lumba² ditengah laut. Di pinggir pantai juga ada resto tempat makan yang bisa di singgahi
Waktu paling tepat untuk melihat lumba lumba antara pukul 06.00-09.00 pagi.
Kalau siang hari biasanya agak susah melihat kumpulan lumba lumba jadi harus menyeberang agak ke tengah laut

First, it's a bit 'empty' compare to the beaches down south (looking at Kuta, Canggu etc) . Well, also because we arrived really early in the morning, bcoz we went from Denpasar in the middle of the night.

Then we rented a boat to see the dolphins! Yess, dolphin sightings is the main attraction here! It's better to get early, as the morning view was just amazing. Look at the sky! The mountainous background add more dramatic effect here. Lol. The air was a bit chill though.

There will be many boats just like us, searching for dolphins. If one saw it, every boats will race towards it. Quite fun!

Destinasi wisata yg bagus  view nya...ada tenant es krim yg enak  jg disitu
Kalau mau lihat dolphin juga snorkeling di Lovina and berenang sama dolphin tolong hubungi saya +6281338490820
Beautiful beach, not to crowded
Lovina is synonymous to Dolphins and Tranquility. Always come here to have break from everything that the bustling Seminyak, Kuta and Ubud offers.

We booked a dolphin tour with Edi Popeye (WhatsApp: +6285237477172) and we highly recommend going with him and his team. They go slightly later than the other boats, do not chase the dolphins, and they gave us the opportunity to swim with them using the swings on the boat. We also did some snorkeling on the reef on the way back! And the package was only 300k per person. That was a great experience while respecting the animals!

Сам пляж хороший, есть где погулять и на что посмотреть. Но мне очень не понравилось отношение местных туристов к чистоте. Семья ужинает у статуи дельфина, тут же оставляет контейнеры от еды и уходит. Мусор везде, куда ни глянь.
Be careful with snakes in the sea. They looks poisonous.

Located in North Bali, famous with the dolphins, Black/Grey sand, the air temperature is a bit hot during the day.  That's a little characteristic of Lovina Beach. But this place is very quiet and safe for vacation. Very easy to get all kinds of food, especially seafood as my favorite, there are many choices ranging from salads, fish soup, fish satay, grilled fish, fish peppers, and other various seafood dishes. Everyone I met was friendly. For me the most important thing of all is that the standard of cleanliness here needs to be appreciated because it makes us feel comfortable.
Sangat seruu banget anak" Sangat bergembira dan antusias sekali lihat lumba", nyam dan ramah yng punya prahu.
Cari lumba2 pagi2.. kjar2an sm kapal pengunjung lain biar lihat dr dekat...jdnya lumba2nya lari..
Nice, lovin it

Bukan sekedar tempat wisata pantai dengan pemandangan alamnya yang eksotis khas Bali.

Pantai lovina adalah tempat yang menawarkan pengalaman yang takkan terlupakan khususnya bagi anak dan keluarga terutama untuk momen melihat secara langsung dengan jarak sedekat-dekatnya fauna ikan lumba-lumba liar berkeliaran bebas di alam, rumah sebenarnya. Bukan di tempat sempit yang begitu menyiksa. juga pengalaman snorkling seperti pada umumnya di taman laut.

Namun saran saya, sebaiknya sebelum kesini cari kontak pic untuk sewa perahu. Karena harus datang lebih dini hari untuk bisa dapat sewa perahu on the spot...pengalaman saya, paling telat agar dapat momen lumba-lumba keluar mencari makan adalah perahu berangkat jam 06.15 WITA. namun begitu jangan khawatir, penduduk sekitar sangat welcome juga helpful..

sebagai acuan harga per orang di Mei 2022 kmrn, Tarif perahu saja per orang adalah kisaran Rp.75-100rb, Tarif perahu + sewa kacamata utk snorkling kisaran Rp.125 - 175rb.

semoga bermanfaat dan jaya selalu Pariwisata  Bali dan Pariwisata Indonesia..
Pantai yang terkenal di buleleng, terkenal dengan wisata melihat lumba-lumba ke tengah laut

Well-worth the 2hrs drive from Ubud to come here for sunrise dolphin watching! ✨ Seeing them up close was such a magical experienceand I can't believe it cost less than $10sgd?! (Booked via Klook). If you want to support the boat driver directly, you can WhatsApp Gede at +62 813 3729 7472. Meet-up was 6am near Lovina Beach. Sunrise dolphin watching only cost $62,000idr and it's $70,000idr with snorkelling. Don't forget to tip the boat driver! It means a lot to them coming out of the pandemic

Tour gedaan om dolfijnen te spotten en mee te zwemmen. Super gave ervaring!!

Nice black sand beach, get lot of food close to it. Very shallow and coral can be seen without diving inside the water. Saw dolphins, but was aghast the way the dolphins are chased in boats for a better view.
Tempat rekreasi keluarga dengan pemandangan alam pantai yang indah di Utara Bali.

It’s a beach and not much more. Not particularly interesting.

Not inviting for swimming and a lot of garbage.

Plenty of small tour boats and people who try to sell you dolphin tours.
Sisi lain dari pulau Bali, sebuah pantai yang indah, habitat alami lumba-lumba

Hati2 deh di lovina,orang bali pada gak bener semenjak pandemi udh gk kyk dulu. berubah drastis.semenjak pandemi apa2 diduitin. sebenarnya gak bisa salahin lovina jg.org bali yg bawa tamu juga curang masa dibilang lumba2 ada siang. Saya saranin pinter2 pilih guide di Bali mereka sudah sengkongkol dgn orang pantai. masa jam 12 siang dibilang ada lumba2. pemerintah harus tindak langsung. nama bali bs jelek.udh gitu dijaminin lagi.
Bagi yg mau sewa perahu dan tdk ada kenalan, bisa kesini, karena bakal banyak yang menawarkan jasa perahu untuk lihat lumba2. Tempat lumayan bersih dan penduduknya ramah2

ada tempat sholat deket pantai, bisa subuh di situ sebelum dolphin tour.

Bersih,nyaman,& aman
you know, it's a cool place to swim with dolphins and see the plankton when it's still dark in the water. Feeling like in "Star Wars" when you fly in the outer space

Dikenakan hanya biaya parkir 5k/mobil. Utk motor kurang tau. Pantainya bersih. Di sini lebih menawarkan wisata di tengah lautnya utk melihat taman laut, kasih makan ikan, melihat lumba². Namun utk lumba² hanya bisa di pagi hari. Harga sewa 150k/perahu isi 5 org. Tempatnya lumayan sejuk karena banyak pepohonan. Penjual makanannya juga relatif murah.

Tempatnya bagus. Saran dari saya:
1. Jalan/aspal dekat pintu masuk/gapur tolong diperbaiki
2. Bangunan bagian barat setelah melewati gapur, terlihat terbengkalai, jadi tolong dibersikan atau dikondisokan supaya tidak terlihat terbengkalai
Terima kasih.
Suasana sgt nyaman bgt

My advice, if you want to visit Lovina Beach from the south of Bali, DON'T FOLLOW the route from Google Maps! You will be directed to use a small and steep road. From my experience, my car brakes was overheat when going down that road. Choose the Gitgit highway, even though the distance is longer, the road is safer.
tempat yg bagus untuk lihat sunset tapi kurang tempat sampah jadi sampah berserakan

Nice black sand (more like Grey) Beach. It's the main tourist attraction in lovina.

From here you can enjoy sundowner while enjoying beautiful sunsets, book a boat trip to the famous lovina dolphins, or go snorkeling at the nearby reefs.

The reefs are quite damaged so nothing too special compared to some of the other gems in Indonesia.

Dolphins can also be a bit of a let down if the conditions aren't great or too many boats are there. It ends up being a game of cat and mouse where boats frantically race to the dolphins, they get scared and dive under, and it starts again.

Was a bit let down about the latter, but still a nice experience to see these majestic creatures. Just wish it could be handled with less stress to the animals.

I am regretting and ashamed for attending a dolphin watching, I should have done some research what it is.
If you love animals and it’s the first time you heard  about the thing,don’t make a mistake like me.
It’s not dolphin “watching”, it’s more like “chasing” or “abusing”.
Countless boats are gathering at a point, and all the boats moving point to point with really high speed when someone found dolphins. Many boats were running over the pod of dolphins.
I immediately noticed my mistake and ask my boat to go back. You know what my boat man said at that time??He said “it’s okay,dolphins likes to be chased “
If this city wants to continue the tourism as “city of dolphins “, they need to be educated. Or maybe experiencing how it feels like to be chased around when they are eating.
Absolutely disgusted.

Пляж чистый, тины почти нет. Песок чёрный-все лав. Туристов днём нет, многие приходят на закат. Дети купались под мостом, смотрели мальков. Много местных торговцев, очень навязчивые, но их можно понять, они от бедности себя так ведут, мне жалко их много добрых собачек,если будет у вас возможность в пепито можно купить угощения им, мы брали корм и лапки(стоят копейки), зато потом охраняли наши вещиблагодарные.
Ездили на лодке встречать закат, а утром смотрели дельфинов и сноркелинг. Отдали, закат за шестерых 200К, а дельфины и сноркелинг 600К так же за 6х.
Мне очень понравилось смотреть на дельфинов, это целое приключение чтоб поймать их, у нас был бомбезный гид все делал четко и мы почти почти всегда были первые у стаи дельфинов.

Сноркелинг это отдельная любовь в моем сердце, после этих эмоций, записалась на обучение дайвингом .

Pantai yang sangat terkenal di kawasan Bali Utara (Buleleng). Kalau datang sangat pagi dapat melihat lumba-lumba dengan menyewa boat.
Kebersihan dan keamanan pantai terjaga dengan cukup baik.

Ombak di bibir pantai tidak begitu keras dan besar.

Lovina atau sering juga disebut Pantai Lovina merupakan salah satu kawasan wisata laut yang terdapat di bagian utara Pulau Bali. Pantai yang terletak di Lovina di daerah Bali Utara ini memang menarik karena masih relatif alami. Salah satu keunikan di pantai ini adalah Anda bisa menyaksikan aksi lumba-lumba liar yang terdapat di laut.

Lovina terletak di Bali Utara di pesisir utara Pulau Bali tepatnya sekitar 10 km arah barat Singaraja. Pantai Lovina berada di Desa Kalibukbuk, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali. Karena itu, kadang orang menyebutnya sebagai kawasan wisata Kalibukbuk.

Pantai Lovina yang berpasir hitam ini masih alami sehingga menarik dikunjungi. Yang menarik di Pantai Lovina adalah perjalanan ke tengah laut di perairan Lovina. Anda dapat menjumpai lumba-lumba di perairan Lovina yang terletak sekitar 1 kilometer dari bibir pantai. Laut Bali yang berada di perairan Lovina relatif tenang sehingga Anda bisa berwisata di laut tersebut dengan menggunakan perahu nelayan.

Kawasan Lovina terkenal terkenal sebagai tempat untuk menyaksikan pertunjukkan lumba-lumba liar. Anda dapat langsung menyaksikan tingkah laku yang lucu dan bersahabat dari lumba-lumba langsung di tengah laut. Tentu ini akan menjadi pengalaman liburan yang menarik untuk Anda. Di kawasan Lovina terdapat ratusan ekor lumba-lumba.

Untuk bisa melihat atraksi lumba-lumba liar, Anda harus berangkat pagi sekali saat matahari akan terbit. Mengapa? Karena lumba-lumba di kawasan ini hanya muncul antara pukul 6 pagi hingga 8 pagi. Pada jam itu, puluhan lumba-lumba akan beratraksi secara alami menunjukkan kegiatan mereka. Ada yang sekadar berenang di permukaan air, ada juga yang melompat-lompat. Tentu hal ini akan membuat takjub akan keindahan binatang laut berwarna hitam tersebut.

Biasanya para wisatawan sudah berkumpul di pantai sekitar pukul 5.30 WITA untuk berangkat ke tengah laut. Anda bisa menyewa perahu nelayan yang memang disediakan untuk perjalanan tersebut. Perjalanan dimulai dengan menggunakan perahu kecil yang hanya bisa mengangkut maksimal 4 orang selain sang nelayan. Perahu akan membawa Anda sekitar satu hingga dua kilometer ke arah tengah laut ke tempat biasanya lumba-lumba akan muncul.

Selama perjalanan, Anda bisa melihat-lihat pemandangan laut yang luas dan seraya perahu menjauhi daratan, Anda bisa melihat daratan Lovina dari kejauhan seperti siluet. Setelah sampai di tengah laut, sang nelayan akan menyusuri ke tempat biasanya lumba-lumba akan muncul. Dan apabila ada sekelompok lumba-lumba yang melompat, sang nelayan akan memberitahu perahu-perahu lain di sekitarnya sehingga perahu-perahu tersebut akan menambah kecepatan untuk mengejar sekelompok lumba-lumba itu.

Tentu anda dapat merekam sewaktu lumba-lumba tersebut berlompatan di tengah laut. Ada juga para wisatawan yang tidak bisa melihat lumba-lumba tersebut. Hal ini tergantung dari faktor alam juga seperti pasangnya air laut, arah angin, dan tentu saja keberuntungan anda untuk dapat melihat lumba-lumba liar tersebut. "Pengejaran" ini akan berlangsung kira-kira 3 jam. Namun, apabila Anda sudah merasa mual karena mabuk laut Anda tidak perlu ragu ragu untuk memberitahu sang nelayan untuk kembali ke daratan.

Seraya perjalanan kembali ke daratan, Anda bisa menikmati pemandangan sepanjang pantai Lovina dengan jelas karena matahari sudah bersinar dengan terangnya. Anda juga dapat menikmati wisata taman laut di perairan Lovina.

Pantai Lovina tentu bisa menjadi tujuan wisata Anda. Banyak hal menarik yang bisa Anda temui di sini seperti melihat pertunjukkan lumba-lumba liar di tengah laut, maupun taman laut dengan beragam ikan hias. Apalagi jika Anda sedang mengunjungi kawasan Singaraja, maka sempatkan diri Anda mampir ke Lovina dan menginap setidaknya satu hari di sana untuk menyaksikkan atraksi lumba-lumba pada pagi-pagi sekali.

Lovina is a much slower pace than the southern part of Bali still with lots to do. Walking along this beach is particularly beautiful early in the morning or in the evening. It is quite a long beach and if you watch for low tide you can wander for miles if you don't mind a bit of wading and climbing. The morning dolphin tours that go out from here are very popular  so lots of people and boats but still a delightful outing.

Secara etimologi Lovina memiliki dua arti. Pertama, Love= cinta, INA= akronim dari Indonesia , jadi arti pertama Lovina adalah Cinta Indonesia. Kedua, Love= cinta, INA=induk/ibu (dalam Bahasa Bali kata ina artinya induk), jadi dapat disimpulkan arti kedua Lovina adalah cinta pada ibu (ibu pertiwi). Lovina salah satu kawasan wisata di Kabupaten Buleleng dengan pantai yang ombaknya relatif tenang, aktivitas yang bisa dilakukan adalah wisata bahari seperti snorkeling dan melihan rombongan lumba-lumba saat dini hari sembari melihat matahari terbit. Harga untuk melihat lumba-lumba kurang lebih 75 ribu rupiah (yang penting pintar nawar) per orang untuk wisatawan domestik.

Обязательно к посещению. Огромные стаи дельфинов, плывущих рядом с лодкой. Есть возможность поплавать в маске в открытом море и увидеть их танец под водой, услышать, как они переговариваются друг с другом. Прозрачная, чистая и теплая вода. Невероятные эмоции. Не отказывайтесь от снорклинга. Коралловые рифы и многообразие ярких рыбок по своей красоте ничем не уступают Красному морю в Египте. Все это удовольствие длится 4-5 часов и стоит 200000 Rp (около 1000 рублей).

Les meilleures plages (Dream Beach, etc...) que j'ai vu pour le moment (Indonésie et Thaïlande comprise). Les plus belles plongées en snorkeling (tortues, raies manta et vie sous marine) grâce à un super captain.

Devil's tear is a must visit place, it's right next to the dream beach. They have an entry ticket, but it is seriously worth it - they have a proper park, you might see kids playing skateboarding outside and some joggers inside. Go during the sunset time! The sky was so vibrant. It's pretty big, they have good sitting area as well, can bring some food and relax, watching the waves hits the rocks and mist spreading around.

The snorkeling trip was great! We saw corals, fishes, turtles - weren't lucky enough to see manta rays though.

Here the shops have much better and unique collection compared to the streets of bali, might be little bit more expensive but they give you good bargain as well.

There aren't any pure veg restaurants though, given it's a small island.

Can spend a day or two max. We later rented scooters and went to ceningan, covered the whole island in just 4hrs, should definitely do this if you are staying in lembongan. On the last peak point of the island, there a nice cafe from there you can watch surfers - it's good place to chill nice music and food also.

Une journée inoubliable grâce à Secretoo et notre guide ! L’organisation était au top et tout s’est déroulé sans stress. Notre guide Momol était vraiment adorable et très prévenant : il s’est assuré que chacun profite de l’expérience, même quand la houle et le courant étaient un peu présents à Manta Bay.

Nager aux côtés des majestueuses raies mantas restera un souvenir magique. Nous avons aussi découvert Crystal Bay avec ses tortues et poissons tropicaux, puis Mangrove Point, un vrai aquarium naturel. Le déjeuner les pieds dans le sable et les superbes photos GoPro reçues directement sur notre téléphone ont parfaitement conclu cette journée.

Merci à Secretoo et à notre guide pour cette excursion exceptionnelle que nous recommandons sans hésiter !

Cette journée à Nusa Lembongan avec Captain Arya restera un souvenir inoubliable ! On est partis dès 7h30 du matin, ce qui change tout : on a évité la foule et surtout tous les autres bateaux. Résultat : les spots étaient beaucoup plus calmes et on a vraiment pu profiter de chaque moment.

On a commencé tranquillement par un petit tour en pirogue dans la mangrove. C’était super paisible, entourés de nature, parfait pour se mettre dans l’ambiance avant le snorkeling. Ensuite, place aux trois spots magiques : Manta Bay (voir ces raies manta de si près, c’est impressionnant !), Turtle Point pour nager avec les tortues, et enfin Gamat Bay, un récif coloré plein de poissons tropicaux. Franchement, on en a pris plein les yeux.

Après toutes ces émotions, on a fini les pieds dans le sable avec un repas délicieux au bord de la plage. Le cadre était parfait : la mer devant nous, une bonne assiette, et Captain Arya toujours souriant et aux petits soins.

On a trouvé Arya sur Secretoo et tout était super fluide, tout compris, zéro prise de tête. On a juste eu à profiter, et clairement, c’était un vrai coup de cœur .

Un isola  fronte Bali, che fa parte delle Nusa Islands.Si arriva in 40 minuti con le barche veloci, partendo da Bali. Relativamente tranquilla, si trovano delle belle spiagge con sabbia dorata e tipici Huts per alloggiare. Traffico stradale c'è, soprattutto di motorini, che consiglio di noleggiare per spostarsi se desiderate andare alla scoperta delle spiagge, in quanto andare a piedi può risultare stancante visto che il  sole è forte e le distanze da percorrere da una parte del isola al altra,a piedi sono impegnative. Ci sono anche i taxi se il motorino non è il vostro mezzo preferito. Se vi piace tranquillità suggerisco di cercare un alloggio vicino Mushroom bay. Invece per chi ama stare in centro del movimento più turistico, Jungutbatu beach può essere una buona soluzione. Un'altra isola Ceningan, più piccola è collegata con Nusa Lembongan da un ponte giallo sospeso, percorribile a piedi o in moto. L'isola non ha spiagge, piuttosto roccie e scogliere alte, bellissime viste sul oceano è punti dove fare le foto spettacolari. Oltre le spiagge, Nusa Lembongan offre i tour nelle mangrovie, snorkeling,oppure tour a Nusa Penida, fare il bagno con le mante....tutto sommato,merita visitarla, tre giorni possono essere sufficienti.

Nusa Lembongan is a one-of-a-kind island experience. It is worth visiting Nusa Lembongan to explore not only one but two stunning islands! The neighbouring Nusa Ceningan is accessible via a charming yellow bridge, which is a popular Instagrammable location in Bali. The most common way for people to get between Nusa Lembongan and Bali is by fast boat. The distance is about 15 kilometres between Bali and Nusa Lembongan across a passage of water known as the Badung Strait. The fast boats typically take 30-40 minutes to do the crossing, depending on the prevailing conditions. COMMON QUESTION - how long should I spend on Nusa Lembongan? Once on the island, most people would spend 3 or 4 nights on Nusa Lembongan for their first trip, though we typically find on return trips guests spend 5-7 nights on the island or even skip Bali entirely and spend their whole holiday on Nusa Lembongan! Nusa Penida demands a bit more commitment as it involves a longer boat ride, approximately 45 minutes, from Bali. On the other hand, Lembongan, being closer, offers a shorter journey of around 30 minutes from Bali – making it ideal for those planning a quick day-trip from the mainland. The reality is that Nusa Lembongan is more expensive than Bali. Everything on the island arrives via the local ferry and is hand carried off at the beach. Expect prices to be higher than in Bali and locals less willing to bargain.

We left the island within 24 hours of arriving (while we planned 3 days), totally disappointed due to the rubbish everywhere, garbage bags in between houses on the streets half opened and eaten by animals, there are flies everywhere. Tried to have a lunch on the beach in the central north-west area but it is not nice with 50 flies on your dish fighting for the food. I would recommend against visiting this island unless people start cleaning or becoming more conscious about leaving their trash everywhere. I also did not like the people we met were trying to squeeze as much money out of you, did not feel friendliness at all.. 100k for a 800m taxi ride is excessive.

Great place to visit. Staying at 3 monkeys on the island. Great little hotel and bar with good food. Lots to do and explore here. Great surfing, snorkelling  and diving.  If you are in Bali it is worth the 45 minute ferry to come here and explore real paradise .

I have been lucky of visiting (and sometimes even lived) in many places and countries in my life. This island is the very first place that I visited that I didn't like at all, and even I left it before planned, something that I have never done before.
IT IS A PLACE FOR INSTAGRAM. The picture is beautiful, nothing else.
In most of the beaches you can't swim, mushroom Bay is the best one but you have to tolerate all the boats, ropes and gasoline smell (not something of my pleasure).
To go around you need a scooter, but if an accident happen you are on the mercy of God (and I'm not religious). I've been told that there's no police in the island (unconfirmed information). As they rent the scooters to tourist that don't know who to drive, it is bit unsafe.
I don't recommend this island to anyone, specially if your purpose is beach life. There are much better places in Bali to enjoy a real beach, with a real swim in the ocean.

Une merveilleuse île au calme désuet, qui vit au rythme lent de ses cultivateurs d'algue se déplaçant lentement sur leurs embarcations colorées .

It’s a nice island with expensive transport fees. Bicycle renting 60k if you want save cost. 100k taxi fee regardless the distance. One local said the cost is high due to the payment to the middlemen on transporting foods and petrol into the island. Sounds like a corruption to me.
Went to their Penida festival 2024. We had to find out from our Indonesian friends about the scheduled programme. Didn’t stay for long at the location because of lacking foods and drinks. Basically only one stall selling rice and one stall selling sausages etc. and … only one stall selling juices or smoothies. Funny thing was it’s out of order. Because there wasn’t any ice in its stock.
What do you call a festival when there isn’t enough food/drink. I heard the locals enjoyed it perhaps because they ate before they went.

Used to be nice island back in 2015. However, due to the increasing number of tourists. The island is no longer nice and full of rubbish.

Hope the authority and tourists can keep this beautiful island clean.

This beautiful island located in the south of Bali promises endless natural pleasures. Starting from snorkeling, fishing, surfing, boating around the mangrove forest, driving around the island by motorbike and many other fun activities. Almost all the residents there are very friendly and most of them cultivate seaweed. Next to Nusa Ceningan, only by crossing The Yellow Bridge we will get there.

Heerlijk eiland. Veel beter dan het drukke Nusa Penida. Mooie stranden, aardige mensen, goed te bereiden met scooter. Leuke restaurantjes. Fantastische Mantarays tour geboekt bij Ceningan Paradise Adventures. De beste om bij te boeken.

A very pretty island with two good beaches at Mushroom Bay and Jungutbatu Beach and lesser ones at Pantai Mahagiri and Secret Beach. The island is pretty small and good for walking around, though the main road between the Mangrove Forest at one end and Mushroom Bay at the other is rather hazardous because of constant traffic and tourists driving their scooters a bit wildly. There's much to see and do on the island - from water scooters, diving to sightseeing. You can do it on foot, if you like walking and trekking, but be very wary of the traffic.

Lembongan Island is located southeast of Bali. The island gets its name from the deep blue waters that surround it (Google) . Away from the hustle and bustle of Bali, Lembongan Island offers a quiet, beautiful bay and a peaceful countryside. Enjoy a day at the beach while you lounge in one of the many beach chairs. You can also visit the cafes, restaurants, and bars to enjoy fine food and drink. It's a completely relaxing destination.

Nachdem wir eine tolle Zeit in Bali, Ubud hatten, haben wir 3 Tage in Nusa Lembongan und Nusa Ceningan geplant. Leider kann ich die positiven Bewertungen nicht nachvollziehen. Die Insel ist zugemüllt und die Natur viel trockener als auf Bali und nicht besonders spektakulär. Die Bewohner:innen scheinen von den reichen Touris die Nase voll zu haben. Das schlechte Gewissen lässt einen nicht los, wenn man die Armut hier sieht... und alles scheint hier irgendwie unverhältnismäßig: für eine einfache kurze Taxifahrt zahlst du locker 10€. Das Essen ist wiederum wahnsinnig günstig. Man weiß nicht so recht woran man ist.

Schön sind die hohen Aussichtspunkte der Insel, aber insgesamt überhaupt nicht zu empfehlen. Lieber auf Bali bleiben.

Great place to go to if you want to escape the long queues for a nice view like you have to do at Nusa Penida. You have multiple beautiful sunset spots, it is not that touristy, the beaches are nice and snorkelling spots are good as wel. During snorkelling you can spot nice coral, manta rays, dolphins, sea turtles and very colourful fish.
I advice you to rent a scooter bike to get around since there is not Gojek or Grab on this island, but watch out for the cracks in the road.
Nice island. Very narrow roads need to becareful when you walk or ride scooter. Bimo driver is crazy.

Deutsch
Als Tagestour aus Bali her ist gut zum Schnorcheln geeignet. Sonnenuntergang ist herrlich zu beobachten. Die selbe Sonne gibt es aber auch woanders.
Für längere Aufenthalte ist die Insel Infrastruktur, die es nicht gibt, nicht geeignet. Es stinkt nach Müll, es ist sehr schmutzig (Fliegen als Indikator), alles extrem überteuert, die Strände sind von sehr vielen Hunden belagert, die jeden anknurren, der vorbeiläuft.
Man muss es mögen können. Wir konnten leider nicht. Schlechteste Spot in Indonesien.

Bahasa
Sebagai perjalanan sehari dari Bali sangat baik untuk snorkeling. Matahari terbenam sangat indah untuk dilihat. Namun, matahari yang sama juga dapat dilihat di tempat lain.
Untuk masa tinggal yang lebih lama, infrastruktur pulau, yang tidak ada, tidak cocok. Baunya busuk, sangat kotor (lalat sebagai indikator), semuanya sangat mahal, pantai-pantainya dikepung oleh banyak anjing yang menggeram pada semua orang yang lewat.
Anda harus bisa menyukainya. Sayangnya kami tidak bisa. Tempat terburuk di Indonesia.

English
As a day trip from Bali is good for snorkeling. Sunset is wonderful to watch. However, the same sun is also available elsewhere.
For longer stays, the island infrastructure, which does not exist, is not suitable. It stinks of garbage, it is very dirty (flies as an indicator), everything extremely overpriced, the beaches are besieged by very many dogs that growl at everyone who walks by.
You have to be able to like it. Unfortunately we could not. Worst spot in Indonesia.

Very disorganized little island (just a bit worse than Bali). They do not know how to make business and to promote tourism and the only objective is to rip you off while they smile at you.
80 AUD to take you around 7 km ...or 60 AUD...depending on how bad you need.
60 dollars to rent a motorcycle, 100 AUD or a million IRD) for an electric buggy.

They claim to be poor and they charge even  more than Australia. I will never go back. The value for money is not there. VERY UNPLEASANT STAY.

Also consider road safety and boat safety and amenities which do not exist. I highly discourage to go with kids. Indonesia first and last time.

Nusa Lembongan
Una de las islas más visitadas de las Nusas, ya que tiene muchas cosas para hacer. Tiene playas muy bonitas, como Mushroom Bay y Dream Beach, los acantilados de Devil's Tears (olas que estallan contra las rocas conocidas como lágrimas del diablo), esnórquel con manta rayas (cuando es temporada), tortugas, coral y muchos peces de colores. Los tours de esnórquel son espectaculares: te dejan en unas corrientes marinas y te sigen con una barca, verás un montón de coral y peces sin apenas tener que nadar. La isla es muy pequeña y se puede recorrer fácilmente con moto, que es casi imprescindible y podrás alquilar con facilidad.

Petite île faite pour flâner sur la plage et découvrir une vie de grand village.

People in here (more than 80% of the population that is working in the tourism) are just desperately looking for money. They see the foreigners as an atm not as humans. One of the worst places I’ve ever visited in my life. It’s a very expensive island compared to Gili Air for example, and what they have is not even special as Gili Air is.

Food is under the average regarding quality and cleanliness and the reviews of the restaurants are totally fake! 4,8 stars for restaurants that have very dirty kitchens and the food is average.
Many shops have crazy high prices, highest than any other shops in the world sometimes (simple very simple crackers at 40k).

I’ve traveled the globe and this island is the most disappointing place I’ve ever been, never again coming back here.
